items.title: Sr. Demand Generation Manager
items.content:
Sr. Demand Generation Manager

Company: TaxJar

TaxJar is the leading technology solution for busy eCommerce sellers to manage sales tax and is trusted by more than 10,000 businesses. Our mission is is to make eCommerce easier for everyone. 

OUR CORE VALUES

  • We do the right thing for our customers.
  • We're a team, built on trust.
  • We're proud to be remote.
  • We're in control of our own destiny.

TaxJar’s remote-only team of 40 people is growing quickly. Our team has an immediate full-time opening for an enthusiastic, highly-experienced, Senior Demand Generation Manager.

OUR TEAMS MISSION

The TaxJar marketing team’s mission is clear: get more eCommerce businesses to experience TaxJar to manage their sales tax reporting, filing and calculations. Our team demonstrates the tremendous value in cost and time-savings in choosing to fully automated solution like TaxJar for their sales tax needs. 

The marketing team’s goal is to maximize the number of qualified customers that begin our free trial and ensure the highest percentage of those folks end up as a customers. We work closely every day alongside sales, success, development, and user experience teams in order to deliver on these goals.

The Senior Demand Generation Manager is fanatical about finding and engaging our target audiences, generating qualified sales leads, and ultimately producing revenue opportunities for the TaxJar sales team to close.

AS A SR. DEMAND GENERATION MANAGER AT TAXJAR YOU WILL

  • Develop and communicate a strategic plan. Own the research, development, implementation, and success of multi-channel lead generation programs in order to meet lead, prospect, and ultimately, revenue goals.
  • Define the right tactics for reaching target markets, build a sales pipeline of qualified prospects, develop KPI’s, and measure results of activities on a regular and ongoing basis.
  • Be responsible for creating and implementing marketing plans that drive both inbound and outbound demand generation, messaging, and define our market/vertical segmentation.
  • Identify trends to nurture prospects and inform content development from data.
  • Organize and launch a best-in-class event marketing plan that ties closed won TaxJar Plus event activities back to marketing dollars.
  • Bring a creative and open mind to the team and be ready to hit the ground running.
  • Assist the sales and design teams in developing campaign-specific content necessary to close business
  • Must have a proven track record for driving lead generation and building a qualified pipeline for sales.
  • Must be willing to travel and attend in-person trade-shows and live events with customers.

This is a key strategic marketing role and requires a self-starter with strong experience in executing demand generation projects and has a deep understanding of eCommerce business needs. You don't wait for others to tell you what to do—you figure things out on your own. You ask questions. You get clarity. You do what's best for the customer.

REQUIREMENTS

  • Extensive experience with SEO, SEM, Google AdWords, Facebook (FBX), Doubleclick Bid Manager (DBM), Amazon Media Group (AMG), Quora Ads, etc
  • Well-versed in marketing automation tools and analytics platforms (Marketo, Eloqua, Pardot, Drift, Grow, Drip, VWO, Groove, Google Analytics, HotJar, Hootsuite, Woopra)
  • Ability to understand how tools connect and how to leverage platforms to get our tools to talk to each other (Segment, Zapier)
  • Agile, humble, trustworthy, and a team player
  • Rapid learner who thrives in a fast-paced and demanding environment
  • Passion for marketing simple and intuitive products that solve complex problems in eCommerce
  • Excel at communicating with the team remotely (Basecamp, chat, zoom, email, etc)
  • Proficient in Microsoft Office/Google Docs (Pivot tables, vlookups, etc)
  • Strong design capability a bonus (Canva, or Adobe CS).
  • This is not an entry level position. You’re an experienced demand generation marketer of 5+ years and are open to experimenting in new and creative ways of attracting potential new customers to try TaxJar.

YOU'LL BE A GREAT FIT FOR OUR TEAM IF YOU

  • Only want to work remotely
  • Are a PRO at communicating and collaboration
  • Highly value working with people you like and respect
  • Are accountable
  • Are confident in your skills and a solid team player (We’re peers here, no egos please) but also comfortable working asynchronously
  • Hungry to play an impactful role and not afraid to fail

We’re a happy team and we all really love what we do. We've created a space where high-achievers can succeed, but are also safe to fail. We're profitable and focused on growing TaxJar sustainably. We're always learning how to make TaxJar the best place to work for all of us, and not just another tech startup. We’re always looking for an amazing new teammates to come share in the excitement of solving real-world problems with technology.

BENEFITS

  • Excellent health, vision and dental benefits
  • Flexible vacation policy (we’ll actually pay you $500 a year to take time off!)
  • $1,000 in professional development credit
  • Home office stipend
  • Equity in a profitable company 
  • 2x year all-company in person retreats (fully paid for by us of course)
  • Brand new Macbook computer 
  • Mandatory Birthday holiday!
  • 12 week paid maternity/ 6 week paid paternity leave
  • Monthly perks reimbursement for things like Netflix, Amazon Prime, your gym membership, home internet and more.

We offer all of our employees amazing benefits. Visit www.TaxJar.com/jobs for a full list of our benefits and to learn more about how we work and what we stand for.

If you're not the perfect fit for this position, but you know someone who is, we'll pay you $1,000 if you refer us to the person we hire.

    How to apply:
    Apply here: taxjar.workable.com/jobs/768009/candidates/new. Please treat this as your first interview. We receive lots of resumes, so here's your chance to stand out from the crowd.

items.content:
Project Leader, Sr Project Leader at PAREXEL

Remote

Location: USA – Any Region – Home Based

46268BR

Job Description:

PAREXEL currently has excellent opportunities for Project Leaders / Senior Project Leaders ( Project Managers), and Project Directors with a background in leading clinical trials ( Phase I and II) in Oncology. These Regionally Home Based positions are part of our growing Early Product Development team and unlike most traditional Phase I projects, these trials are much larger across multiple sites and require prior large project or global project experience. The individuals selected for these roles will provide leadership to project teams and manage the day to day operations of domestic and international clinical projects. They will strive to achieve operational excellence through on time delivery that is within budget and to the highest quality with the goal to exceed client expectations. In addition to the above duties, those selected for the Project Director role could lead more complex domestic and global programs. In addition they will have functional management responsibilities (mentoring/training) for a group of Project Leaders and Senior Project Leaders. They will actively participate in the proposal development teams and take the lead in bid defenses.

Qualifications:
Successful candidates must at minimum, possess an undergraduate degree in a clinical or health related field: advanced degree preferred, along with a minimum, at the Senior Project Leader level of 4+ years’ experience working as a Project Manager within a CRO (preferred), Biotech or Pharma. More years of experience will be required at the Project Director level. These positions also require experience in project scheduling, managing resources and budgets and coordinating team activities, as well as experience with the full clinical development process through regulatory submissions. This position requires candidates to be detailed-oriented, computer proficient in a Windows environment and possess superior interpersonal and organizational skills. The Project Director position will also require demonstrated functional line management experience leading and developing a team of direct reports. PAREXEL offers a pleasant working environment and outstanding career opportunities

Apply for job

items.content:
Community Development Manager

Various
Anywhere
Company: Wikimedia Foundation
Full Time

Overview

The Wikimedia Foundation is looking for a collaborative and results-oriented Manager of Community Development to support core volunteer community development initiatives such as mentoring, face-to-face trainings and workshops (e.g. “learning days” and sessions at regional events), and remote learning modules. We are seeking someone who understands how groups and individuals learn and build capacities and skills in different contexts and at different stages. We are seeking someone to lead efforts to assess community capacity and set achievable targets for development. We are seeking a leader for a team that will create a holistic approach to guiding our volunteer communities to learn in order to reach and grow impact towards our movement’s mission. We’re looking for a candidate who is mission motivated, an organized and effective project and people manager, an advocate for open knowledge, and excited to help build our global volunteer movement.

Responsibilities:
  • Determine a coherent vision and strategy to develop Wikimedia’s volunteer communities, at the group and individual level.
  • Create a framework for identifying, supporting, and developing volunteer leaders in the Wikimedia movement.
  • Design an approach to identify volunteer capacity needs and steps to grow potential (training, partnership, and/or funding), weaving together the expertise of your team, other Foundation teams, and community volunteer groups.
  • Consult on your approach with staff and community and review transparently and publicly on an ongoing basis to ensure that work is impactful and effective.
  • Expand your team as needed to support your vision, with an eye towards diversity, equity, inclusion and WMF values.
  • Manage, support, and collaborate with a distributed team of highly motivated staff and contractors, and collaborate regularly with colleagues in and out of the San Francisco office as well as our diverse international multicultural community of volunteers.
  • Communicate the work, goals, and outcomes of community development initiatives to internal and external audiences.
  • Participate as a member of the Community Engagement department’s lead management team in planning and resourcing department-wide objectives.

    • Requirements:
    • The capacity to teach. Familiarity with instructional design for international and/or adult audiences. Demonstrated ability to support volunteers or non-profit staff to grow as leaders.
    • The ability to collaborate. Demonstrated capacity to work collegially with others with an open and approachable working style.
    • The ability to build networks. Systems-design thinking to develop an infrastructure for coordinating strategy and services through multiple stakeholder groups. Ability to build and manage cohesive networks for collaboration across organization and greater Wikimedia community.
    • The ability to organize and lead. Demonstrated people management experience (3 or more years). Demonstrated program/project management experience with good long-term strategic implementation skills (3 or more years).
    • The ability to adapt. Comfort with innovative, experimental, iterative, bottom-up collaborative teams, especially around crowd-sourced projects which rely on volunteer engagement.
    • Familiarity with community service-focused, volunteer-based, and/or international initiatives. Commitment to inclusion and diversity. Cross-cultural sensitivity and awareness.
    • A proficient level of written and spoken English, including the ability to communicate clearly with non-native English speakers. Non-native English speakers welcome!

      • Pluses:
      • Experience working with online communities, particularly as part of the free culture movement.
      • Global perspective, with significant experience living or working internationally.
      • Fluency in languages other than English.
      • Nonprofit, NGO or INGO experience
      • Passion for or experience contributing to Wikipedia and the other Wikimedia projects.

        • **COVER LETTER REQUIRED:  Please briefly explain (2-3 paragraphs) why you are interested in WMF, what you will bring to this role, and your approach to community development. 

        The Wikimedia Foundation is… 

        …the nonprofit organization that supports Wikipedia and the other Wikimedia free knowledge projects. Our vision is a world in which every single human can freely share in the sum of all knowledge. We believe that everyone has the potential to contribute something to our shared knowledge, and that everyone should be able to access that knowledge, free of interference. We host the Wikimedia projects, build software experiences for reading, contributing, and sharing Wikimedia content, support the volunteer communities and partners who make Wikimedia possible, and advocate for policies that enable Wikimedia and free knowledge to thrive. The Wikimedia Foundation is a charitable, not-for-profit organization that relies on donations. We receive financial support from millions of individuals around the world, with an average donation of about $15. We also receive donations through institutional grants and gifts. The Wikimedia Foundation is a United States 501(c)(3) tax-exempt organization with offices in San Francisco, California, USA.

        The Wikimedia Foundation is an equal opportunity employer, and we encourage people with a diverse range of backgrounds to apply

        Benefits & Perks *
        • Fully paid medical, dental and vision coverage for employees and their eligible families (yes, fully paid premiums!)
        • The Wellness Program provides reimbursement for mind, body and soul activities such as fitness memberships, baby sitting, continuing education and much more
        • The 401(k) retirement plan offers matched contributions at 4% of annual salary
        • Flexible and generous time off – vacation, sick and volunteer days, plus 19 paid holidays – including the last week of the year.
        • Family friendly! 100% paid new parent leave for seven weeks plus an additional five weeks for pregnancy, flexible options to phase back in after leave, fully equipped lactation room.
        • For those emergency moments – long and short term disability, life insurance (2x salary) and an employee assistance program
        • Pre-tax savings plans for health care, child care, elder care, public transportation and parking expenses
        • Telecommuting and flexible work schedules available
        • Appropriate fuel for thinking and coding (aka, a pantry full of treats) and monthly massages to help staff relax
        • Great colleagues – diverse staff and contractors speaking dozens of languages from around the world, fantastic intellectual discourse, mission-driven and intensely passionate people

          • * for benefits eligible staff, benefits may vary by locationb

          More information

          WMF

          Blog

          Annual Report – 2017

          Wikimedia 2030

          To apply for this job please visit the following URL: https://boards.greenhouse.io/wikimedia/jobs/1239209 →

items.title: Director of Operations
items.content:
Director of Operations

Company: Zoomforth

See here for a full description, and application instructions: https://share.zoomforth.com/director-of-ops

Join an early-stage, profitable company serving some of the world's top brands. Work directly with our CEO and help us optimize processes and manage priorities as we scale.

Zoomforth's design software helps customers gather and arrange content into beautiful web pages online. It's like Squarespace but specifically for professional communications.

We work with some of the world's top professional services companies and agencies, and we're looking for someone to help us manage priorities and processes as we scale.

We're a remote company (with an office in SF), with about 20 talented, kind and committed individuals working across the country and world.

We're quickly gaining traction supporting companies as they adapt their communications to a digital world. And after five years, we're now profitable, and have a huge opportunity to be a go-to solution for web-native communications in the modern enterprise. Our opportunity to scale, however, will be either advanced or constrained by how we optimize the time of our current team, prioritize, and improve our processes to meet customer demand.

You'll be working across the entire company, but primarily with our CEO. This means that some decisions that have historically been made by the CEO will be yours to make. It's a tremendous opportunity for anyone who wants to learn & grow, and has the opportunity to transition into a COO role.

RESPONSIBILITIES
You’ll be doing something different every week. Your job is to determine the most important operational barriers to growth and solve for it in any given week or month. You’ll do some measure of all of the areas below:

Operations
- Design and run a hiring pipeline
- Develop communications systems and practices to strengthen a remote culture and keep the team engaged
- Support the CEO in administrative tasks and scheduling
- Help design, organize, and manage bi-annual team retreats

Project Management
- Coordinate with our design team and manage client design requests to ensure design projects are swiftly completed.

Business Development
- Lead outreach to prospective partners to begin developing a network of parter companies.

Data and Reporting
- Manage reporting across sales, customer success, and product. For example, you'll determine the most efficient way to consistently surface sales metrics to the team, ensuring that we remain focused and that we learn from our data. 

Other Sample Projects
- Research GDPR requirements & develop strategy for compliance
- Support the bringing together of a global advisory board
How to apply:
See here for a full description, and application instructions: share.zoomforth.com/director-of-ops

items.title: Development Manager
items.content:
Development Manager


Finfolio


FinFolio is simplifying wealth management for professional financial advisers. Can you switch rapidy between talking high-level architecture and putting out the latest fire? This is for you! :-) We need somebody to lead our development team, which is a mix of onsite and remote developers. We recently completed a 2-year pivot from a desktop app to our current modern web app. 

Our pivot worked and business is booming. Part of your responsibilities are interacting with the management team, and clients and prospects. We're seeking someone who wants to work in financial software development; a background in finance would be a plus but is not required. We should see some nice growth over the next few years.

This is a hands-on job. You will write some code, but most of your time is spent helping guide the product direction and keeping the team focused on the right things. Early stage startup atmosphere, lots of fun but can be chaotic with hard work. (12/12 on the Joel test)

We are open to a remote role although prefer a local candidate for this position. FinFolio is roughly 50% remote workers but this position requires a high level of interaction with the CEO and other senior managers.

See more jobs at Finfolio

items.title: UX Product Development Manager
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=8}
items.content:
JOB TYPE: Full time

EXPERIENCE: expert

COMPANY: Herrmann; 10-50 employees; 75-100% remote;

SKILLS:
• Persona
• Product Development
• UX Design
• SaaS
• User Research
• UX/UI
• UX/UI Design
• User-centered Design
• User Experience Design

Herrmann is hiring an experienced UX Product Development Manager to assist in enabling our new platform features for visual search and image recognition. Primary focus is to manage and coordinate product development projects to include evaluating and resolving technical feasibility, design optimization, and production issues. Role is an integral member of our Technology team and will interact with a cross-functional team in creating, developing, and delivering products to our strategic markets & support our client needs and our ongoing growth; will include working with clients and partners to co-create and tailor our solutions to ensure strong product market fit.

DUTIES & ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTION
• Own the overall user experience of the platform in collaboration with the Platform technology team and the Product team
• Manage and/or lead internal and external resources such as web designers, content specialists on user experience and user interaction (UX/UI) strategies and plans
• Work alongside design and development to define the overall architecture of the platform and any additional products and/or features and continue to develop rules and patterns within our atomic library design system
• Provide input to the product strategy and vision for the business regarding the progression of the platform
• Develop functional specifications for assigned product features to include effective product and user interface design, rapid prototyping, product validation testing, and usability testing, while ensuring that the product strategy is adhered to throughout the product life cycle
• Own prioritization of work for the platform team including the high-level roadmap, as well as epics/stories within sprint and the backlog
• Collaborate with Platform lead on the overall architecture of the platform to include the user’s perspective
• Work/Partner/Collaborate with Platform, Product and Marketing teams to drive product definition, development prioritization, and product/feature launches and ongoing support


QUALIFICATIONS
• Bachelor’s degree in visual design, communications, computer science or psychology
• 5+ years’ experience in UX technology & development within an agile environment
• Proven track record of success in software development, with experience in leveraging agile methodologies to launch 2+ products that have generated substantial new revenue and return on investment (ROI)
• Demonstrated understanding in the areas of user-centered design and system development, UX research and testing, UX technologies and tools, web and mobile technology, communication and supplemental delivery and distribution systems and analytics
• Proven experience applying research to interactive design, prototyping, and product development for website and web-based applications or platform-level tools
• 3+ years in project management capability
• Experience working with data visualization libraries
• Proven track record of delivering web-based products to market
• Experience working in an agile, rapid development and prototyping environment where effective communication is paramount
• General knowledge of how design impacts development effort, especially in an agile development environment
• Proven ability to manage multiple projects at a time while keeping designs very detailed oriented to communicate with our internal team and stakeholders
• Ability to work under pressure and meet scheduled deadlines
• Demonstrable ability to communicate, present and influence credibly and effectively at all levels of the organization
• Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
• Self-directed in creating their own path and processes to deliver projects
• Self-starter/self-motivated to aid in increasing service efficiency and process
• Team Player with a positive attitude
• Highly proficient in Microsoft Office/Google Docs Suite and web-based SaaS customer platforms
• Familiarity and experience with Jira and Confluence for stories and documentation
• Experience working in a mobile and remote environment

TOOLS WE USE
• Jira and Confluence for stories and documentation
• Zoom, Slack and email for keeping in touch
• Google Suite/Drive for keeping things organized
• Git/Bitbucket for source control
• React for data driven front end experiences
• Design specific tools at your discretion

PREFFERED ADDITIONAL EXPERIENCE
• Experience and familiarity with atomic design principles, is an asset
• Familiarity and experience with Tableau and/or Sketch
• Fluency in other non-English language is an asset
• Experience and knowledge of SaaS /subscription business models

Travel required for internal team activities/meetings when necessary.

Herrmann is a proudly woman-owned business and an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of thinking preferences, race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

items.title: Account Manager
tags: DBG:surround``OR(locat, base, resid) 3W OR(berlin, london, pari)
DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=3, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
*Role Summary*

We have an exciting opportunity for a sales professional to join our team. Your role will be working as a valuable member of our sales team managing relationships with our amazing partner accounting firms.

We're growing at an incredible rate and generating huge growth in the accounting channel. This is a perfect time to join Chaser and make an instant impact and contribution to the company's success.

Chaser Account Managers are at the heart of our sales and customer service offering. Taking a consultative approach to form strong relationships with our accounting partners, assisting and guiding them with cloud strategy.

As cloud accounting adoption keeps increasing within accounting firms, you will have the unique position to help support and increase their client portfolio by adopting Chaser into their firms. You can truly help them become more efficient, add real value to their clients and help them become that go digital accounting firm they strive to become.

You'll be reporting directly to the Head of Partner Channel Sales. Our head office is located in Moorgate London; however, we do offer remote working for the right candidate.

*As a person you:*

* Have highly developed communication skills and a positive demeanour
* Are consultative, process driven and persistent, with excellent professional written and verbal communication skills
* Have a proven track record in sales / account management within the B2B space (SaaS or Fintech would be great but not a requirement)
* Hard working but like to have fun and come to work with a smile on your face
* You will be extremely ambitious
* You will be someone who thrives in a high speed environment
* Digitally proficient, you will be excited to build an understanding of how best to use Chaser as a product. This will be essential for your success in the role

*What your role will consist of*

* Building a deep understanding of accounting and bookkeeping firms
* Acting as a trusted advisor to our accounting and bookkeeping partners and supporting change management in their firms
* Educating partners to help maximise growth
* Managing and respond to incoming partner enquiries
* Monitoring all existing and prospective partners progress through the sales funnel
* Maintaining and update the CRM system of all partners staff and contact details, alongside adding new partner enquiries
* Creating and running webinars
* Providing both online and onsite demos of Chaser

*Why you'll love Chaser*

At Chaser we value our people, we want them to enjoy the job they do and provide opportunities to love and grow their career. An exciting growing company we attract people who want to help us have a positive impact by helping our partner and their clients thrive and be successful. Our passionate, innovative Chaser team strive every day to make a meaningful impact. At Chaser, we truly value the input of every single member of the team. If successful, you'll be joining a sharp, welcoming group of people who will help you learn new skills and develop as an individual.

*Benefits*

* Competitive salary
* Share options
* Company pension scheme
* 25 days holiday
* Flexible working hours

If you're looking for a role that is exciting, challenging and diverse in which you can form lasting business and personal relationships, apply for the Chaser Account Manager position today.

*How to apply*

In applying please answer the following questions:

* Why have you applied for this role?
* Talk us through your most recent/relevant role and your sales performance to date
* What is your proudest professional achievement and why? - ( Max 200 words)
* Are you eligible to work in the UK?

items.title: Head of Customer Success
tags: DBG:surround``OR(locat, base, resid) 3W OR(berlin, london, pari)
items.content:
*Role Summary*

We’re looking for a passionate, customer-focused leader who can build and own responsibility for our Success and Support processes. Our primary route to market is through accounting and bookkeeping firms. You will be responsible for the delivery of Partner Success to those partner accounting and bookkeeping firms to ensure they make the most out of the block licences we sell to them. You will also be responsible for the delivery of Customer Success to new direct trialists to ensure maximum conversion from free trial. You will own responsibility for both ongoing retention and expansion MRR.

We are growing at a fantastic rate. Success and support are absolutely integral to our growth. This is an incredible opportunity for someone talented and ambitious to make a huge impact.

You'll be reporting directly to the CEO. Our head office is located in Moorgate London. Over half our team work remotely and we do offer remote working for the right candidate.

*Your Role Will Consist Of*

* Recruiting and managing a high performing success team. At the outset, this will be a team of two so you will still need to be very actively involved in delivery
* Building a deep understanding of accounting and bookkeeping firms. You will need to develop a deep empathy that can enable us to work with them to successfully introduce Chaser to their clients
* Crafting, delivering and refining training programmes for accounting and bookkeeping firm staff. This training will need to provide them with a detailed understanding of how Chaser as a product works. It will also need to equip them to identify opportunities and successfully sell and market Chaser to clients who could benefit from it
* Leading ongoing partner and customer account management to both avoid churn and maximise upsell opportunities for growth in their use of Chaser
* Delivering demonstrations of Chaser
* Management of all educational resources about Chaser, including inter alia our help centre and educational videos
* Ensuring partners and customers are aware of all new developments to the product and enabled to make the most out of them
* Creating and running webinars about Chaser
* Crafting, delivering and refining our Customer Success outreach and training process to new direct trialists so as to maximise trial conversion and retention
* Ensure that all customer and partner support is prompt and comprehensive. We pride ourselves on the quality of our support as a company
* Work closely with Sales, Marketing, Product and Engineering in carrying out these responsibilities; relaying feedback and insights as the voice of our partner and customer to shape our ongoing product roadmap
* Attending and representing Chaser at events

*About You*

* You will have a minimum of 3 years sales, success or account management experience. Experience of working in SaaS, with accounting firms or in credit control is a bonus
* You will have a deep passion for helping our customers and partners succeed
* You will be a proactive self-starter who is comfortable taking the initiative and solving problems autonomously
* You will be positive with an ability to engender the energy and excitement in partners and customers to use Chaser
* You will be extremely ambitious
* You will love learning (fast!). You will be comfortable (well, as comfortable as it’s possible to be!) learning through trial and error
* You will have strong commercial and business acumen with an instinct for opportunity
* You don’t need to be an amateur netless tightrope walker, but you will be comfortable with the need to take risks in the role
* You will have excellent written communication skills
* You will have excellent spoken communication skills, both in person and over the phone. You will need to explain what are often complex technical matters in simple terms
* You will have strong time management and prioritisation skills. There will be lots of balls to juggle in this role
* You will be someone who thrives working in a high speed environment
* You will be excited about working as part of a small, tight-knit team
* Digitally proficient, you will be excited to build an excellent understanding of how to best use Chaser as a product. Curiosity about how and why our product works will serve you well in this role

*Benefits*

* Competitive salary
* Share options
* Company pension scheme
* 25 days holiday
* Flexible working hours

*How to apply*

In applying please answer the following questions:

* Why have you applied for this role? (Max 100 words)
* What is your proudest professional achievement and why? ( Max 200 words)
* What is a company or product that you think has excellent educational resources and/or support materials; and what makes them so good?
* What is the one resource (be that video, written, audio or any other medium) that you would recommend everyone in your Success team consume to help them do their jobs better; and why are you recommending it?
* Are you eligible to work in the UK?

items.content:
Web Development Project Manager at Black Fin Digital Marketing

Remote | Freelance

Black Fin Marketing is looking for a full time Web Development Project Manager.

We are an innovative, purpose-driven, values-based culture that is looking for self-starters.

This is a key position in our web design and development department. The primary responsibilities include administrative oversight, project management, and quality control.

Responsibilities:

Your primary responsibility as Web Development Project Manager is to ensure that our standards are met for every project that comes through to our web team. Other responsibilities include:

  • Able to handle multiple projects and perform under pressure
  • Must be self-motivated and able to motivate others
  • Track project deliverables, tasks and KPIs using appropriate tools
  • Continuously monitor and report progress of projects with effective communication to all involved in process
  • Implement and manage project changes to achieve project outputs

Qualifications:

We are seeking candidates with a strong background in project management and that have worked with distributed teams.

Candidates must have:

  • Project management experience
  • Be familiar with the WordPress CMS
  • CSS/HTML Knowledge Required
  • An innovative mindset
  • Experience working on or with a distributed team
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills

Exceptional candidates should have:

  • Experience managing a team of designers and developers in day to day activities
  • Background in web technologies
  • Ability to work under pressure in a deadline driven environment
  • A “can-do” attitude and be a highly proficient multi-tasker

This is a full time position. Compensation will be determined based on qualifications and experience.

Please take a look on our website before applying: https://goblackfin.com/

If you are interested, please send me the following info:
(this is required to be considered for an interview)

1. Your Skype ID for a video interview
2. A YouTube video of yourself explaining:
– Why you believe you’re the best person for the job
– Your two primary strengths

Job Type: Full-time

Apply for job

items.title: Remote Cerner CCL Programming Analyst
tags: DBG:surround``remot 3N OR(options, avail, allow) NOT encourag
items.content:
Job Description

Position Title: Cerner CCL Programming Analyst (100% remote)

Required Experience:

  • Previous experience with Cerner Command Language (CCL) and support, maintenance, and report writing
  • Two to Three (2-3) years of information system development, implementation, and support required
  • Remote work available for 100% of project

Roles and Responsibilities:

  • Provide Cerner CCL (Cerner Command Language) programming, maintenance, report writing, and testing for Cerner clinical solutions.
  • Develop reports and build programs per hospital specification as needed.
  • Utilize CCL/Discern Explorer to select from, insert into, update into, and delete from a Cerner database.
  • Execute Discern Explorer programs on demand using ExplorerMenu.exe (EM) and ExplorerAnalyzer.exe (EA) to analyze the system resources used by RDBMS queries.
  • Utilize Discern Explorer to create, execute, and analyze ad hoc queries, reports and programs.
  • Utilize VisualExplorer.exe (VE), DiscernVisualDeveloper.exe (DVDev), operating system command-line editors, and other text editors.
  • Familiar using with Record Structure and subroutines to gather data, store in temporary structure, and execute particular section of the code as needed.
  • Meet with project team, vendors, systems engineers, technicians, and super users to determine requirements.
  • Provide updates to management on project progress.
  • Maintain knowledge of security and data integrity of system.
  • Manage resolution of project issues, escalating them to appropriate decision making staff and change control management team.
  • This is a full time salaried position

Consultant Attributes:

  • Must bring positive energy to the position
  • Excellent written and verbal skills
  • Ability to adapt to a fast pace healthcare environment
  • Analytical problem solving skills
  • Strong interpersonal skills
  • Results oriented
  • Clear commitment to the project
  • Focus on accountability
  • Ability to work in a collaborative team environment
  • Maintain professional attitude and performance

Company DescriptionCordea Consulting is an Information Technology Consulting firm serving the healthcare industry. We specialize in providing healthcare information technology solutions and take pride in our level of experience and expertise. Cordea Consulting is a privately held firm founded by two Healthcare IT consultants who have worked the challenges and experienced the rewards of implementing healthcare informatics solutions.

Our unique and consultant centric approach allows us to offer our consultants industry leading compensation opportunities not found at other firms. In addition, we offer great benefits, a flexible employment structure, and a true commitment to your long term career growth.

Cordea Consulting is dedicated to serving clients to help them achieve the most efficient healthcare process for their staff. We are proud to provide excellent consulting services while maintaining a high degree of professionalism.

Note: Please complete the short interview questionnaire for the position. Incomplete applications run the risk of not being fully submitted by the system for review. We appreciate your time and hope to speak with you soon!

items.title: Implementation Project Manager
tags: DBG:surround``3N( OR(feasibl,OR(consid,consider),option,occas,opportun,possibl,abil), OR(3N(remot, work),telecommut,2N(work,home)) ) NOT OR(regularli, abracadabra)
items.content:
Implementation Project Manager

Company: Healthify

We are looking for Implementation Managers to join our growing Product Support team! Implementation Project Managers plan and realize the implementation of Healthify’s product for our enterprise clients, working closely with client operational and technical partners and coordinating across internal teams to ensure our clients are set up for long-term success. You should apply if you are a technical project manager who is passionate about the impact technology can have on communities. We're excited about meeting candidates of all backgrounds who value success for our customers and our users.

About Us

Our mission is to build a world where no one’s health is hindered by their need.

We're effecting change for the most vulnerable among us by building software that social workers, nurses, patient advocates and care coordinators at Hospitals and Health Insurance companies use to connect their patients with social services. Our software addresses "social determinants," such as access to food, housing, childcare and jobs, which determine over 60% percent of our population's health. Our aim is to move the needle on healthcare outcomes and cost for these populations. After only 5 years, we've managed to touch the lives of over 6 million people in need. Our products are currently in use by some of the top health plans and Hospitals in the country such as BlueCross BlueShield and Johns Hopkins Healthcare.

We support diverse individuals and communities in need. To do this effectively, we believe it’s crucial to build a team that is equally diverse. We enjoy meeting people who share in our commitment to cultivate thoughtful and safe work environments, and understand the meaning and importance of our mission. We encourage individuals from marginalized and underrepresented communities to apply!

REQUIREMENTS

About the Role:

The Implementation Manager will:

  • Develop the implementation of Healthify’s platform for our enterprise clients
  • Ensure quality completion of implementation tasks across partners, including, but limited to: Product, Engineering, Product Support, Sales, and Account Management
  • Manage enterprise client relationships throughout the implementation process
  • Learn from your failures and improve Healthify’s implementation process
  • Identify and escalate project risks to the right parties
  • Travel domestically up to 25%

About You

  • 3-5 years experience in a client facing, project management role, preferably in healthcare and/ or IT environment
  • Technical project management experience
  • Empathetic Communicator: you “know your audience” and can deliver messages to a broad assortment of partners
  • Excited by new opportunities to grow and build
  • Experience with various healthcare technology platforms (e.g., EHR/ EMR/ HIE vendors)
...And the following would be nice

  • Professional experience in a dynamic, collaborative environment

BENEFITS

Together, we live into our Core Values

  • We lead with empathy: We believe kindness and empathy lead to effective communication. We assume good intentions and seek mutual understanding from our teammates, customers, and users.
  • We lean into vulnerability: We are not afraid to ask for help or give and receive feedback. We build off our failures and don’t shy away from tough conversations.
  • We rise above the status quo: The status quo leads to pain for the people we serve, our communities, and our clients. We do our best to rise above the status quo, and to do things that no one else are doing. On an individual level, we strive to improve ourselves and always be learning.
  • We love the hustle: We maintain an entrepreneurial mindset and stay scrappy. “No job is too small” and there are no bad ideas.
...and to further support them, we offer:

  • Unlimited Vacation
  • A comprehensive tech set up
  • Equipment allowance
  • Education reimbursement allowance
  • Monthly unlimited MetroCard reimbursement (New York only)
  • Monthly wellness reimbursement
  • 401k with 4% matching
  • 100% covered Medical, Dental & Vision insurance
  • Inclusive Parental leave
  • Flexible work schedule with work-from-home options
  • Weekly team lunches and learning opportunities
How to apply:
healthify.workable.com/j/1FC32867B7

items.title: TaxJar: Sr. Demand Generation Manager
items.content:
Sr. Demand Generation Manager

Company: TaxJar
Headquarters: Remote, USA
www.taxjar.com
TaxJar is the leading technology solution for busy eCommerce sellers to manage sales tax and is trusted by more than 10,000 businesses. Our mission is is to make eCommerce easier for everyone. 

OUR CORE VALUES

  • We do the right thing for our customers.
  • We're a team, built on trust.
  • We're proud to be remote.
  • We're in control of our own destiny.

TaxJar’s remote-only team of 40 people is growing quickly. Our team has an immediate full-time opening for an enthusiastic, highly-experienced, Senior Demand Generation Manager.

OUR TEAMS MISSION

The TaxJar marketing team’s mission is clear: get more eCommerce businesses to experience TaxJar to manage their sales tax reporting, filing and calculations. Our team demonstrates the tremendous value in cost and time-savings in choosing to fully automated solution like TaxJar for their sales tax needs. 

The marketing team’s goal is to maximize the number of qualified customers that begin our free trial and ensure the highest percentage of those folks end up as a customers. We work closely every day alongside sales, success, development, and user experience teams in order to deliver on these goals.

The Senior Demand Generation Manager is fanatical about finding and engaging our target audiences, generating qualified sales leads, and ultimately producing revenue opportunities for the TaxJar sales team to close.

AS A SR. DEMAND GENERATION MANAGER AT TAXJAR YOU WILL

  • Develop and communicate a strategic plan. Own the research, development, implementation, and success of multi-channel lead generation programs in order to meet lead, prospect, and ultimately, revenue goals.
  • Define the right tactics for reaching target markets, build a sales pipeline of qualified prospects, develop KPI’s, and measure results of activities on a regular and ongoing basis.
  • Be responsible for creating and implementing marketing plans that drive both inbound and outbound demand generation, messaging, and define our market/vertical segmentation.
  • Identify trends to nurture prospects and inform content development from data.
  • Organize and launch a best-in-class event marketing plan that ties closed won TaxJar Plus event activities back to marketing dollars.
  • Bring a creative and open mind to the team and be ready to hit the ground running.
  • Assist the sales and design teams in developing campaign-specific content necessary to close business
  • Must have a proven track record for driving lead generation and building a qualified pipeline for sales.
  • Must be willing to travel and attend in-person trade-shows and live events with customers.

This is a key strategic marketing role and requires a self-starter with strong experience in executing demand generation projects and has a deep understanding of eCommerce business needs. You don't wait for others to tell you what to do—you figure things out on your own. You ask questions. You get clarity. You do what's best for the customer.

REQUIREMENTS

  • Extensive experience with SEO, SEM, Google AdWords, Facebook (FBX), Doubleclick Bid Manager (DBM), Amazon Media Group (AMG), Quora Ads, etc
  • Well-versed in marketing automation tools and analytics platforms (Marketo, Eloqua, Pardot, Drift, Grow, Drip, VWO, Groove, Google Analytics, HotJar, Hootsuite, Woopra)
  • Ability to understand how tools connect and how to leverage platforms to get our tools to talk to each other (Segment, Zapier)
  • Agile, humble, trustworthy, and a team player
  • Rapid learner who thrives in a fast-paced and demanding environment
  • Passion for marketing simple and intuitive products that solve complex problems in eCommerce
  • Excel at communicating with the team remotely (Basecamp, chat, zoom, email, etc)
  • Proficient in Microsoft Office/Google Docs (Pivot tables, vlookups, etc)
  • Strong design capability a bonus (Canva, or Adobe CS).
  • This is not an entry level position. You’re an experienced demand generation marketer of 5+ years and are open to experimenting in new and creative ways of attracting potential new customers to try TaxJar.

YOU'LL BE A GREAT FIT FOR OUR TEAM IF YOU

  • Only want to work remotely
  • Are a PRO at communicating and collaboration
  • Highly value working with people you like and respect
  • Are accountable
  • Are confident in your skills and a solid team player (We’re peers here, no egos please) but also comfortable working asynchronously
  • Hungry to play an impactful role and not afraid to fail

We’re a happy team and we all really love what we do. We've created a space where high-achievers can succeed, but are also safe to fail. We're profitable and focused on growing TaxJar sustainably. We're always learning how to make TaxJar the best place to work for all of us, and not just another tech startup. We’re always looking for an amazing new teammates to come share in the excitement of solving real-world problems with technology.

BENEFITS

  • Excellent health, vision and dental benefits
  • Flexible vacation policy (we’ll actually pay you $500 a year to take time off!)
  • $1,000 in professional development credit
  • Home office stipend
  • Equity in a profitable company 
  • 2x year all-company in person retreats (fully paid for by us of course)
  • Brand new Macbook computer 
  • Mandatory Birthday holiday!
  • 12 week paid maternity/ 6 week paid paternity leave
  • Monthly perks reimbursement for things like Netflix, Amazon Prime, your gym membership, home internet and more.

We offer all of our employees amazing benefits. Visit www.TaxJar.com/jobs for a full list of our benefits and to learn more about how we work and what we stand for.

If you're not the perfect fit for this position, but you know someone who is, we'll pay you $1,000 if you refer us to the person we hire.

    Apply for this position

    Apply here: https://taxjar.workable.com/jobs/768009/candidates/new. Please treat this as your first interview. We receive lots of resumes, so here's your chance to stand out from the crowd.

items.title: CET Sales Support and Special Projects
items.content:
Job Requirements

This is a full-time remote sales position for someone with existing customer service experience, who loves customer service work, and would like to add involvement in related sales projects such as partner relations, licensing, and documentation.

We are looking for someone who is willing to usually work 9:00am-6:00pm CET.

The job requires written and spoken fluency in English (any other language skills are a plus).

About Us

We are a small software company with team members working all over the world. Our goal is to help rid the world of bad software - not a small task! We believe that providing best-in-class customer support is just as important as the software and services we provide. Our support staff is the face of our organization - the manifestation of our ideals and love for our users.

We have grown slowly and remained agile for over ten years now, and that's something we really treasure. When you join our team, you join our circle of friends.

About You

Here are a few things we believe are required to do the CET Sales Support & Special Projects job well.

You are Accurate and Organized
To be successful in this role you'll need to be focused and detail-oriented and good at self-management. We are looking for someone who in addition to dealing with daily sales support tickets, will bring skills in Project Management. You know how to take a new task, research it, figure out the steps required to deliver the work on time, and communicate to others about it.

You have Empathy
We believe this is the single most important attribute of an awesome sales support person. Being able to jump into a user's shoes (and walk around a bit) gives you the best perspective to help them. Our company also strives to focus on empathy in our interactions with each other, as well as with our partners and vendors. You know how to balance the importance of an efficient process and the goals of the company while still caring for the needs of an individual person.

You Love Helping People
We're looking for someone who genuinely likes interacting with people: meeting them, hearing their stories, helping them with their problems, and treating each new customer interaction like the beginning of a long-term friendship.

You Are Tech Savvy
Not only will you be helping customers decide what version of Balsamiq software is best for them, we also work in a remote "virtual" work environment. That means we use a lot of different software to keep our organization moving. You don't need to have a computer science degree, but being comfortable learning and using new software to communicate, track projects, and organize information is a must.

The Work

You should take the time to read our what it's like to work at Balsamiq page. It will help you decide if we are a good match for you.

The Sales Support work for this position is currently done by our colleague Anna, but due to recent growth in our company, we've decided to split the work into two positions. The second portion of the work is other sales related projects where our team could use assistance.

You'll be a member of the Sales Team (also known as the Wow! Division) and work collaboratively with the Tech Support Team (Customer Champions) spread between the US and Europe.

Your responsibilities will include:

  • Sales Support in CET 50%
    • phone and email support for an average of 20 customers a day
    • processing orders, refunds, general sales inquiries, lost license keys, basic installation/registration issues, etc
    • keeping up to date on basic changes in our software: new features, new prices, and new purchasing processes
    • help advise customers to pick the best and most cost effective way to purchase our product for their situation
    • help the sales team watch for trends in problems or requests from our customers, to help improve our software and systems
  • Collaboration and Management of Various Sales-Related Projects 50%
    • The Sales Support team's main focus is helping customers. The nature of the team is not project-heavy, but there are certain areas that we would like to develop, and that's exactly where we could use your help.
    • Some of these areas include:
      • strengthening and improving relations with Software Resellers and Partners
      • continued development and enhancement of sales processes
      • continued enhancement of legal and software licensing best practices
      • general project management when it comes to recognizing and taking action when there is a need for improvement

items.title: Senior QA Engineer/Manager
items.content:
OpenPlay is a digital platform operating in the UK, Ireland, UAE, Canada, Australia and Singapore that connects people to sports facilities and activities. It offers a search engine and a ‘nudge tool’ with curation based around user preferences, with quick easy online booking.

The core product is a comprehensive online booking system for venues and activity providers used to run all aspects of their business- see more at http://openplay.net

We are based in an amazing office in Clerkenwell, Central London with an informal, hard-working and kind team culture. The office is full of other innovative startups and there’s a real buzz in our working space.

The successful senior QA will be the first point of contact for all testing requirements. You will help shape our QA roadmap from seeing up Jira workflows/processes to managing junior QAs in the team.

Key Skills:

- Have worked in a structured environment with standard QA Procedures and Processes.

- Have experience of working in an environment encompassing the full life cycle of product development from defining and writing the technical specification through to release.

- Good working knowledge and experience in JIRA and related tools.

- Be capable of prioritising own workload and potentially others in a high pressured and time constrained environment.

- Have the ability to demonstrate skills in troubleshooting and 'thinking on your feet'.

- Experience testing large web applications and developing automation frameworks

- Experience managing one or more junior QAs

Location

The role would mainly be based from our offices in Clerkenwell but we do have flexibility for remote/ home working – we are a remote focused company so slack/Skype/trello etc are used in the majority of day to day interactions

items.title: Project Manager – SaaS
items.content:
Project Manager – SaaS at Aravo

Remote

Location: Irving, TX US

Hiring in Dallas, San Francisco, Portland, London, or Remote (US).

Aravo was founded in 2000 to bring order to the complex, chaotic world of enterprise Third Party Risk Management. We deliver market-leading SaaS solutions for managing third-party compliance and risk that help Global 2000 companies protect their brand, build customer trust, and drive principled performance. We have a notable and growing customer base of some of the biggest and most respected brands in the world including Google, Accenture, Ford, BAE Systems, Cisco Systems, GE, J&J, Lloyds Bank, Pfizer, P&G, Unilever and Visa.

Working for Aravo is working with purpose. Were a team that takes pride in delivering excellent products that really make a difference and we enjoy providing exceptional service to our clients. Were smart, collaborative and solutions driven. We know what we do helps serve a greater purpose by providing solutions that help eradicate corruption and social injustice from the worlds supply chains and third-party networks. We feel really good about that.

Aravo is headquartered in San Francisco, with offices and partners across the US, Europe and Asia.

The Role
Aravo is growing fast and recognizes the importance of building a world-class team to fuel our continued success. With significant investment and strong leadership to expand our business, its a tremendous time to be joining the Aravo team. In this role you’ll have the opportunity to:

  • Support our clients who are building and managing world-class third party risk management programs by maximizing the value of their investment in the Aravo platform.
  • Provide a valued voice, where ideas and creative approaches are welcomed.
  • Feel a sense of accomplishment as you are empowered to deliver in a dynamic, fun and fast-paced environment.
  • Celebrate successes and grow with us!

The Project Manager will join our Professional Services team to own all aspects of project delivery. They will be expected to complete multi-phase client deliverables with minimal guidance and oversight and improve the productivity of the overall team beyond assigned client deliverables.

Main Responsibilities:

  • Manage scope, schedule and budget of medium size, multi-phase software deliveries
  • Own all aspects of project delivery
  • Supervise, mentor and provide performance feedback to internal and 3rd party resources
  • Model attributes of a leader when interacting all internal team members and clients
  • Accurately estimate work effort on large projects
  • Supervise time tracking and billing
  • Create Services Statements of Work (SOW)
  • Act as an integral part of the pre-sales team in the closing phase of client acquisition
  • Proactively provide insight to other departments gained from project experience
  • Proactively identify and mitigate project risks
  • Improve upon and/or create new project templates as appropriate
  • Work within cross-functional teams to solve complex problems outside of ones core expertise

Requirements:

  • 5+ years of professional experience working as a team member of software delivery implementations
  • 3+ years of professional experience independently leading medium to large scale software delivery implementations
  • 4+ years of professional experience with procurement software or within a vertical industry applicable to Aravos client acquisition strategy

Skills:

  • Proven execution on all aspects of a software delivery lifecycle and clear understanding of more than one type of delivery methodology
  • Proven execution in a SAAS delivery environment
  • Excellent problem solving and conflict resolution skills
  • Ability to effectively translate complex business needs into a software delivery plan and to document and communicate that plan
  • Demonstrates natural leadership skills (provides value-added insight without prompting; coordinates/facilitates meetings, discussions and project efforts without establishing formal assignment or hierarchy)
  • Proven ability to leverage other team members to accomplish tasks
  • Capable of working autonomously to desired outcomes of a project

Benefits:

  • Medical / Dental / Vision Insurance
  • 401k
  • Competitive compensation
  • Work with leaders in the industry, opportunities to learn and grow every day
  • Collaborate with international teams
  • Flexibility to work remotely
  • …. and many more!
Apply for job

items.title: Zoomforth: Director of Operations
items.content:
Director of Operations

Company: Zoomforth
Headquarters: San Francisco, CA
https://share.zoomforth.com/director-of-ops
See here for a full description, and application instructions: https://share.zoomforth.com/director-of-ops

Join an early-stage, profitable company serving some of the world's top brands. Work directly with our CEO and help us optimize processes and manage priorities as we scale.

Zoomforth's design software helps customers gather and arrange content into beautiful web pages online. It's like Squarespace but specifically for professional communications.

We work with some of the world's top professional services companies and agencies, and we're looking for someone to help us manage priorities and processes as we scale.

We're a remote company (with an office in SF), with about 20 talented, kind and committed individuals working across the country and world.

We're quickly gaining traction supporting companies as they adapt their communications to a digital world. And after five years, we're now profitable, and have a huge opportunity to be a go-to solution for web-native communications in the modern enterprise. Our opportunity to scale, however, will be either advanced or constrained by how we optimize the time of our current team, prioritize, and improve our processes to meet customer demand.

You'll be working across the entire company, but primarily with our CEO. This means that some decisions that have historically been made by the CEO will be yours to make. It's a tremendous opportunity for anyone who wants to learn & grow, and has the opportunity to transition into a COO role.

RESPONSIBILITIES
You’ll be doing something different every week. Your job is to determine the most important operational barriers to growth and solve for it in any given week or month. You’ll do some measure of all of the areas below:

Operations
- Design and run a hiring pipeline
- Develop communications systems and practices to strengthen a remote culture and keep the team engaged
- Support the CEO in administrative tasks and scheduling
- Help design, organize, and manage bi-annual team retreats

Project Management
- Coordinate with our design team and manage client design requests to ensure design projects are swiftly completed.

Business Development
- Lead outreach to prospective partners to begin developing a network of parter companies.

Data and Reporting
- Manage reporting across sales, customer success, and product. For example, you'll determine the most efficient way to consistently surface sales metrics to the team, ensuring that we remain focused and that we learn from our data. 

Other Sample Projects
- Research GDPR requirements & develop strategy for compliance
- Support the bringing together of a global advisory board

Apply for this position

See here for a full description, and application instructions: https://share.zoomforth.com/director-of-ops

items.content:
Golang Engineer for an Open-source Project

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Industry: DevOps, Internet of Things, Software Development
Company size: 11-50 people
Company type: VC Funded
Company: Resin.io | No office location

Technologies

docker
go
gnu
linux
embedded-linux

Job description

On being a Golang Engineer at resin.io

Resin.io maintains Balena, an open source Moby-based container engine tailored to IoT devices. We are looking for Golang Engineers with in-depth expertise on container technologies and open source software to innovate in the realm of containers for embedded GNU/Linux devices.

Responsibilities

  • Actively invest back in our own technology, libraries, and frameworks
  • Understand security best practices and strive to apply them in your work
  • Be highly motivated to produce great code
  • Evaluate customer requirements and other inputs to determine the scope and timing of new functionality
  • Lead and maintain the Balena container engine open source project
  • Contribute back to major open source projects such as Docker
  • Research novel approaches to efficiently run and update containers in embedded devices

REQUIREMENTS

Need to have:

  • Desire to make yourself and others more effective. You'd be bothered by an inefficient process
  • Good understanding of software engineering practices and how to apply them
  • Excellent written communication skills, and fluency in English
  • Self-discipline to take on a project and push it to completion without too much management. You also know when to ask for help
  • Experience leading, or contributing to, open source projects
  • Experience with GNU/Linux
  • Experience with Golang
  • In-depth knowledge of Docker internals like namespaces, cgroups, and layers

Nice to have:

  • A sample of your work (URL or attached sample)
  • Contributions to OSS projects (please include a URL)
  • Having worked remotely before
  • Experience with Resin.io as a user
  • Experience with embedded GNU/Linux, anything ranging from personal projects with a Raspberry Pi to commercial or industrial scenarios with custom devices
  • Experience with Node.js
  • Experience with Kubernetes

Make sure to let us know if any of these items apply to you!

Apply now

About Resin.io

Resin.io provides a software platform that helps developers build, deploy and manage the code that runs on connected devices. In short, we make IoT work.

Our technology is open, standards-based and proven in production across a wide range of scenarios from drones, 3D printers, point-of-sale devices, tidal turbines, skyscrapers and more. Our investors include DFJ, Aspect Ventures, GE, and Ericsson.

We come from 15+ countries, and we embrace a remote culture with flexible hours. To us, this means being highly productive while still maintaining a healthy work-life balance. You need to be able to work remotely, and have a dependable internet access available so you can join video calls.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity. We value knowledge and initiative more than educational and personal backgrounds, age, or location. We maintain a work environment in which team members are treated with respect at all times and in which thoughts and ideas can be shared openly.

We communicate proposals, discuss with others in the team and accept feedback if it makes the result better. We value the ability to learn, which is more important to us than knowledge of specific technologies. We know that learning fast means being outside our comfort zone, which is OK -- we'd rather learn than let our assumptions get in our way.

Benefits

  • Work with extremely talented, distributed team
  • Work remotely
  • Flexible working hours
  • Equipment of your choice
  • Annual company gathering in an international location
  • We send you hardware for side projects!

items.title: Executive Assistant Template
items.content:
JOB TYPE: Full time

LOCATION:
Lisbon, Portugal
(Partial remote)

Anywhere in
Lisbon

EXPERIENCE: intermediate

COMPANY: The Tasty Studio; 10-50 employees; 0-25% remote;

SKILLS:
• Proposal Management
• Negotiation
• Contract Negotiation
• Office Administration
• Value Selling
• Sales Operations
• Creative Writing
• Sales Presentations
• Business Writing
• CRM

Job Description:

We are looking for a new Executive Assistant to support our executive team at The Tasty Studio, a unique Digital Food Studio operating in Lisbon. We are an all in-house culinary production company that creates and develops foodie content.

You will manage mostly business related tasks for our CEO and COO, such as creating reports, organizing travel and accommodation, time management, calendar organization, client management, assist on marketing campaigns and other important organizational tasks. To do this role properly you should have a detailed understanding of the full Microsoft Office suite or G Suite, tech-savvy, be a fast and efficient search engines user, be extremely fast at solving problems, be able to work under stress, find solutions, and have experience as an executive or administration assistant in the past.



Executive Assistant Responsibilities:

Preparing financial statements, reports, memos, invoices letters, and other documents.

Answering phones and routing calls to the correct person or taking messages.

Handling basic bookkeeping and Invoicing tasks.

Filing and retrieving corporate records, documents, and reports.

Researching and conducting data to prepare documents for review and presentation by executives.

Helping prepare for meetings.

Accurately recording minutes from meetings.

Greeting visitors and deciding if they should be able to meet with executives.

Using various software, including word processing, spreadsheets, databases, bookkeeping, invoicing and presentation software.

Reading and analyzing incoming memos, submissions, and distributing them as needed.

Making travel arrangements for executives.

Performing office duties that include ordering supplies and managing a records database.

Experience as a virtual assistant.

Opening, sorting and distributing incoming emails, and other correspondence.

Provide general administrative support.



Executive Assistant Requirements:

Proven experience as an executive assistant or other relevant administrative support experience.

Basic Understanding of the National Financial Systems (PT).

In-depth understanding of entire MS Office suite or G Suite.

Understanding of Knowledge Base Systems or SharePoint.

Understanding of Invoicing and Bookkeeping Software.

High school diploma (12º Ano).

Ability to organize a daily workload by priorities.

Must be able to meet deadlines in a fast-paced quickly changing environment.

A proactive approach to problem-solving with strong decision-making skills.

Professional level verbal and written communications skills in English & Portuguese.



To do Before Job Interview:

Have a look at our website to fully understand what we do.

Send us an introduction letter explaining why you are the person we should hire

Pick 3 (or all of them) of the 7 following tasks to do:

What are your strategies for managing your time when dealing with multiple urgent tasks simultaneously?

Write 2 simple marketing strategies to improve a production company sales on their website;

Which are the essential social networks for a Professional Food Blogger and Explain what is the best strategy to reach more audience with one of them.

Explain to a Recipes Website Owner why he needs to have a video for all his recipes rather than just a text with a photograph of the final dish;

What do you believe an executive assistant brings to a company?

What would be the 5 google search sentences you would use to find online platforms to sell video/photography services

How would you deal with an angry person demanding to speak with an unavailable executive?

What We Offer:

Base Net Salary of 750€ - 1000€.

Comfortable Work Environment.

Constant Professional Evolution.

Food is on us.

Rewards and Benefits for your amazing work.

Do You Love Finding Faster And Better Ways Of Doing Things, Especially Through Technology And Creating Systems To Save Time?
