items.title: Hands-on Chief Technology Officer / VP of Engineering -- Remote
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=9, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=44, embedded=0, frontend=4}
items.content:
Hands-on Chief Technology Officer / VP of Engineering -- Remote

Company: Natural Health Sherpa

Excited to take on the challenge of strategicallyleading our tech team from the comfort of your home?

Eager to join a team of high-performing, yethumble A-players that simply get things done?

Excited to be a part a rapidly growing $250 billion+ industry while measurableimproving people’s lives?

If so, and you’re a seasoned, marketing-oriented,strategic-thinking technology leader with lots of hands on full-stackexperience, has built and led efficient development teams… and has an incessantdrive towards excellence, an unquenchable curiosity and a get-it-done nowmentality, we’d love to talk.

We’ve posted this both as a CTO and VP ofEngineering role as both equally describe the actual opportunity and theday-to-day authority and responsibilities. To be 100% clear, this involves both heavy hands-on coding as well asstrategically building and managing our tech team.

We’re really looking for a seasonedengineering leader who has made lots of mistakes, has learned from that andmastered the art of technical discipline and smart decision making.

Who Are We?

We're an 8-figure direct response company that's been profitable since day 1 of our founding in 2010.  We’re in the process of re-branding our company to Metabolic Living.  As part of this, we’re launching a branded e-commerce website that more accurately reflects our full suite of products we’ve developed.

And to help lead us into our next stage of growth, we’re hiring a hands-on, strategic-thinking CTO to continue building out our small, but highly efficient tech team.  We have a number of exciting projects we need a full-time CTO to lead development efforts on:

  • We’re porting our outdated website at www.naturalhealthsherpa.com to our modernized content and commerce platform we’re building at www.metabolicliving.com on Shopify.
  • We’re strategically integrating our in-house direct response platform that we’ve built over the past 8 years with Shopify so we can leverage the best of elements of each platform
  • An end-to-end assessment of tools we’ve built internally to determine what should be migrated to SaaS and what we should continue to develop/maintain
  • Developing strategy to extend our success into the mobile app world; as up until now, we’ve been 100 web-focused with no app, but we have a huge opportunity with our own app
  • Strategically guide the company’s overall tech decisions as we continue on our path towards building out a billion-dollar lifestyle brand that penetrates into the offline retail channel

We're riding the $250+ billion annual tidal wave of demand for natural health products.  And we’re positioning our new brand to be right on top of that wave.  It is an extremely exciting time for us now.

Our nutrition courses and exercise programs are designed to deliver the most results in the least time. For example, our exercise videos deliver the same or better benefits in just 15 minutes, 3 times a week than do traditional exercise programs that require 60 minutes, 5 times a week. Yes, really.

You can see an example of one of our exercise products at http://www.metabolicrenewal.com as our e-commerce happens on product-specific websites for now.  All e-commerce will happen on http://www.metabolicliving.com as part of the re-branding.

We also formulate state-of-the-art nutritional supplements and functional foods that fuel your metabolism to generate the energy you need to consistently perform at your peak.  For example, instead of taking weeks to notice a difference, it takes just days to feel better.

We practice what we preach:  our company is designed so everyone both enjoys their work challenges while having plenty of time to do what they love to do the most in their life.  We recruit only high-performing, humble people who produce in fast cycles, hold themselves accountable and have fun.

Who We Need: 

We’re scouring the U.S. for a full-time, hyper-talentedCTO with in-depth, hands-on, full-stack web development experience, bothbuilding and leading highly efficient development teams.  It is a remote/work-at-home position with avery flexible work/vacation schedule as lifestyle is hugely important to our company given what we do.

This opportunity is suited only for ahigh-performing CTO-caliber developer and technology leader with an integrativemindset and proven ability to get things done cleanly and on time.  The ideal person is relishes being hands-onin all facets of web engineering from the browser to the code to the server.

As our CTO, you will optimize, support and manageour entire web infrastructure.  You willdecide what we should build vs. what we should leverage in the cloud /SaaS.  You will have full authority totake our company’s technology infrastructure to the next level.

Just as we obsess about creating healthyliving products that get the most results in the least time, we’re looking forsomeone equally obsessed about doing the same thing with beautiful, efficient code.  And with smart decisions on build vs. buy.  We really need a strong strategic thinker inthis position.

As a marketing-focused company, the highestROI on our technology investments are tied to marketing-related initiativeslike funnel development, precision analytics, split testing, paymentprocessing, etc.  To that end, the moretech resources we can focus on marketing-oriented activities, the better.

Because we run a highly efficient, small team,your hands-on technology skills are just as important as your team building andleadership skills.  Moreover, how fastyou process information, how quickly (and accurately) you can cycle throughwork and how well you work with the rest of our team is crucial.

Finally, we’re looking for someone who cancollaborate in real-time with the company’s marketing team.  This can require real-time communicationthroughout the day based on our heavy advertising spend on Facebook, Google,which can reach upwards of $100k / day. The ability to turn a business conversation into an actionable set ofdev tasks that you can jump on immediately is crucial.

What the IdealCandidate Looks Like:

  • Deep experience as an end-to-endapplication/web architect responsible for every single part of the projectincluding requirements gathering, project management, system architecture, infrastructuresetup, coding, integrating with third parties and documenting and testing.
  • Highly marketing- and revenue-focusedtechnology experience with heavy emphasis on e-commerce-related activities suchas analytics, split testing, payment processing, etc.
  • 10+ years’ experience as a softwareengineer/web developer with recent, applicable focus on database-driven webapplications on a LAMP stack.
  • Familiar with various development, testing,and DevOps processes and techniques and can provide direction to a smalltechnical team and the company on how to be efficient and nimble
  • Working knowledge with a variety ofdevelopment and process (task tracking, build automation, load testing, etc.)and can guide the introduction and improvement of processes.
  • Expertise in solution architecture, withproven experience creating strategic plans and visions for technology andexecuting on the tactical efforts to get there.
  • Expert-level, working knowledge of HTML, CSS,and JavaScript; our design team creates most of the assets, but you’ll beimplementing, optimizing, troubleshooting, and adding functionality.
  • Ability to build complex PHP applicationsquickly, efficiently, and under pressure. Our application stack runs on CodeIgniter, so working knowledge of that frameworkis a plus.
  • Just as good with SQL as you are with PHP withability to write ad-hoc queries for data extracts by hand, optimize tables with100s of millions of rows, and built new, smart database schemas.
  • Familiarity with CDNs (especially Amazon S3and CloudFront) and general web speed optimization design patterns andtechniques.
  • Solid knowledge of Linux, Apache, and generalinfrastructure/server support so you can troubleshoot and optimize as neededwith our hosting team.
  • You’re a self-starter who can take initiativeand run with the ball without having to be told what to do and you loveanalyzing seemingly intractable problems and devising creative solutions.
  • You’re a strong project manager who can scopeout technical requirements based on business needs, define deliverables, createa project plan and then execute and deliver upon that plan.
  • You’re available during normal Easternbusiness hours (8 a.m. – 5 p.m. ET) with occasional off-hour support duringcritical business events.

What You’ll BeDoing:

  • Strategically building, managing and leader ourtechnology team
  • Optimizing the feature set in our directresponse software platform (LAMP), integrating with 3rd party tools,optimizing our web infrastructure and creating workflow automation modules.
  • Designing, maintaining and enhancing internalsystems, programs and web applications, including e-commerce, marketingcampaign tracking, content management and more.
  • Building and improving existing and newanalytics and reports using MySQL, large datasets, and a custom-buildreplication and data warehouse engine.
  • Manage asset, code, and database deploymentsto managed servers and cloud servers, as well as building or finding tools toimprove and automate the deployment and testing process.
  • Proactively suggest ways to improve any systemyou work with, looking for opportunities to use technology to deliver clear,measurable value to the business.

5 Key AttributesWe Look For:

  1. QuicklyEngages – Attacks projectsimmediately, doing just the right amount of planning to avoid analysisparalysis, constantly pushing andmaintaining high intensity.
  2. TakesOwnership – Takes personalresponsibility for projects due to a deepsense of pride, going the extra mile, constantly surprising, solving problems proactively.
  3. ProducesResults – Prioritizes work based on what’smost impactful to company, while deftly cycling through tasks to produce the most meaningful results thefastest.
  4. RelentlesslyPersists – Embraces get-it-doneattitude, relentlessly attacks problems at different angles until somethingworks, staying resilient until thetask is done. 
  5. CollaboratesSmoothly – Gels well within or acrossteams, respecting others, communicating candidly, no hidden agendas, coordinating effectively so things get donefaster.

What You'll Enjoyfrom Us:

  • HighlyCompetitive Salary – This respectsthe fact that you are a needle in a haystack, a true high-performer that anycompany would die to have on their team.
  • PerformanceBonuses – Additional cashcompensation based both on company as well as individual performance, allowingyou to participate in the company’s upside success.
  • Flexible Benefits – We can customize your benefits to yourspecific situation, rather than forcing you to accept something that may notmake sense for you.
  • Work-from-HomeFlexibility – A fantasticlifestyle that allows you to work from home, have flexible hours when neededwith ability to carve out time to do what you love.
  • Curated Team – Peace of mindknowing we only recruit high-performing, humble people and that you’ll besurrounded by a supportive, high-energy team that respects you and your work.

How to apply:
If this sounds like a good fit, if you’re excited to do something challenging and meaningful that preserves your ability to enjoy life to the fullest, then please apply ASAP as we can’t wait to meet you! Please apply via: naturalhealthsherpa.workable.com/j/21C819510F

items.title: Manager, Research Programs
items.content:
Manager, Research Programs at Susan G. Komen for the Cure

Remote

About this Job

FLSA Status: Exempt

Location: Remote

Job Description:

Basic Function

Provide scientific expertise to and oversight of Komen’s portfolio of research grants

Primary Responsibilities

  • Manage Komen’s process of developing Requests for Applications and solicitation of scientific grant applications.
  • Oversee the peer review process and ensure scientific rigor is applied to all submitted applications, and appropriate support is provided to both applicants and reviewers.
  • Implement and oversee the grant contracting process and post award science management of funded research grants, which includes an active portfolio of over 250 projects totaling over $150 million.
  • Hire, manage, and coach a team of PhD-level scientific staff (Research Grants Managers).
  • Provide accurate information to the Development, Marketing and Communications teams to support efforts to illustrate the importance and impact of the Komen Research Program in support of the Bold Goal.
  • Ensure that Komen’s principles of scientific excellence, fairness and transparency throughout the research process are achieved.

Job Qualifications:

Minimum Experience Required

  • Doctorial Degree required
  • 4-8 years of management experience in peer-reviewed grant making or other scientific program development.
  • At least 2 years of supervisory experience.
  • Ability to manage a large, complex workflow with multiple deadlines, data points, and priorities.
  • Highly developed administrative and organizational skills, and financial acumen.
  • Excellent organizational and contract and project management skills required.
  • Demonstrated success coordinating information and data across multiple team members. Excellent communication skills leading to exceptional team and cross departmental interactions as well as the ability to communicate scientific concepts to a lay audience (internal and external). Exceptional writing and speaking skills required.
  • Ability to prioritize and manage daily business dynamics.
  • Shows positive approach to work, flexibility, cultural awareness, sensitivity to relationships, security, and confidentiality.
  • Excellent and instinctive service and customer relationship skills.

Preferred Experience

Breast cancer research background and publication history

Five years of management experience in peer reviewed grant making, preferably in health research and/or scientific project management.

Specialized Knowledge Requirements

Knowledge of breast cancer research, the scientific and research process, and particularly research funding and grant-making operations.

Department: Health Science

Apply for job

VP Product at Footprint

San Francisco, Remote · Full Time

We're transforming large organizations with chat, machine learning, and A.I.

Applied
Apply to Footprint
Add a message to Footprint
Apply

Job Description

As the VP Product at Footprint Labs, you'll be the leader of our product and engineering teams.

Working directly with our CEO (head of product), your mission is to achieve product parity across all platforms: Android, iPhone, iPad, mobile web, and desktop web--in parallel.

This means any action you can take on Footprint can be performed on every platform.

This means our production releases across all platforms are synced, too.

This means you're the captain, now.

About You: You're a missionary at heart and a proven technology leader both in your head and in practice.

You can execute software across multiple platforms, in parallel. You can build and manage a backlog, deploy resources accordingly, manage product managers and designers, and keep the backlog and other instrumentation devices updated weekly. Engineers, Product Managers, and Product Designers like working with you and for you. You play well with marketing and sales. You believe in an innovation-first approach but are well grounded in serving customer needs. When making decisions, you're skilled at making sense of gut vs. data. You've worked with distributed engineering teams. You understand and believe in Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery. You don't believe in process for process' sake, however, and can distinguish between tasks that need to be fully automated and those that need a lighter touch.

You want to help build a world-class company.

Responsibilities
- Manage product delivery across web (cross-browser), mobile web, iPhone, iPad, Android, and desktop apps
- Manage product design across web (cross-browser), mobile web, iPhone, iPad, Android, and desktop apps
- Manage design, product, and engineering communication
- Work closely with the CEO to define product
- Write software specs and manage the writing of specs
- Prepare product presentations to the CEO and board
- Recruit, train, and expand the entire product team at Footprint
- Instrument everything
- Talk to customers

Skills
Javascript, Software Development, Product Management, Android, iOS Development, Programming: 3P APIs & Libraries, Product Development, Leadership, Enterprise Software, CTO, Cross-Functional Team Leadership, Cross Platform Mobile Development, Enterprise Architecture, Sales/Marketing and Strategic Partnerships, Leadership and Team Inspiration, Engineering Leadership, Engineering, Product Design, Start-Up CTO, React.js, Instrumentation, Go

items.title: Engineering Manager Studio
items.content:
Engineering Manager Studio


Invisionapp


You are someone who loves building high performing teams. You believe that the foundations of a really good team are a clear vision, engaged and talented engineers, just enough process, fast and effective decision-making, and excellent communication.  You’re never satisfied and are always looking for ways to make things better and to deliver faster with higher reliability. You care deeply about the work that you do and the people who are doing it. You practice the leader-leader model. You love building great products and working with awesome people.


At InVision, we are creating the world's leading product design experiences through powerful design and prototyping tools.  We are building InVision Studio to be the world’s most powerful screen design tool. But in many ways, that’s just the beginning.  We intend for Studio to be a platform upon which a massive ecosystem of creative people can solve problems we never even imagined. Through this platform we will be enabling a powerful ecosystem of plugins and applications that enable designers and more to achieve their goals.  As an Engineering Manager on the Studio Marketplace, your team will build the UI and infrastructure that allows developers and partners to share their unique additions to the Studio ecosystem.


There are a number of reasons you really want to be an Engineering Manager on this team.  You will have the opportunity to work with a super talented, engaged engineers who love what they do.  You will work with an experienced leadership team that has successfully grown and mentored managers. You’ll be part of a peer group that is supportive and always learning.


As an Engineering Manager, you will:


* Be accountable for your team’s delivery and execution on projects and operation of services.

* Lead and grow the engineers on your team through coaching and mentoring, regular reviews, and one-on-ones.

* Manage projects through effective planning, communication of status, and coordination of activities within your team and across teams.

* Continuously improve your team’s processes.





A great candidate is someone who is:


* Experienced in mentoring and coaching engineers.

* Experienced in delivering complex projects quickly and with a focus on quality and reliability.

* Process-oriented but hates bureaucracy. Experienced with Agile and/or Lean.

* Good at getting things done with minimal oversight while maintaining good information flow.

* Experienced hiring good engineers who add to the strengths of the team.

* Balances good strategic vision with tactical execution.





If this sounds like you, please let us know in a cover letter why you think this is a perfect fit for you.


Get to Know Us:
InVision is the Digital Product Design platform used to make the world’s best customer experiences. We provide design tools and educational resources for teams to navigate every stage of the product design process, from ideation to development.

Today, more than 3.5 million people use InVision to create a repeatable and streamlined design workflow; rapidly design and prototype products before writing code, and collaborate across their entire organization. That includes more than 80 percent of the Fortune 100, and organizations like Airbnb, Amazon, HBO, Netflix, Slack, Starbucks and Uber, who are now able to design better products, faster.

InVision is a fully distributed company with employees in 25 countries around the world. The company has raised more than $235 million in funding from leading investors including Accel, ICONIQ, FirstMark, Tiger Global, Battery Ventures, and Spark Capital. Visit us at InVisionApp.com and InVisionApp.com/blog.

See more jobs at Invisionapp

Job Description

We are seeking an experienced sales leader to effectively drive IntellaSphere’s sales activities in order to maximize customer/subscriber acquisition. We’re looking for a highly motivated, hands-on sales rock star, who has broad experience growing sales with B2B SaaS-based software and/or a Digital Marketing Agency (preferably experience with both).

Our business is ready to take flight – so we are looking for someone who moves fast, is nimble, comfortable with digital marketing solutions, and has a strong desire to drive revenue and sales to the next level and be part of a winning team.

Job description

• Quickly learn, understand and be able to pitch IntellaSphere’s Integrated Marketing System.
• Create, communicate and execute on an effective sales approach and sales plan.
• Close sales of our full service marketing offering and help drive trial signups of our DIY SaaS-service offering.
• Manage all steps of the sales process / sales pipeline, from lead generation to nurturing to closing.
• Sell consultatively, assessing the prospective client’s needs and tapping into how our a multi-channel product suite can help them quickly grow their business.
• Conceptualize breakthrough sales strategies and programs that drive sales, as well as differentiate and advantage IntellaSphere.
• Serve as an sales ambassador / evangelist for the company. Instill confidence in and loyalty to our brand.
• Determine and optimize cost effective sales initiatives / programs.
• Build or better yet, leverage existing relationships at all levels, including small-to-mid-size businesses, digital marketers, marketing agencies and key industry influencers

items.title: Head of People Operations
items.content:
Head of People Operations at Toptal

Remote | International

We created Toptal to solve an extremely difficult, real-world problem: the talent shortage.
Learn more about us and how to join our core team today.

Job Description

About Toptal

Toptal is a network of the world’s top 3% of software engineering, design, and finance talent – available on demand to help companies accelerate, adapt, and scale. With $100+ million in annual revenue and triple-digit growth, Toptal is the largest fully distributed workforce in the world.

We take the best elements of virtual teams and combine them with a support structure that encourages innovation, social interaction, and fun. We see no borders, move at a fast pace, and are never afraid to break the mold.

If you’re not in the job market, you’re exactly the type of person we’re looking for.

Position Description

The Toptal core team consists of hundreds of driven, high-skilled team members distributed around the world. It is a truly global, fully remote, high-impact workforce.

As Head of People Operations, you will lead the team responsible for maximizing the impact of all Toptal core team members. You will be the primary carrier of culture at Toptal, defining and reinforcing what maximum impact means day-to-day on both an individual and organizational level. You will develop and evolve systems for measuring impact, creating new initiatives designed to improve it over time through combinations of onboarding, performance measurement, learning and development, HR, and quality assurance of key workstreams. You will be responsible for ensuring Toptal becomes the world’s most impactful, effective workforce as we scale, and will be empowered with all the resources you need to achieve success.

This is a remote position that can be done from anywhere.

Responsibilities

You will work closely with Toptal’s founders, executive team, People Operations team, and individuals across the company to achieve and maintain cultural alignment throughout the company. You will build systems to measure, reinforce, and reward cultural alignment, as well as feedback mechanisms to identify when teams or individuals are not aligned.

You will work with the People Operations team and key stakeholders around the company to evolve our systems for maximizing the individual impact of all Toptal core team members. This will include measuring the efficacy of our existing processes for onboarding, performance measurement, and learning & development, using this data to guide initiatives to improve each.

Additionally, you will work with the People Operations team and key stakeholders to evolve our systems for maximizing Toptal’s impact on an organizational level, with a focus on HR and quality assurance of key workstreams. You will ensure that the Toptal workforce has world-class support for benefits, employee relations, compensation guidelines, etc., as well as effective processes in place ensuring that all client- and talent-facing work completed is high quality.

In the first week, you will:

  • Onboard and integrate into Toptal.
  • Rapidly begin learning about Toptal’s history, culture, and vision, with a heavy focus on how top performers effectively get things done at Toptal.
  • Shadow key teams across the company to learn the core of Toptal’s operations and capabilities.

In the first month, you will:

  • Undergo an intense training and mentorship period with top performers from a diverse range of teams across Toptal.
  • Deep dive into the structure, processes, and ongoing initiatives of the People Operations team.
  • Begin working on projects with smaller problem scopes designed to both deliver impact and train you on effective problem solving process and style at Toptal.
  • Develop a vision for the future of People Operations at Toptal and a prioritized backlog of projects that will realize that vision across onboarding, performance measurement, learning & development, HR, and quality assurance of key workstreams.

In the first three months, you will:

  • Begin executing on your roadmap, measuring the impact of all initiatives, iterating quickly, and driving real value across the organization.
  • Align with key stakeholders on the right set of KPIs by which People Operations should be measured.
  • Develop and execute initiatives to measure, reinforce, and reward cultural alignment.
  • Develop and/or improve processes and standards for measuring and rewarding merit at Toptal, including compensation guidelines, career paths, etc.

In the first six months, you will:

  • Complete your first key People Operations initiatives successfully, as evidenced by the relevant KPIs trending up and to the right over time.
  • Have a clear set of dashboards and KPIs for People Operations that are reviewed daily or weekly and acted upon quickly and effectively to keep the Toptal core team operating at a world-class level.
  • Prove the impact of People Operations initiatives to Toptal’s bottom line and justify significant further investment into scaling People Operations at Toptal.
  • Expand your team, prioritizing by organizational impact.

In the first year, you will:

  • Further expand your team so that People Operations is ready to support rapid scaling of the Toptal organization.
  • Plan out the processes, standards, and initiatives necessary to successfully execute a rapid expansion of the Toptal workforce without loss of quality, culture, or operational excellence.

Requirements:

  • Exceptional history of effectively leading complex, cross-functional initiatives in fast-paced, intense environments.
  • Strong experience building culture at rapidly growing organizations.
  • 3+ years of experience in HR processes, regulations, and problem solving situations. Strong ability to quickly learn aspects of HR that you don’t already know.
  • Strong understanding of how driven people from a variety of backgrounds and personality types become and stay motivated.
  • Outstanding interpersonal and organizational skills.
  • Exceptional communication skills, including the ability to inspire and reinforce culture both at the executive level and within teams across the company.
  • Exceptional drive, including the ability to set vision and proactively pursue it while being relentlessly resourceful.
  • You must be a self-starter with lots of initiative and creativity.
  • You must be an excellent leader with an exceptional ability to explain complex concepts clearly while dealing with multiple people, teams, projects, and priorities.
  • You need to be comfortable with all aspects of global recruitment and management of global teams, and you must always be an outstanding brand ambassador.
  • A deep understanding of how effective culture and employee growth initiatives work at both small and large companies.
  • Ability to identify issues impeding team and individual growth and a sense for how to fix those problems.
  • While a technical background is not required, you must be excellent at using data and quantitative approaches for decision making.
  • You must be a world-class individual contributor to thrive at Toptal. You will not be here just to tell other people what to do.
Apply for job

items.title: Healthify: Implementation Project Manager
tags: DBG:surround``3N( OR(feasibl,OR(consid,consider),option,occas,opportun,possibl,abil), OR(3N(remot, work),telecommut,2N(work,home)) ) NOT OR(regularli, abracadabra)
items.content:
Implementation Project Manager

Company: Healthify
Headquarters: New York
https://healthify.workable.com/j/1FC32867B7
We are looking for Implementation Managers to join our growing Product Support team! Implementation Project Managers plan and realize the implementation of Healthify’s product for our enterprise clients, working closely with client operational and technical partners and coordinating across internal teams to ensure our clients are set up for long-term success. You should apply if you are a technical project manager who is passionate about the impact technology can have on communities. We're excited about meeting candidates of all backgrounds who value success for our customers and our users.

About Us

Our mission is to build a world where no one’s health is hindered by their need.

We're effecting change for the most vulnerable among us by building software that social workers, nurses, patient advocates and care coordinators at Hospitals and Health Insurance companies use to connect their patients with social services. Our software addresses "social determinants," such as access to food, housing, childcare and jobs, which determine over 60% percent of our population's health. Our aim is to move the needle on healthcare outcomes and cost for these populations. After only 5 years, we've managed to touch the lives of over 6 million people in need. Our products are currently in use by some of the top health plans and Hospitals in the country such as BlueCross BlueShield and Johns Hopkins Healthcare.

We support diverse individuals and communities in need. To do this effectively, we believe it’s crucial to build a team that is equally diverse. We enjoy meeting people who share in our commitment to cultivate thoughtful and safe work environments, and understand the meaning and importance of our mission. We encourage individuals from marginalized and underrepresented communities to apply!

REQUIREMENTS

About the Role:

The Implementation Manager will:

  • Develop the implementation of Healthify’s platform for our enterprise clients
  • Ensure quality completion of implementation tasks across partners, including, but limited to: Product, Engineering, Product Support, Sales, and Account Management
  • Manage enterprise client relationships throughout the implementation process
  • Learn from your failures and improve Healthify’s implementation process
  • Identify and escalate project risks to the right parties
  • Travel domestically up to 25%

About You

  • 3-5 years experience in a client facing, project management role, preferably in healthcare and/ or IT environment
  • Technical project management experience
  • Empathetic Communicator: you “know your audience” and can deliver messages to a broad assortment of partners
  • Excited by new opportunities to grow and build
  • Experience with various healthcare technology platforms (e.g., EHR/ EMR/ HIE vendors)
...And the following would be nice

  • Professional experience in a dynamic, collaborative environment

BENEFITS

Together, we live into our Core Values

  • We lead with empathy: We believe kindness and empathy lead to effective communication. We assume good intentions and seek mutual understanding from our teammates, customers, and users.
  • We lean into vulnerability: We are not afraid to ask for help or give and receive feedback. We build off our failures and don’t shy away from tough conversations.
  • We rise above the status quo: The status quo leads to pain for the people we serve, our communities, and our clients. We do our best to rise above the status quo, and to do things that no one else are doing. On an individual level, we strive to improve ourselves and always be learning.
  • We love the hustle: We maintain an entrepreneurial mindset and stay scrappy. “No job is too small” and there are no bad ideas.
...and to further support them, we offer:

  • Unlimited Vacation
  • A comprehensive tech set up
  • Equipment allowance
  • Education reimbursement allowance
  • Monthly unlimited MetroCard reimbursement (New York only)
  • Monthly wellness reimbursement
  • 401k with 4% matching
  • 100% covered Medical, Dental & Vision insurance
  • Inclusive Parental leave
  • Flexible work schedule with work-from-home options
  • Weekly team lunches and learning opportunities

Apply for this position

https://healthify.workable.com/j/1FC32867B7

items.title: Project Manager (EMR Implementation) - Remote
items.content:
Job Description

NOTE: THIS POSITION IS NOT OPEN TO C2C.

We are looking for a project manager with experience in EMR implementations of Sunrise Clinical Manager.

Skill Set Desired:

_ Must have PMP _

_ Must have Sunrise Clinical project management experience _

Must be located near Beaver, PA or Overland Park, KS (preferred)

_ Must be willing to travel _

Specific Requirements:

• PMP Certification Required.

• Successful completion of Bachelor's degree or relevant business / information technology experience.

• Demonstrable project management skills, including influencing, communications and tracking skills, and planning and organization.

• Solid knowledge of project management methodologies, tools & techniques. Strong ability to collaborate with individual contributors to define business process issues, analyze operational efficiencies, implement creative solutions, and measure delivery results.

• Minimum 5 years relevant project management and/or management experience, plus at least 7 years relevant business experience.

Travel Requirements:

• Occasional as warranted by project work

• Frequency will vary depending on project requirements

• Work is performed in a normal office setting with minimal exposure to health or safety hazards; substantial time is spent working on a computer, having meetings and on conference calls.

Purpose of the role

Manage and control of internal projects for the business, to ensure project completion on time to budget and meeting customer needs.

Accountabilities

• Support Solutions Management teams or other management by providing project management control on key initiatives, usually pertaining to developing and delivering solutions to market or to internal process improvement.

• Support Solution Management or Segment leader to define overall work breakdown structure, detailed tasks, and assess impacts on other projects.

• Ensure adherence to common processes, such as the Product LifeCycle Management (PLM) process, and the Software Development LifeCycle (SDLC).

• Work with project team to define, estimate & schedule specific tasks to achieve project scope.

• Provide a platform for communication and relationship management -- engage stakeholders for buy-in, relieve bottlenecks & complexity.

• Provide performance monitoring, information and reporting; help diagnose root cause of problems.

• Identify and escalate critical issues in timely manner.

• Ensure teams are taking corrective action as necessary to deliver complete scope, desired quality and timeliness of strategic programs.

• Keep team apprised via project plans, meetings and discussion minutes of project tasks identified, tasks to be completed, and work not completed.

Company DescriptionSupporting Information Technology, E-Commerce, Program Management, Administration, International, Corporate, Manufacturing, Technical, Software Development, Web Development, Utilities, Manufacturing, Automobile, Healthcare, Start up, Engineering

items.title: Full Time: Project Manager with Product Experience at The Tor Project, Inc. (Recruiting) in Seattle, WA or Remote
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=5, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
The Tor Project, Inc., a 501(c)(3) nonprofit organization advancing human rights and freedoms by creating and deploying free and open source anonymity and privacy technologies, is seeking a Project Manager with product experience to help coordinate our Tor Browser (desktop and mobile), UX, and Community teams.

The ideal candidate has experience leading an open source project. Tor is developed and maintained collaboratively through the contributions of a diverse, global community. We work hard to choose communications tools that encourage participation, where every contributor is heard and respected. The person in this job must be a team player with excellent communication skills.

The primary focus of our Product PM is to help the Browser, UX, and Community teams succeed by fulfilling their contractual obligations and meeting their roadmap goals. This person will be responsible for ensuring a productive, healthy work environment so all team members are able to contribute effectively and to the best of their abilities. All teams are distributed globally across multiple time zones, so the ability to organize and communicate via chats, email, etc., is crucial. This person will also be the link between the teams, volunteers, and sponsors (funders), and thus must have strong organizational skills and the ability to communicate in writing to diverse audiences.

You will be helping teams roadmap, identify projects for grant proposals, manage the execution of projects, and write progress reports for sponsors. This is where your experience with product comes in -- your product eye should help facilitate discussions between all stakeholders participating in product decisions at Tor.

This position will work closely with other team leads and project managers. This position reports directly to the Executive Director.

Responsibilities:

  • Roadmap: provide advice to teams where needed and point them in the right direction; help them understand what is expected of them
  • Coordinate the transfer of information to and between the teams, sponsors, and greater Tor community
  • Organize team meetings, help your teams plan their roadmaps, and show the teams how to improve their processes
  • Work with other project managers to coordinate contingencies within other teams’ roadmaps
  • Work on grant proposals with the Tor Project’s Fundraising Director and Grant Writer by providing them with your teams’ ideas for projects and the personnel needed for execution
  • Manage risks and issues that might occur while executing a project
  • Oversee roadmap execution and monitor each team’s progress on their respective projects

Qualifications:

  • Solid UX background, with understanding of or hands-on experience in software development and web technologies
  • Super organized
  • Knowledge of how to build great processes, no matter what tools the teams are using
  • Great facilitator
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills; ability to communicate with many different audiences
  • Experience managing a team is a huge plus
  • Knowledge of and experience with software development life-cycle process
  • Experience with Free and Open Source Software culture
  • Comfortable with transparency
  • Excellent attention to detail
  • General knowledge of internet technologies and security tools
  • Prior experience working on U.S. government grants and contracts a plus!
  • Willingness to travel internationally at least twice a year

The Tor Project's workforce is smart and committed. Experience working with open source communities and/or a dedication to internet freedom are added pluses. The Tor Project currently has a paid and contract staff of around 35 developers and operational support staff, plus many thousands of volunteers who contribute to our work. The ideal candidate will be energetic, unflappable and flexible, and will thrive in a highly-technical collaborative environment.

This is a full-time, hands-on position, which can be done remotely or in our office in Seattle, WA. Flexible salary, depending on experience. The Tor Project has a competitive benefits package, including a generous PTO policy; 14 paid holidays per year (including the week between Christmas and New Year's, when the office is closed); health, vision, dental, disability, and life insurance paid in full for employee; flexible work schedule; and occasional travel opportunities.

To apply, send a cover letter and your resume to hr at torproject dot org with the subject "Project Manager - Product." Tell us why you think you're the right person for this job and why you want to work at Tor Project. No phone calls please!

The Tor Project, Inc., is an equal opportunity, affirmative action employer.

The Tor Project, Inc., a 501(c)(3) nonprofit organization advancing human rights and freedoms by creating and deploying free and open source anonymity and privacy technologies, is seeking a Project Manager to help coordinate the projects of our Network, Metrics, and Anti-Censorship teams, as well as our network interference observatory team known as OONI.

The ideal candidate has experience leading an open source project. Tor is developed and maintained collaboratively through the contributions of a diverse, global community. We work hard to choose communications tools that encourage participation, where every contributor is heard and respected. The person in this job must be a team player with excellent communication skills.

Our Network Projects PM understands that inter-team collaboration makes each team stronger, and will focus on helping teams work together effectively. This person will be responsible for ensuring a productive, healthy work environment so all team members are able to contribute effectively and to the best of their abilities. All teams are distributed globally across multiple time zones, so the ability to organize and communicate via chats, email, etc., is crucial. This person will also be the link between the teams, volunteers, and sponsors (funders), and thus must have strong organizational skills and the ability to communicate in writing to diverse audiences.

You will be helping the teams roadmap, identify projects for grant proposals, manage project execution, and write progress reports to our sponsors. You are an experienced professional who is capable of building processes and best practices for the teams, regardless of the tools being used.

This position will work closely with other team leads and project managers. This position reports directly to the Executive Director.

Responsibilities:

  • Provide advice to teams where needed and point them in the right direction; help them understand what is expected of them
  • Coordinate the transfer of information to and between the teams, sponsors, and greater Tor community
  • Organize team meetings, help your teams plan their roadmaps, and show the teams how to improve their processes
  • Work with the Tor Project’s Fundraising Director and Grant Writer on grant proposals by providing them with your teams’ ideas for projects and the personnel needed for execution
  • Manage risks and issues that might occur while executing a project
  • Manage execution of roadmap and monitor the progress of your teams’ projects

Qualifications:

  • Solid knowledge of internet technologies and security tools
  • Super organized
  • Know-how to build great processes no matter what tools teams are using
  • Great facilitator
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Experience managing people
  • Knowledge of and experience with software development life-cycle process
  • Experience with Free and Open Source Software culture
  • Comfortable with transparency
  • Excellent attention to detail
  • Prior experience working on U.S. government grants and contracts a plus!
  • Willingness to travel to internationally at least twice a year

The Tor Project's workforce is smart and committed. Experience working with open source communities and/or a dedication to Internet freedom are added pluses. The Tor Project currently has a paid and contract staff of around 35 developers and operational support staff, plus many thousands of volunteers who contribute to our work. The ideal candidate will be energetic, unflappable and flexible, and will thrive in a highly-technical collaborative environment.

This is a full-time, hands-on position, which can be done remotely or in our office in Seattle, WA. Flexible salary, depending on experience. The Tor Project has a competitive benefits package, including a generous PTO policy; 14 paid holidays per year (including the week between Christmas and New Year's, when the office is closed); health, vision, dental, disability, and life insurance paid in full for employee; flexible work schedule; and occasional travel opportunities.

To apply, send a cover letter and your resume to hr at torproject dot org with the subject "Project Manager - Network." Tell us why you think you're the right person for this job and why you want to work at Tor Project. No phone calls please!

The Tor Project, Inc., is an equal opportunity, affirmative action employer.

items.title: Hands on Chief Technology Officer VP Of Engineering
items.content:
Hands on Chief Technology Officer VP Of Engineering


Natural Health Sherpa


Excited to take on the challenge of strategically leading our tech team from the comfort of your home?
Eager to join a team of high-performing, yet humble A-players that simply get things done?
Excited to be a part a rapidly growing $250 billion+ industry while measurable improving peoples lives?
If so, and youre a seasoned, marketing-oriented, strategic-thinking technology leader with lots of hands on full-stack experience, has built and led efficient development teams and has an incessant drive towards excellence, an unquenchable curiosity and a get-it-done now mentality, wed love to talk.
Weve posted this both as a CTO and VP of Engineering role as both equally describe the actual opportunity and the day-to-day authority and responsibilities. To be 100% clear, this involves both heavy hands-on coding as well as strategically building and managing our tech team.
Were really looking for a seasoned engineering leader who has made lots of mistakes, has learned from that and mastered the art of technical discipline and smart decision making.
Who We Are:
We're an 8-figure direct response company that's been profitable since day 1 of our founding in 2010. Were in the process of re-branding our company to Metabolic Living. As part of this, were launching a branded e-commerce website that more accurately reflects our full suite of products weve developed.
And to help lead us into our next stage of growth, were hiring a hands-on, strategic-thinking CTO to continue building out our small, but highly efficient tech team. We have a number of exciting projects we need a full-time CTO to lead development efforts on:
* Were porting our outdated website at www.naturalhealthsherpa.com to our modernized content and commerce platform were building at www.metabolicliving.com on Shopify.
* Were strategically integrating our in-house direct response platform that weve built over the past 8 years with Shopify so we can leverage the best of elements of each platform
* An end-to-end assessment of tools weve built internally to determine what should be migrated to SaaS and what we should continue to develop/maintain
* Developing strategy to extend our success into the mobile app world; as up until now, weve been 100 web-focused with no app, but we have a huge opportunity with our own app
* Strategically guide the companys overall tech decisions as we continue on our path towards building out a billion-dollar lifestyle brand that penetrates into the offline retail channel


We're riding the $250+ billion annual tidal wave of demand for natural health products. And were positioning our new brand to be right on top of that wave. It is an extremely exciting time for us now.
Our nutrition courses and exercise programs are designed to deliver the most results in the least time. For example, our exercise videos deliver the same or better benefits in just 15 minutes, 3 times a week than do traditional exercise programs that require 60 minutes, 5 times a week. Yes, really.
You can see an example of one of our exercise products at http://www.metabolicrenewal.com as our e-commerce happens on product-specific websites for now. All e-commerce will happen on http://www.metabolicliving.com as part of the re-branding.
We also formulate state-of-the-art nutritional supplements and functional foods that fuel your metabolism to generate the energy you need to consistently perform at your peak. For example, instead of taking weeks to notice a difference, it takes just days to feel better.
We practice what we preach: our company is designed so everyone both enjoys their work challenges while having plenty of time to do what they love to do the most in their life. We recruit only high-performing, humble people who produce in fast cycles, hold themselves accountable and have fun.

Benefits

What You'll Enjoy from Us:
* Highly Competitive Salary This respects the fact that you are a needle in a haystack, a true high-performer that any company would die to have on their team.
* Performance Bonuses Additional cash compensation based both on company as well as individual performance, allowing you to participate in the companys upside success.
* Flexible Benefits We can customize your benefits to your specific situation, rather than forcing you to accept something that may not make sense for you.
* Work-from-Home Flexibility A fantastic lifestyle that allows you to work from home, have flexible hours when needed with ability to carve out time to do what you love.
* Curated Team Peace of mind knowing we only recruit high-performing, humble people and that youll be surrounded by a supportive, high-energy team that respects you and your work.



If this sounds like a good fit, if youre excited to do something challenging and meaningful that preserves your ability to enjoy life to the fullest, then please apply ASAP as we cant wait to meet you!

See more jobs at Natural Health Sherpa

items.content:
Hands-on Chief Technology Officer / VP of Engineering -- Remote

Posted Jul 6

Natural Health Sherpa
Headquarters: Raliegh, NC
https://naturalhealthsherpa.com/
View all Natural Health Sherpa jobs →

Excited to take on the challenge of strategicallyleading our tech team from the comfort of your home?

Eager to join a team of high-performing, yethumble A-players that simply get things done?

Excited to be a part a rapidly growing $250 billion+ industry while measurableimproving people’s lives?

If so, and you’re a seasoned, marketing-oriented,strategic-thinking technology leader with lots of hands on full-stackexperience, has built and led efficient development teams… and has an incessantdrive towards excellence, an unquenchable curiosity and a get-it-done nowmentality, we’d love to talk.

We’ve posted this both as a CTO and VP ofEngineering role as both equally describe the actual opportunity and theday-to-day authority and responsibilities. To be 100% clear, this involves both heavy hands-on coding as well asstrategically building and managing our tech team.

We’re really looking for a seasonedengineering leader who has made lots of mistakes, has learned from that andmastered the art of technical discipline and smart decision making.

Who Are We?

We're an 8-figure direct response company that's been profitable since day 1 of our founding in 2010.  We’re in the process of re-branding our company to Metabolic Living.  As part of this, we’re launching a branded e-commerce website that more accurately reflects our full suite of products we’ve developed.

And to help lead us into our next stage of growth, we’re hiring a hands-on, strategic-thinking CTO to continue building out our small, but highly efficient tech team.  We have a number of exciting projects we need a full-time CTO to lead development efforts on:

  • We’re porting our outdated website at www.naturalhealthsherpa.com to our modernized content and commerce platform we’re building at www.metabolicliving.com on Shopify.
  • We’re strategically integrating our in-house direct response platform that we’ve built over the past 8 years with Shopify so we can leverage the best of elements of each platform
  • An end-to-end assessment of tools we’ve built internally to determine what should be migrated to SaaS and what we should continue to develop/maintain
  • Developing strategy to extend our success into the mobile app world; as up until now, we’ve been 100 web-focused with no app, but we have a huge opportunity with our own app
  • Strategically guide the company’s overall tech decisions as we continue on our path towards building out a billion-dollar lifestyle brand that penetrates into the offline retail channel

We're riding the $250+ billion annual tidal wave of demand for natural health products.  And we’re positioning our new brand to be right on top of that wave.  It is an extremely exciting time for us now.

Our nutrition courses and exercise programs are designed to deliver the most results in the least time. For example, our exercise videos deliver the same or better benefits in just 15 minutes, 3 times a week than do traditional exercise programs that require 60 minutes, 5 times a week. Yes, really.

You can see an example of one of our exercise products at http://www.metabolicrenewal.com as our e-commerce happens on product-specific websites for now.  All e-commerce will happen on http://www.metabolicliving.com as part of the re-branding.

We also formulate state-of-the-art nutritional supplements and functional foods that fuel your metabolism to generate the energy you need to consistently perform at your peak.  For example, instead of taking weeks to notice a difference, it takes just days to feel better.

We practice what we preach:  our company is designed so everyone both enjoys their work challenges while having plenty of time to do what they love to do the most in their life.  We recruit only high-performing, humble people who produce in fast cycles, hold themselves accountable and have fun.

Who We Need: 

We’re scouring the U.S. for a full-time, hyper-talentedCTO with in-depth, hands-on, full-stack web development experience, bothbuilding and leading highly efficient development teams.  It is a remote/work-at-home position with avery flexible work/vacation schedule as lifestyle is hugely important to our company given what we do.

This opportunity is suited only for ahigh-performing CTO-caliber developer and technology leader with an integrativemindset and proven ability to get things done cleanly and on time.  The ideal person is relishes being hands-onin all facets of web engineering from the browser to the code to the server.

As our CTO, you will optimize, support and manageour entire web infrastructure.  You willdecide what we should build vs. what we should leverage in the cloud /SaaS.  You will have full authority totake our company’s technology infrastructure to the next level.

Just as we obsess about creating healthyliving products that get the most results in the least time, we’re looking forsomeone equally obsessed about doing the same thing with beautiful, efficient code.  And with smart decisions on build vs. buy.  We really need a strong strategic thinker inthis position.

As a marketing-focused company, the highestROI on our technology investments are tied to marketing-related initiativeslike funnel development, precision analytics, split testing, paymentprocessing, etc.  To that end, the moretech resources we can focus on marketing-oriented activities, the better.

Because we run a highly efficient, small team,your hands-on technology skills are just as important as your team building andleadership skills.  Moreover, how fastyou process information, how quickly (and accurately) you can cycle throughwork and how well you work with the rest of our team is crucial.

Finally, we’re looking for someone who cancollaborate in real-time with the company’s marketing team.  This can require real-time communicationthroughout the day based on our heavy advertising spend on Facebook, Google,which can reach upwards of $100k / day. The ability to turn a business conversation into an actionable set ofdev tasks that you can jump on immediately is crucial.

What the IdealCandidate Looks Like:

  • Deep experience as an end-to-endapplication/web architect responsible for every single part of the projectincluding requirements gathering, project management, system architecture, infrastructuresetup, coding, integrating with third parties and documenting and testing.
  • Highly marketing- and revenue-focusedtechnology experience with heavy emphasis on e-commerce-related activities suchas analytics, split testing, payment processing, etc.
  • 10+ years’ experience as a softwareengineer/web developer with recent, applicable focus on database-driven webapplications on a LAMP stack.
  • Familiar with various development, testing,and DevOps processes and techniques and can provide direction to a smalltechnical team and the company on how to be efficient and nimble
  • Working knowledge with a variety ofdevelopment and process (task tracking, build automation, load testing, etc.)and can guide the introduction and improvement of processes.
  • Expertise in solution architecture, withproven experience creating strategic plans and visions for technology andexecuting on the tactical efforts to get there.
  • Expert-level, working knowledge of HTML, CSS,and JavaScript; our design team creates most of the assets, but you’ll beimplementing, optimizing, troubleshooting, and adding functionality.
  • Ability to build complex PHP applicationsquickly, efficiently, and under pressure. Our application stack runs on CodeIgniter, so working knowledge of that frameworkis a plus.
  • Just as good with SQL as you are with PHP withability to write ad-hoc queries for data extracts by hand, optimize tables with100s of millions of rows, and built new, smart database schemas.
  • Familiarity with CDNs (especially Amazon S3and CloudFront) and general web speed optimization design patterns andtechniques.
  • Solid knowledge of Linux, Apache, and generalinfrastructure/server support so you can troubleshoot and optimize as neededwith our hosting team.
  • You’re a self-starter who can take initiativeand run with the ball without having to be told what to do and you loveanalyzing seemingly intractable problems and devising creative solutions.
  • You’re a strong project manager who can scopeout technical requirements based on business needs, define deliverables, createa project plan and then execute and deliver upon that plan.
  • You’re available during normal Easternbusiness hours (8 a.m. – 5 p.m. ET) with occasional off-hour support duringcritical business events.

What You’ll BeDoing:

  • Strategically building, managing and leader ourtechnology team
  • Optimizing the feature set in our directresponse software platform (LAMP), integrating with 3rd party tools,optimizing our web infrastructure and creating workflow automation modules.
  • Designing, maintaining and enhancing internalsystems, programs and web applications, including e-commerce, marketingcampaign tracking, content management and more.
  • Building and improving existing and newanalytics and reports using MySQL, large datasets, and a custom-buildreplication and data warehouse engine.
  • Manage asset, code, and database deploymentsto managed servers and cloud servers, as well as building or finding tools toimprove and automate the deployment and testing process.
  • Proactively suggest ways to improve any systemyou work with, looking for opportunities to use technology to deliver clear,measurable value to the business.

5 Key AttributesWe Look For:

  1. QuicklyEngages – Attacks projectsimmediately, doing just the right amount of planning to avoid analysisparalysis, constantly pushing andmaintaining high intensity.
  2. TakesOwnership – Takes personalresponsibility for projects due to a deepsense of pride, going the extra mile, constantly surprising, solving problems proactively.
  3. ProducesResults – Prioritizes work based on what’smost impactful to company, while deftly cycling through tasks to produce the most meaningful results thefastest.
  4. RelentlesslyPersists – Embraces get-it-doneattitude, relentlessly attacks problems at different angles until somethingworks, staying resilient until thetask is done. 
  5. CollaboratesSmoothly – Gels well within or acrossteams, respecting others, communicating candidly, no hidden agendas, coordinating effectively so things get donefaster.

What You'll Enjoyfrom Us:

  • HighlyCompetitive Salary – This respectsthe fact that you are a needle in a haystack, a true high-performer that anycompany would die to have on their team.
  • PerformanceBonuses – Additional cashcompensation based both on company as well as individual performance, allowingyou to participate in the company’s upside success.
  • Flexible Benefits – We can customize your benefits to yourspecific situation, rather than forcing you to accept something that may notmake sense for you.
  • Work-from-HomeFlexibility – A fantasticlifestyle that allows you to work from home, have flexible hours when neededwith ability to carve out time to do what you love.
  • Curated Team – Peace of mindknowing we only recruit high-performing, humble people and that you’ll besurrounded by a supportive, high-energy team that respects you and your work.

Apply for this position

If this sounds like a good fit, if you’re excited to do something challenging and meaningful that preserves your ability to enjoy life to the fullest, then please apply ASAP as we can’t wait to meet you! Please apply via: https://naturalhealthsherpa.workable.com/j/21C819510F

items.title: Hands-on Chief Technology Officer / VP of Engineering (e-commerce) - Remote at Natural Health Sherpa (Charlotte, NC) (allows remote)
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Full-time

Remote details

Technologies

lampphpe-commerce

About Natural Health Sherpa

We, Natural Health Sherpa (http://naturalhealthsherpa.com), create innovative products that optimize people’s metabolism so they can enjoy more energy, feel great, and enjoy life. Frustratingly, the world is setup to encourage sickness vs. health, so our products are designed to make healthy living super-easy.

We're an 8-figure company that's been profitable since we were founded in 2010. We’re in a hyper-growth phase, on track to more than double in 2016. We're riding the $250+ billion annual tidal wave of demand for natural health products. It is an extremely exciting time to be doing what we are doing.

Our nutrition courses and exercise videos are designed to deliver the most results in the least time. For example, our exercise videos deliver the same or better benefits in just 15 minutes, 3 times a week than do traditional exercise programs that require 60 minutes, 5 times a week. Yes, really.

You can see an example of one of our exercise products at http://www.metabolicprime.com as our e-commerce happens on product-specific websites.

We also formulate state-of-the-art nutritional supplements and functional foods that provide the nutrients that fuel a healthy metabolism, generating the energy you need to consistently perform at your peak. For example, instead of taking weeks to notice a difference, it takes just days to feel better.

We practice what we preach: our company is designed so everyone on our team both enjoys their work challenges while having plenty of time to do what they love to do the most in their life. We recruit only high-performing, humble people who produce in fast cycles, hold themselves accountable, and have fun.

tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=8, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Executive Assistant at JDR Consulting

Remote

Job Title : Executive Assistant

Job Location : Remote

ABOUT THE OPPORTUNITY

JDR Consulting is looking for an experienced industry professional to join the CEO’s executive support staff. This individual will provide executive support in a one-on-one working relationship, reporting directly to the Chief Executive Officer. The person in this role must have a positive mindset and be energized by working with people. They must be highly organized and detail oriented. This individual must be able to work virtually and without close supervision.

The individual in this role must be creative, have a strong work ethic, enjoy helping people and working in a time sensitive environment, exercise good judgment in a variety of situations, have strong written and verbal communication, strong administrative and organizational skills, and have the ability to manage multiple tasks and priorities. This role will serve as the primary point of contact for internal and external constituencies on all matters pertaining to the office of the CEO. This role has the opportunity to be the face of the team and be a true partner with those being supported. This individual will assist with development of our outreach programming to deepen relationships with clients and other professionals. This will role will require coordinating dinners, assist with marketing events and help to boost social media presence. It will require proactive follow up including outbound calls, handwritten notes and accurately updating CRM.

ABOUT US

JDR Consulting (JDR) is a premier technology and operations consulting firm committed to improving the business and financial performance of its clients. JDR has unique qualifications in the real estate industry, serving some of the most prominent owners, investors and managers in the commercial and residential segments. JDR specializes in the implementation of leading edge technology solutions, the design and optimization of industry-specific business processes and the monitoring and reporting of a company’s business and financial performance.

JOB DESCRIPTION

The successful candidate must demonstrate remarkable abilities in communications (oral and written), time management, organization, event production and other areas related to daily operations. The candidate should have a minimum of 3+ years of successful administrative experience and unique interpersonal capabilities in order present a white-glove experience for all clients and colleagues. This individual will be responsible for all aspects of the organizations administration; coordinate special client meetings and events, produce and maintain meeting materials and data, arrange travel and process expense reports. Proficiency in Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, Outlook, and PowerPoint) is a must. Knowledge of CRM systems is essential. Sales and Marketing experience is a plus.

POSITION RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Completes a broad variety of administrative tasks including: managing an active calendar of appointments; completing expense reports; composing and preparing correspondence that is sometimes confidential; arranging complex and detailed domestic and international travel plans, itineraries, and agendas; and compiling documents for travel-related meetings.
  • Researches, prioritizes, and follows up on incoming issues and concerns addressed to the CEO, including those of a sensitive or confidential nature. Determine appropriate course of action, referral, or response.
  • Successfully complete critical aspects of deliverables with a hands-on approach, including drafting acknowledgement letters, personal correspondence, and other tasks that facilitate the CEO’s ability to lead the organization to continued profitability, growth and success.
  • Prioritizes conflicting needs; handle matters expeditiously, proactively, and follows-through on projects to successful completion, often with deadline pressures.
  • Works closely and effectively with the CEO to keep them well informed of upcoming commitments and responsibilities, following up appropriately. Acts as a barometer, having a sense for the issues taking place in the environment while keeping the CEO updated.
  • Provides leadership to build relationships crucial to the success of the organization and manages a variety of special projects for the CEO.
  • Logistical planning for multiple events, including budget tracking/reporting, liaison with vendors and venue personnel, including on site preparations.
  • Communicates directly, and on behalf of the CEO, on matters related to their initiatives including coordinating offsite meetings and travel arrangements for all attending parties.

REQUIRED SKILLS:

  • Prior experience as an Executive Administrative Assistant required (minimum 3+ years)
  • Excellent communication (both verbal and written) and ability to appropriately communicate confidential information to all levels of the organization
  • Demonstrates a high level of integrity, confidentiality and professionalism
  • Highly organized and detail oriented with ability to work independently and prioritize workload
  • High capacity for working virtually and within different time zones
  • Proactive and anticipatory with strong problem-solving skills and the ability to get things done
  • Highly proficient in MS Office (Word, Excel, Outlook, and PowerPoint
  • Ability to gain a strong command of new systems
  • Excellent organizational skills and controlling information
  • 60 wpm with basic accounting skills expected.
  • Strong knowledge of office administration practices and procedures
  • Ability to transcribe correspondence from handwritten notes or electronic media
  • High level of problem solving and decision making
  • Work is supervised on a limited basis, with discretion based on individual circumstances.
Apply for job

items.title: Full Time: Executive Vice President of Technical Product Management at Crossover in Remote
items.content:
The Executive Vice President of Technical Product Management will serve as a key member of the global executive team. We are searching for senior level people who have been in CTO positions or Chief Architect roles with people management responsibilities.

You will make important technical decisions on architecture, coach your team on how to deliver more simple technical specifications which meet the business needs, and coach your team towards continuous improvement.

You will hire, coach and manage 5-15 global Senior Vice Presidents of Technical Product Management each responsible for a critical product line.

Another critical element of this position is your ability to work closely with our F500 customer executives as well as key executives within ESW Capital.

The expectation is that you are a seasoned executive with great English communication skills that can effectively manage executive relationships.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES

Hire, manage and coach Senior Vice Presidents of Technical Product Management

Create, standardize and drive an ideation process producing market defining, technology fueled, differentiated products delivering measurable customer value

Establish, monitor and publish KPIs aligned to business priorities Ensure continuous improvement across KPIs and tie KPI changes to top and bottom line impacts

Set and maintain the quality bar for product specifications favoring simplicity and clarity and removing distractions, over-architecture, and bad design decisions

Synthesize inputs, communicate strategic direction, and validate assumptions with internal and external stakeholders

Establish feasibility with Engineering teams early in the process to avoid delays and last minute scope change

CANDIDATE REQUIREMENTS

Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science is absolutely mandatory, (M.Sc. or PhD preferred)

5+ years of recent hands-on experience defining and owning the tactical and strategic technical definition and design of software products

15+ years of hands-on technical development and architecture experience Extensive experience communicating requirements in writing and using diagrams (such as architecture diagrams, data flows, and system component diagrams)

NPI experience with startups or new/1.0 products within larger companies

items.title: Project Manager (Research Participant Acquisition)
tags: DBG:surround``OR(pacif, pst, pdt, western, california, losangel, sanfrancisco, paloalto, sanmateo) 3W OR(time,timezon)
items.content:
Project Manager (Research Participant Acquisition) at Respondent

Remote

We are an entirely distributed team and our company has been profitable since week 3. We’ve had overwhelming demand from companies like IBM, Airbnb, Uber, Microsoft and Procter & Gamble. We are building out an A class team to build a next generation market research company. We are excited to offer a Junior Project Manager (Research Participant Acquisition) position dedicated to the research participant side of our marketplace.

About the position:

We are looking for a project manager who is a driven problem-solver with a ‘get things done’ mentality and strong attention to detail. This is an opportunity for a smart, driven and energetic individual who is looking to get in on the ground floor of a fast growing startup.

This role will require you to turn manual intervention strategies we currently employ to fill studies into a science. We have a tool kit of methodologies you can use, but we will expect you to be innovative and find new ways to deliver research participants to researchers.

You should expect a high degree of autonomy in this role. We focus on and measure outcomes, not processes.

Please note, this is NOT a digital marketing role. Although there will be elements of the position that require various communication strategies, this role is much more practical, and will involve hands on project management. This include messaging people on LinkedIn, and cold calling research participants to encourage them to apply for research studies. Being organized and working with a sense of urgency is way more important than possessing skills like SEO optimization and knowing how to interpret multi-funnel ROI metrics.

Day in the life:

  • You’ll check new studies that have been posted on our marketplace – the ones that are not filling with qualified respondents need your hands on help!
  • You will segment our database of contacts and set up email campaigns that invite respondents to participate in paid market research studies
  • Your teams KPI will be filling more than 90% of all research studies posted on the Respondent platform every week – it’s a high pressure job that requires a highly productive and precise person
  • You will be expected to liaise in a clear manner with technical members of our team, who are also contributing to filling studies with qualified candidates
  • You will be prepared to cold call potential research participants and communicate research opportunities in a clear and concise manner
  • You will be working through google sheets, filtering the data and making decisions about where your effort can have the greatest impact in the shortest amount of time

Requirements:

  • Bachelor’s degree required
  • Understanding how people are recruited in marketplaces – especially professionals services marketplace – is viewed extremely favorably
  • Market Research Experience
  • Familiar with a wide range of marketing automation platforms i.e. Sendgrid and Mailchimp would be great, but not expected
  • Driven to learn how businesses are built from the ground up in a high pressure environment
  • Capable of self-directed learning and detail oriented and ability to innovate
  • Goal oriented in high pressure tactical situations
  • Excellent communication and relationship-building skills
  • Motivated self-starter who can achieve results while balancing demanding expectations
  • Ability to prioritize dynamic to do lists
  • Creativity and resourcefulness
  • Data and optimization driven mindset
  • An ability to multitask, especially when managing a diverse range of lead generation approaches
  • Comfortable presenting data on your performance and standing behind your efforts

Job Conditions:

  • $55K annual salary
  • Work remotely from anywhere, on U.S pacific time (preferred if you live on U.S pacific time)
  • A solid company culture with an upbeat motivated team
  • We are looking for someone who matches our level of joy for the work we do, fits in well with our team, and elevates our game
  • A sense of humor, a lack of ego, and a desire to do great work is essential

Respondent is an equal opportunity employer: Respondent provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, genetic information, marital status or veteran status.

Apply for job
