items.content:
Cloud Operations Customer Deployment Project Manager at Deltek Inc.

Remote

US East Coast-Remote, US HDQ-Herndon, VA, US HDQ-Remote, US Midwest-Remote, US Remote, US West Coast-Remote

4027BR

Position Responsibilities

Deltek is seeking a results-oriented, detail-driven project manager to manage Cloud Operations projects. The Customer Deployment Project Manager is responsible for coordinating and managing the cloud operations activities related to large Enterprise customer activations and go-lives and is accountable for on-time, high quality cloud operations project deliveries. This position also requires a high degree of collaboration with the leaders of technical teams and customer facing teams such as the cloud operations activation team, cloud operations infrastructure team, database system administrators, customer care, consulting and product management. The Project Manager is expected to apply project management techniques to modern cloud operations projects (e.g. agile) ensuring successful on-scope and on-time delivery. At one time, this role could be coordinating 5 – 10 customer projects in varying stages of the activation and implementation. The PM is also expected to contribute to project management and DCO implementation and customer software development best practices.

Specific Responsibilities:

  • Project Planning and Management Apply modern project management techniques to manage a project, achieving objectives of scope, quality, time and cost; organize and lead project status and working meetings; prepare progress reports; present to executive steering committee on a regular basis; Identifies, mitigates, prioritizes, manages and drives resolution of project issues, constraints, dependencies and risks. Proactively identify risk areas and critical items that need to be completed to keep project on track; manage project changes; develop relationships with key business stakeholders.
  • Team Management Hold project teams accountable for their project responsibilities and deliverables; proactively ensure that teams are “in sync” in terms of communication, schedules, issues, etc.; develop project teams by promoting empowerment, engagement and high quality deliverables; project manage teams in Europe, US and the Philippines.
  • Customer Implementation Management – Work with cloud ops team and implementation consultants to develop activation and go live schedules for the customers. Lead the cloud ops team through the creation, management and execution of the customer go-live or activation process ensuring the project is on schedule, on budget, and achieving the defined goals. Create and manage the overall cloud operations go live and maintenance schedules for assigned customers.
  • Cloud Operations Customer Issue and Service Request Management Coordinate with the cloud ops team and the implementation team to ensure that Cloud Service Requests and Issues are resolved in a timely manner and work with the teams to avoid issue escalation. Serve as a point of contact for the implementation team and liaison to the Cloud Operations team.
  • Team Leadership Support – Partner with product managers, DCO management and consulting management to plan and prioritize project deliverables and support key customer deployments. Closely work with Sr. Project Manager for the product line to coordinate and manage related projects.
  • Process Management and Improvement Champion continuous improvement and adoption of project management and software development best practices.

Qualifications

Other Key Requirements of the Successful Candidate:

  • Strong understanding of the development life cycle for enterprise software products, with knowledge of both Agile and traditional project management practices. Able to blend and right-size these practices to fit the project and business need.
  • Deltek is a fast-paced environment; the ability to multitask on different projects concurrently and react quickly to movements in the business is critical.
  • A strong communicator with the ability to pull out and summarize information, tailor communication style and content for executives, comfortable and confident presenting to executives, ability to work with remote teams.
  • Driven, proactive and a doer.
  • Have an understanding of the bigger picture. Be able to conceptualize where and how the project fits into the company’s mission. Must be able to establish project goals, validate and confirm acceptance, challenge stakeholders, and hold stakeholders accountable.
  • Enough technical insight to become a credible leader with operational teams, to facilitate resolution of technical issues, and to evaluate complex project issues and risks.
  • Able to communicate with customers to gather requirements, gather feedback during implementations and support issue resolution during deployments.

Experience:

  • At least 5 years of progressively responsible experience on large scale IT or consulting projects, preferably in a commercial software development environment or 5 years in cloud operations.
  • Proven project management in the software or IT industry using project management best practices.
  • Experience coordinating cross-functional teams
  • B.S., Computer Science, Business Administration or equivalent experience.
  • Proven experience managing projects with remote teams
  • Experience working in a PMO (desirable)
  • Experience with US Government Project Accounting (desirable)

Company Summary

Deltek is the leading global provider of enterprise software and solutions for government contractors, professional services firms and other project-based businesses. For decades, we have delivered actionable insight that empowers our customers to unlock their business potential. 22,000 organizations and millions of users in over 80 countries around the world rely on Deltek to research and identify opportunities, win new business, recruit and develop talent, optimize resources, streamline operations and deliver more profitable projects. Deltek. Know more. Do more. www.deltek.com

Apply for job

items.title: Engineering Manager, Vault (vaultproject.io)
items.content:
Engineering Manager, Vault (vaultproject.io)

Company: HashiCorp

Our Organization


At HashiCorp, we value top-notch collaboration and communication skills, both among internal teams and in how we interact with our users. We take care to balance and be responsive to the needs of our open source community as well as our enterprise level customers.

Engineering at HashiCorp is largely a remote team. While prior experience working remotely isn't required, we are looking for team members who perform well given a high level of independence and autonomy.

Our Products


We build Consul, Nomad, Vault, Terraform, Vagrant, and Packer. Alongside of that, we deploy enterprise products for each in a variety of different ways: licensed and unlicensed binaries, appliances to public cloud platforms, and hosted SaaS platforms. Our products help organizations of all sizes run any infrastructure for any application.

This Position


This is an engineering management role focused on our Vault product line, managing the Vault engineering team and overall product delivery.  Our Vault engineering team is working to provide a fantastic and broadly used secrets tool for businesses and individuals handling all sizes and types of infrastructure.  Our Vault customer base is growing rapidly and Vault is foundational for them to secure their applications.  The highly technical team also provides development support and guidance to external vendor development teams and the entire Vault community across a range of technologies.

HashiCorp views management and technical leadership as two tracks, with a highly technical background being a requirement for both. This role is uniquely technical given the nature of the product, it’s criticality in securing businesses and interaction with strategic partners and vendors.  Given this unique situation, it is expected that applicants would be comfortable playing a mix of roles. In order of priority, this would include management and coaching, advocacy for the team and with technical partners, and individual contribution.

In this role, you can expect to:

  • Support the career growth for individuals on a team building and contributing to Vault in a busy open source community
  • Work with some of the largest infrastructure providers to support strategic relationships with HashiCorp
  • Contribute to our growing engineering management team and culture
  • Hire within the US, UK, and Canada to grow your team
  • Ensure the on-time release of well tested and reliable code used to secure mission critical services
  • Manage a team of subject matter experts with unique and individual expertise in security
 
You may be a good fit for our team if you have:

  • An interest in building a support structure for engineers to help them succeed at their job
  • Models and supports a positive and healthy work life balance
  • A strong and nimble set of technical skills across technologies the team interacts with, such as commonly used security technologies
  • An interest in a management career track in a technical context
  • Great communication skills for working across the organization, capable of building strong relationships with peers and leadership
  • You have experience operating and maintaining production systems in a Linux and public cloud environment
  • You have experience managing a remote distributed team of reasonable size

In your cover letter, please describe why you're interested in working at HashiCorp, and on the Vault team in particular. 

At HashiCorp, we are committed to hiring and cultivating a diverse team. If you are on the fence about whether you would be successful working with us, please apply anyway!

How to apply:
www.hashicorp.com/jobs/1056495

tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=3, nodejs=1, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=10, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=1}
items.content:
Engineering Manager

Company: Logikcull

Why we do what we do:
Logikcull’s mission is to democratize discovery. The costs and risks associated with complex data projects like e-discovery, responding to FOIA requests, and conducting internal investigations are skyrocketing as the amount of data increases. Logikcull is transforming these tasks so they can be completed in minutes, by anyone, anywhere. As a result, our customers--modern legal teams from solo attorneys to massive law firms, Fortune 500 companies, and leading non-profit organizations -- can find and use important information quickly so they can focus on their important work, like pursuing a better democracy or saving the Earth.    

Who we are:
Logikcull.com is instant discovery for modern legal teams. Its secure, cloud-based solution helps law firms and organizations of all sizes solve the expensive, complex, and risky challenges associated with eDiscovery, internal investigations, and open records response. With Logikcull, you can start a discovery project in five seconds, from anywhere at any time on any device.

What we need:
After a year of rapid growth, we are looking to bring on a new Engineering Manager to help support our distributed engineering team while providing guidance and mentorship. During the past year, our engineering team doubled in size, we saw 5X growth in the amount of data that we process and and our customer base grew by 10X. We are looking for someone who can help us to ensure that our engineers continue to have a great experience and are able to keep delivering the same high quality code. You will also help to plan and coordinate major projects for the team, set goals, and remove obstacles along the way. We have several exciting new projects and lofty goals on our strategic roadmap and we know that the team will need additional support to get us there. You will also help recruit new team members and create a world class onboarding and ongoing employee experience for them. You will get to work cross functionally across different departments, meet with customers to learn their pain points and exemplify our values.  

What you'll be doing:

  • Conduct 1:1’s, providing mentorship and feedback of current team members, making sure they have what they need to be successful
  • Partner with Talent team to attract, retain, and grow world class talent
  • Collaborate with Design and Product teams to create a clear roadmap to clarify priorities for your engineering team
  • Monitor and communicate progress to stakeholders and make adjustments to scope as needed
  • Provide context for engineers and help them to understand the “why”
  • Assist engineers with breaking down large problems into small ones setting goals, and forming plans for how achieve them
  • Remove any obstacles for your team and maintain blocks of uninterrupted time to help them to maintain a state of flow
  • Assisting with Code Reviews on occasion
  • Collaborate and coordinate about plans with other engineering managers

What we need from you:

  • Understanding of and appreciation of servant leader model of leadership
  • Desire to practice and improve the craft of management
  • While this is not primarily a coding a position, a deep understanding and appreciation of Ruby on Rails, Javascript, and scalable web applications will go a long way towards helping you to be successful
  • 3-5 years experience working on and managing distributed teams
  • Ability to both inspire engineers and to hold them accountable for excellence
  • A love of helping customers to solve problems
  • Experience managing multiple cross-functional agile teams
Want to know more about what we do at Logikcull? Check this out!
Apply Here: jobs.lever.co/logikcull/b596472e-56bc-4ad4-9d8f-541c55bbf3dd

items.title: Program Manager
items.content:
Program Manager


Citrusbyte


Company Overview


Citrusbyte is a team of craftspeople and experts who build amazing products and believe in cultivating a high degree of leadership in all of our people. We build medium and large scale applications that solve our customers' business-critical problems. 


Job Summary


We're looking for an experienced Program Manager to join the team at Citrusbyte. It is expected that you have lived the full product lifecycle, having bought multiple programs to completion.


In this role, you will lead a program staffed with craftspeople and experts, working directly with customers to build complex custom software applications. 


Responsibilities and Duties


As a Program Manager, you are responsible for overall product guidance, vision, prioritization, planning, and stakeholder communication. You've got to be a quick study and become a domain expert in the areas required for your products: You need to know the business opportunities, competitors, customer pain points and technical details about each product. The Program Manager is also a guide. Clients look to you to chart out the approach that will get them results within their time and budget. 


You will work closely with our designers who actually do the design & wireframing but you should be able to roll up your sleeves to create and make changes to wireframes yourself.



* Strategy: Collecting research, running project kickoffs, and defining business goals 

* Consulting: Guiding clients and project teams through the right steps to get a world-class product 

* Design: Converting ideas and goals into wireframes with a UX/UI designer, often developing the first set of sketches yourself or collaboratively 

* Engineering: Overseeing the delivery of each project milestone by managing/collaborating with the project team





We are looking for smart, driven & talented people who want to work in a consultative environment, help our clients have great projects and also contribute to the growth of a great company. Tell us more about you!


Qualifications and Skills


Prior to an interview, we will want to review wireframes and product positioning that you worked on ( alone or in a team ) and we are only proceeding with candidates who have strong product sensibilities. 


Benefits and Perks



* 100% REMOTE

* TEAM RETREAT - Once a year the entire Citrusbyte team gest together at an inspiring location to meet, work and play.

* HEALTHY BODY, HEALTHY MIND - HAPPY TEAM - We offer paid vacation and support healthy lifestyles through our physical fitness benefits program.

* HEALTHCARE & FINANCE - We have comprehensive medical, dental, vision, and life insurance plans, plus we have a 401k plan.


See more jobs at Citrusbyte

  • Engineering: Overseeing the delivery of each project milestone by managing/collaborating with the project team

We are looking for smart, driven & talented people who want to work in a consultative environment, help our clients have great projects and also contribute to the growth of a great company. Tell us more about you!

Qualifications and Skills

Prior to an interview, we will want to review wireframes and product positioning that you worked on ( alone or in a team ) and we are only proceeding with candidates who have strong product sensibilities. 

Benefits and Perks

  • 100% REMOTE
  • TEAM RETREAT - Once a year the entire Citrusbyte team gest together at an inspiring location to meet, work and play.
  • HEALTHY BODY, HEALTHY MIND - HAPPY TEAM - We offer paid vacation and support healthy lifestyles through our physical fitness benefits program.
  • HEALTHCARE & FINANCE - We have comprehensive medical, dental, vision, and life insurance plans, plus we have a 401k plan.
Apply now

About Citrusbyte

Citrusbyte is a team of craftspeople and experts who build amazing products and believe in cultivating a high degree of leadership in all of our people.

items.title: Origin Protocol | Blockchain Engineer, React Engineer | SF, Boulder, Remote | https://www.originprotocol.com Origin Protocol is a blockchain project focused ...
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=2, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=24}
items.content:
Origin Protocol | Blockchain Engineer, React Engineer | SF, Boulder, Remote | https://www.originprotocol.com

Origin Protocol is a blockchain project focused on building the sharing economy without intermediaries. We're creating protocols to allow buyers and sellers of fractional usage assets and services (think Airbnb, Getaround, Fiverr, Taskrabbit) to transact without paying middlemen 20-30%. We're excited by the opportunity to promote free and transparent commerce and redistribute value to the contributors to the network instead of just the founders and VCs. We believe the open source protocols we're developing could ultimately replace dozens of existing multimillion or multibillion dollar businesses.

We're experienced founders who have built and sold multiple businesses in the past. Origin is the most ambitious idea we've tackled to date (hopefully on the right side of crazy). We currently have a working demo built on Ethereum and IPFS. We're looking for all sorts of people to join our team, whether you code in react, python or solidity. We're a distributed team, 100% open-source and open to remote.

We're backed by well-known investors like Pantera Capital, Foundation Capital, Garry Tan, Alexis Ohanian and many more. (https://medium.com/originprotocol/announcing-origin-protocol...)

You'll get the chance to work alongside engineering legends like Yu Pan who was part of the founding team of PayPal and the 1st engineer at YouTube. (https://medium.com/originprotocol/welcoming-yu-pan-to-the-or...)

Ping us at founders@originprotocol.com if you're interested, or better yet, join our public Discord group and start engaging with our distributed engineering team there (http://www.originprotocol.com/discord).

items.title: Engineering Manager
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=9, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=8}
items.content:
Engineering Manager

Company: Loom Network

We’re Loom Network, a Techstars NY ’18 startup. We build blockchain tech that makes it easy for developers to build large-scale games and social apps on Ethereum.

If you’re in the crypto space, you may have already heard of us. We’re the first Ethereum scaling solution in production (https://www.coindesk.com/ethereums-first-production-scaling-project-catch/), Vitalik has tweeted about us (https://twitter.com/VitalikButerin/status/984651585476116480), and our free code school CryptoZombies.io is the #1 Ethereum programming resource on the Internet.

About technical team here

Our technical team is largerly remote, working in Asian timezones. We have 25+ developers and several engineering managers, we are looking for someone to come in and lead a department of 12 developers and grow it.

We’re looking for someone (full-time, remote ok) who IS good at staying organized and systematizing things, who can manage our team of developers and lead our technical efforts.

Activities will include:

* Managing multiple teams of Senior Go Developers
* Setting technical direction
* Making sure our products are secure and reliable
* Continuous integration and testing are in our blood. 

About our stack:

* All our blockchain software is written in Go
* We are big fans of Vue.Js on the frontend but not religous
* Mysql and Elastic Search for traditional apps
* Everything is build on CI and continuous deployed to our staging environments
* We use Google Cloud and Kubernetes for all our non Blockchain workloads
* While not fully TDD, we do have extensive test suites for all our products

Our ideal candidate:

- We’re looking for someone who’s extremely organized, good at managing multiple people to keep them accountable, and juggling multiple priorities and make sure everything gets done.
- You should also be an experienced developer, understanding the big picture of organizing highly technical projects.
- Loves Go or can learn to love it 

Preferred experience:

- Having managed a team of multiple developers with an Agile process, while maintaining multiple releases a week.
- A background in Backend Software development 
- Experience coordinating strategy across multiple remote teams at a previous organization
- If you’re already knowledgable about Ethereum and DApp scaling, that’s a huge bonus! But not required.

Send a resume to hiring@loomx.io

items.title: Apple, Inc. | Cupertino -- Siri -- Apple’s Siri is looking for exceptional engineers, designers, and project managers well ...
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=2, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=2, ruby=0, apple=2, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Apple, Inc. | Cupertino

-- Siri -- Apple’s Siri is looking for exceptional engineers, designers, and project managers well versed in machine learning, natural language, speech recognition, server automation, and/or mobile software development. Siri is used on countless iOS, tvOS and watchOS devices and handles over a billion requests per week.

If you’re passionate about Music, Natural Language Processing, Tool UI design, or one of a variety of our open positions, you’ll be right at home. Note that we have offices in Ottawa, Canada and Cambridge, UK too!

Apply online or send a resume to brittanyd@apple.com.

-- Security Engineering -- Apple’s Security Engineering and Architecture organization is looking for talented and driven engineers to build systems that protect our customers with leading privacy and security technologies. Successful candidates will be generalists capable of working anywhere in the stack from cloud-based infrastructure services to operating system components on device.

Do you start all tasks by asking yourself “how do I automate this”? Relish wading into unfamiliar code bases? Feel at home with multiple systems programming languages? Are you determined to ensure that devices are safely working on the owner’s behalf and protecting their digital lives?

Apply online or send a resume to nectar@apple.com.

items.title: Finance Manager, Technical Services
items.content:
Finance Manager, Technical Services at Cisco

Remote
  • LOCATION: San Jose, California, US
  • ADDITIONAL LOCATION(S): Raleigh NC, Anywhere in the US
  • AREA OF INTEREST: Finance
  • JOB TYPE: Professional
  • TECHNOLOGY INTEREST: None
  • JOB ID: 1233298

WHAT YOU’LL DO

As a Technical Services Finance Manager, you will lead the FP&A activities including the monthly forecasting process, annual financial planning activities, and provide overall financial support for Technical Services regions and offers. You will be a trusted advisor to this worldwide organization.

This finance role is an excellent opportunity to financially and operationally support critical groups within the Technical Services BE and Region teams. You will be able to build relationships with key managers across all levels of business and finance organizations.

You will manage the monthly/quarterly activities including: actuals reporting, forecasting, variance analysis, and ad hoc responsibilities for regional and offer P&L’s. You will also develop and maintain strong cross-functional relationships with business partners within TS and Finance.

WHO YOU’LL WORK WITH

  • Cisco Services is an award-winning organization that supports thousands of mission-critical networks around the world every single day. Our world-class people, processes, systems and capabilities are at the core of enabling and accelerating customer success.
  • The Technical Services finance team is composed of dedicated, hardworking people who work in an empowered collaborative environment. You will be an integral part of a high profile finance team.

WHO YOU ARE

  • You are a self-driven, hardworking, dependable business partner with excellent communication skills.
  • Your ability to create complex financial models and make recommendations to senior leadership sets you apart.
  • You are open to new challenges and an ever-changing working environment.
  • You are good at establishing strong business partner relationships and working independently.
  • You are a self-starter with the ability to prioritize who is also intellectually curious with a track record of excellence.

MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS FOR THIS ROLE INCLUDE:

  • BS Degree in finance or related field
  • 5-8 years relevant corporate finance experience
  • Excellent Excel skills
  • Ability to distill complex topics into executive-level summaries

WHY CISCO

At Cisco, each person brings their unique talents to work as a team and make a difference. Yes, our technology changes the way the world works, lives, plays and learns, but our edge comes from our people.

  • We connect everything people, process, data and things and we use those connections to change our world for the better.
  • We innovate everywhere – From launching a new era of networking that adapts, learns and protects, to building Cisco Services that accelerate businesses and business results. Our technology powers entertainment, retail, healthcare, education and more from Smart Cities to your everyday devices.
  • We benefit everyone – We do all of this while striving for a culture that empowers every person to be the difference, at work and in our communities.

Colorful hair? Don’t care. Tattoos? Show off your ink. Like polka dots? That’s cool. Pop culture geek? Many of us are. Be you, with us! #WeAreCisco

Apply for job

items.title: Head of Marketing [ Europe only ]
tags: DBG:surround``OR(locat, anywher, base, resid) 7W OR(europ, european, europeanunion)
items.content:
Head of Marketing [ Europe only ]

Company: Semaphore CI

At SemaphoreCI.com we're building the next generation code delivery platform for developers and looking for our first Head of Marketing. The company is currently a ~25 person remote team distributed in 7 countries. We're bootstrapped, profitable and have a six-year track record of providing a product that customers love.

We’re looking to bring someone that has a proven track record of being part of a growing SaaS business. Someone who can spearhead strategy, hire, recruit and onboard a team, establish and scale processes, and take our marketing to the next level.

About us

Semaphore is used by thousands of tech companies across the globe, from startups to companies like Salesforce, Toyota and Uber. Our mission is to help developers move fast in their work. We do that by delivering a product that's fast and easy to use, backed by a highly rated customer service.

Our culture is built on optimizing for happiness, of our customers and ourselves. We operate on continuous improvement on a personal and collective level. When doing things, we prefer to get real and make something valuable sooner, rather than never. We treat each other and our customers with openness, respect and empathy.

You'll be responsible for:
  • Growing our team remotely and internationally
  • Expanding our brand
  • Expanding our marketing campaigns (our top market is USA)
  • Expand our marketing efforts (content / social / paid / SEO / etc)
  • Set strategy and execute marketing campaigns
  • Set up KPIs and report to the founding team
  • Work closely with Product and Customer Success team to align all teams for growth

Requirements

  • 5+ years of B2B SaaS/Startup marketing experience
  • 2+ years of Director of Marketing experience
  • Strong leadership and people management skills
  • Proven track record of scaling marketing campaigns internationally
Because of time overlap with the team, we'll consider candidates based in Europe only.

Bonus points if you have experience:

  • In developer tools industry
  • With content marketing
  • Working remotely
  • With international markets (USA, UK, Germany, Canada, Australia)

BENEFITS
  • The impact of working on a product that's competing on a global market.
  • Join a small team of around 25 full-time people who love what they do.
  • A healthy 40-hour work week, friendly and supportive work environment.
  • Competitive salary.
  • Company retreats.
  • Space to learn continuously and choose the tools and equipment for your job.
  • Paid trips to conferences and books of your choice.
  • Paid membership at a fitness club of your choice.

Semaphore is an equal opportunity employer. Consistent with our mission of serving a diverse and global audience, we value a diverse workforce and inclusive culture which reflects that. We encourage applications from all qualified individuals without regard to race, colour, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, national origin, marital status, disability, and veteran status.

items.title: IBM TRIRIGA Project Manager (REMOTE POSITION/TRAVEL REQUIRED)
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=3, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Job Description

HQ is based in Addison but we are seeking Project Managers who can travel throughout the U.S to client sites for projects. Road Warriors needed!

Roles and Responsibilities

Successful candidates will have experience managing large / medium IBM TRIRIGA projects and maintaining all aspects of Project plans including:

  • Timeline management
  • Issue Resolution and escalation
  • Communications & status reporting
  • Vendor Management
  • Risk Management
  • Stakeholder Management
  • Resource Management
  • Deliverable Management
  • Scope Management
  • Demonstrated ability to focus on several different projects while still maintaining attention to detail
  • Elicit requirements using interviews, document analysis, requirements workshops, surveys, business process descriptions, use cases, scenarios, task and workflow analyses.
  • Utilize project management skills to ensure successful software release process, including development and execution of project plans and ensuring internal organizational readiness. This requires the ability to effectively communicate (verbally and in writing) with all levels of the organization.
  • Critically evaluate information gathered from multiple sources, reconcile conflicts, decompose high-level information into details, abstract up from low-level information to a general understanding, and distinguish user requests from the underlying true needs.
  • Help translate product specifications and business processes between clients and internal technical team
  • Be the liaison between the business units, technology teams and support teams. Successfully engage in multiple initiatives simultaneously
  • Ensure that issues and action items are identified, tracked, reported on, and resolved in a timely manner
  • Support user acceptance testing processes to ensure that product requirements are fully satisfied
  • Work with internal stakeholders to execute project plans while developing best practices to facilitate high-quality software releases
  • Other duties as required

Job Qualifications

  • Experience with IBM TRIRIGA preferred however experience with other enterprise-class IWMS programs may be considered such as Manhattan, CenterStone, Archibus, eBuilder, Planon, Accruent and Lucernix
  • Experience or understanding of real estate, facilities management, maintenance and operations, capitol projects and condition assessments preferred
  • Extreme attention to detail and top organizational skills
  • Strong communication skills
  • Solid technical knowledge / aptitude
  • Experience working within IWMS products or within the Real Estate and Facilities Management industries preferred
  • Experience working as a Project Manager in a professional services organization for a growing software company
  • PMP or SCRUM Certifications a major plus
  • Preferred Experience: 2-5 years of experience with IBM Tririga
  • Preferred Education: B.S. or B.A. in a related discipline
  • Ability to travel as 30-50% required

Company DescriptionValuD, a Gold Accredited IBM Business Partner, delivers real estate, asset and facilities management solutions that solve business problems. Founded in 2009 by Gopi Latpate, an original architect of TRIRIGA, ValuD has the largest and most experienced team focused exclusively on IBM TRIRIGA and Maximo. ValuD is the 'go to' IBM partner for implementations, upgrades, training and support for TRIRIGA and Maximo. On the INC 5000 list three years in a row, ValuD has successfully completed more than 180 projects, improving real estate, asset and facilities management for companies of all sizes. The dedicated Lease Accounting practice has implemented more FASB compliance projects than any other firm in the world. With over 240 employees, the company is headquartered in Dallas, TX, with a virtual US team and an office in India.

items.title: Engineering Manager at Kyokan
items.content:
Engineering Manager at Kyokan

Company: Kyokan

Kyokan is a software engineering consultancy that builds products and infrastructure for the crypto asset industry. Founded by software engineers who have worked at Symphony Communications, Wealthfront, and Uber, we are bootstrapped and profitable. Headquartered in the San Francisco Bay Area, we're building remote-first, distributed product teams. We are laying the foundation for a robust, collaborative, friendly, and diligent product culture that will last for decades. We value dedication to craft, intrinsically motivated pursuit of mastery, and care for quality. We bring a relentless drive to deliver outsized impact to the projects we collaborate with. We believe that public blockchains will replace networks with markets, enabling a future with greater efficiency and individual agency. We are looking for exceptional software engineers and product-focused professionals to join us.

Qualifications 
- 5+ years experience building and maintaining large-scale software in production 
- 5+ years experience building and leading engineering teams 
Methodical, empathetic, and unambiguous 
- Champion controversial positions without being a jerk 
- Proactive, results-oriented, and data-driven, with a desire to make a difference at a company that aims to improve blockchain ecosystem as a whole

Responsibilities 
- Helping set and fulfill the engineering hiring plan for the team, including sourcing, screening, and interviewing 
- Represent the team in planning and product meetings, including client-facing meetings 
- Help implement effective engineering processes and policies, including 1:1s, sprint retros, and effective use of in-person retreats/meetups across a distributed team 
- Represent Kyokan, and help shape engineering culture across the blockchain industry

Skills
Software Development, Software Testing, Engineering Management, Technical Hiring
Kyokan is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, ancestry, pregnancy, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, protected veteran status, medical condition or disability, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Please send a resume to operations@kyokan.io

items.title: Head of Technology
tags: DBG:surround``OR(locat, base, resid) 3W OR(berlin, london, pari)
items.content:
JOB TYPE: Full time

LOCATION:
London, UK
(Partial remote)

Anywhere in
London

EXPERIENCE: expert

COMPANY: Candesic Ltd; 10-50 employees; 0-25% remote;

Candesic is an established healthcare consultancy with headquarters in London and branch offices in Europe. The managing partner of the firm is passionate for technology and innovation, and is keen to test new ideas and products that can revolutionise industries. Sometimes this means venturing outside of the Candesic brand and this has led him to develop several spin-out startups that were incubated at Candesic.

Currently, the Managing Partner is looking to commence development of an innovative and revolutionary product (with ‘uber’-like potential) in the realm and crossroads of communication, social media, and on-demand connection. The Head of Technology will take on technology leadership for the new product development (80% of workload), while providing technical consultancy for healthcare projects at Candesic (20% of workload).

Role Responsibilities:

- To make well informed technology choices for the new product. Including, but not limited to, software stack, architecture, environment, tools,

- Manage tech teams that may be distributed across several locations,

- Contribute to the code development in the most important and sensitive parts of product functionality,

- Provide technology consultancy and guidance for a number of projects and clients at Candesic.

Requirements:

- 7+ years of experience of managing tech teams, designing software architectures, and superb programming skills,

- Advanced soft skills: ability to coordinate team members effectively, ability to motivate people, good verbal and written communication skills,

- Proactive approach to collaboration and problem solving, both in technology and people domains. A passion for continuous improvement of the product and work processes,

- Previous experience working on similar or related products or technologies would be an advantage (multi-platform apps, voip, algorithms).

- The ideal candidate would be based in London and Candesic will sponsor a work visa for the successful applicant if required.

We’re looking to bring someone that has a proven track record of being part of a growing SaaS business. Someone who can spearhead strategy, hire, recruit and onboard a team, establish and scale processes, and take our marketing to the next level.

About us

Semaphore is used by thousands of tech companies across the globe, from startups to companies like Salesforce, Toyota and Uber. Our mission is to help developers move fast in their work. We do that by delivering a product that's fast and easy to use, backed by a highly rated customer service.

Our culture is built on optimizing for happiness, of our customers and ourselves. We operate on continuous improvement on a personal and collective level. When doing things, we prefer to get real and make something valuable sooner, rather than never. We treat each other and our customers with openness, respect and empathy.

You'll be responsible for:
  • Growing our team remotely and internationally
  • Expanding our brand
  • Expanding our marketing campaigns (our top market is USA)
  • Expand our marketing efforts (content / social / paid / SEO / etc)
  • Set strategy and execute marketing campaigns
  • Set up KPIs and report to the founding team
  • Work closely with Product and Customer Success team to align all teams for growth

Requirements

  • 5+ years of B2B SaaS/Startup marketing experience
  • 2+ years of Director of Marketing experience
  • Strong leadership and people management skills
  • Proven track record of scaling marketing campaigns internationally
Because of time overlap with the team, we'll consider candidates based in Europe only.

Bonus points if you have experience:

  • In developer tools industry
  • With content marketing
  • Working remotely
  • With international markets (USA, UK, Germany, Canada, Australia)

BENEFITS
  • The impact of working on a product that's competing on a global market.
  • Join a small team of around 25 full-time people who love what they do.
  • A healthy 40-hour work week, friendly and supportive work environment.
  • Competitive salary.
  • Company retreats.
  • Space to learn continuously and choose the tools and equipment for your job.
  • Paid trips to conferences and books of your choice.
  • Paid membership at a fitness club of your choice.

Semaphore is an equal opportunity employer. Consistent with our mission of serving a diverse and global audience, we value a diverse workforce and inclusive culture which reflects that. We encourage applications from all qualified individuals without regard to race, colour, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, national origin, marital status, disability, and veteran status.

Apply for this position

https://renderedtext.workable.com/jobs/726339/candidates/new

items.title: Partner Manager - Key Accounts
items.content:
Partner Manager - Key Accounts

Company: Zapier

Hi there!

We're looking for someone who's eager to help our largest and fastest-growing partners, like Google, Trello, Facebook, and Slack, succeed in launching and growing their Zapier integrations. If you're excited about SaaS, APIs, building win-win relationships, and automation, then read on.

We know applying for and taking on a new a job at any company requires a leap of faith. We want you to feel comfortable and excited to apply at Zapier. To help share a bit more about life at Zapier, here are a few resources in addition to the job description that can give you an inside look at what life is like at Zapier. We hope you'll take the leap of faith and apply.

About You

Meaningful relationships maximize your success.You prioritize creating, nurturing, and managing personal relationships over relying on hastily-made contacts.

You’re a marketer at heart. You are quickly able to assess a partner’s marketing assets, channels, intended audience, etc. and design a marketing plan that benefits both parties.

Writing is a skill you sharpen non-stop. From composing a short, convincing email to penning an 800-word persuasive blog post or the world’s punniest tweets, you don't stop honing your craft

You make fearless asks. You don’t hesitate to reach out to a new partner, deliver a presentation, or negotiate a win-win deal. You can navigate large organizations and zero in on the right decision-maker.

You strive to build partnerships that benefit customers and partners alike. You think about how a potential partnership will solve customers' problems with practical use cases.

API documentation is familiar territory. You're comfortable looking for and suggesting improvements to an integration based on reading through a tool's API docs.

Efficiency impacts outcomes. You consistently automate time-consuming processes to free up time for more meaningful work.

Action beats inactivity. When you're given a task, you take ownership and find an effective way to complete it, whether or not it requires dozens of Google searches.

Learning gives you satisfaction. You strive to improve your work and expand your industry and marketing knowledge

Things You Might Do
Zapier is a small, fast-growing, and remote-first company, so you'll likely get experience on many different projects across the organization. That said, here are some things you'll probably do:
  • Build and maintain relationships with Zapier’s top 100+ partners
  • Find creative ways to surface Zapier inside our partner’s products where customers would be looking for integrations/automations
  • Inject yourself into partners' upcoming roadmaps; persuade them to work with Zapier, plan and execute product launches that highlight Zapier
  • Motivate partners to participate in Zapier marketing opportunities (new feature releases, app roundups, etc.)
  • Gain understandings of partners' users and show them practical use cases for Zapier
  • Listen to partners and document their needs/requests in our feedback database
  • Coordinate with Zapier's product teams to deliver the tools your partners need and with Zapier's content teams to deliver long and short-form content that inspires their users to automate their work.
  • As part of our All Hands Support initiative, every week help customers have the best possible experience with Zapier
zapier.workable.com/j/275A6AB793

items.title: Program Manager
items.content:
Program Manager

  • PM
  • Anywhere
  • Posted June 24
  • Upwork
    • Full Time

    Overview

    Upwork is the world’s largest freelancing website. Each year $1.5 billion of work happens through Upwork, allowing businesses get more done and helping professionals break free of traditional time and place boundaries and work anytime, anywhere on projects they love. At Upwork, you’ll help build on this momentum. Together, we’ll create economic and social value on a global scale, providing a trusted online workplace for businesses to connect with extraordinary talent and work without limits.

    An Upwork Program Manager is the human layer between the Upwork platform and Upwork Enterprise clients, providing white glove service and strategic consultation for program activities.

    From consulting with hiring managers, helping to scope out projects, executing processes to build large projects, recommending Upwork talent, coordination with Talent Solutions, Upwork Compliance and reporting functions, the PM is there to make clients’ lives happier and easier by enabling them to get more done, faster. These individuals have deep knowledge of the platform, utilizing freelance resources, and are highly resourceful individuals capable of driving Upwork Enterprise matters.

    Responsibilities
    • You will lead day-to-day operational functions of the Upwork Enterprise solution, which might include working directly with clients to scope and craft projects, post jobs, evaluate talent, facilitate freelancer engagement and payment, and work with Upwork internal teams including sales, compliance and 
      • billing
    • Source talent on and make job award suggestions to drive successful outcomes for our clients
      • Upwork.com 
    • Troubleshoot and resolve basic platform issues as they relate to the best use of Upwork Enterprise
    • Work with peers and partner teams to develop solutions and deepen the value proposition of the Upwork Professionals

      • What it takes to catch our eye:
      • Validated program management, project management and/or operational expertise with an advanced knowledge of the Upwork platform
      • Experience with large program administration, including experience working with distributed teams
      • Big plus for experience at a staffing or recruiting firm

        • How to really knock our socks off:
        • An active Upwork platform account, in good standing, with a minimum of 500 billed hours, or reasonable achievement equivalent
        • A high level of business insight and enthusiastic professional communication style
        • You are a wizard working with project management and CRM systems like Asana, Salesforce, etc.
        • Did we mention that we’re looking for a people person? You are able to work cross functionally with internal teams and externally with clients.
        • You understand big clients, and have deep knowledge of Managed Services and VMS agreements
        • Strategic and creative thinking enables you to understand industry and customer trends and apply those insights to deliver business results
        • Bilingual or multilingual a plus

          • Come change how the world works.

          At Upwork you’ll help shape the future of work. From our offices in San Francisco, Mountain View and Chicago, together we’re creating exciting new opportunities for a world of professionals. You’ll be part of a vibrant culture built on shared values: Inspire a boundless future of work, Put our community first, Have a bias towards action, and Build amazing teams. Along the way you’ll have fun and enjoy the perks of a people-first company: Work from Home Wednesday’s, daily breakfast and lunch, regular in-office happy hours, top-notch benefits … and more. Check out  for a glimpse of our daily work/life balance.

          Upwork’s spotlight on The Muse

          Upwork is proudly committed to recruiting and retaining a diverse and inclusive workforce. As an Equal Opportunity Employer, we never discriminate based on race, religion, color, national origin, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical condition), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics.

items.title: Remote IT Project Manager/Product Owner (MORTGAGE/ LOS experience requ
items.content:
Remote IT Project Manager/Product Owner (MORTGAGE/ LOS experience requ - Jobmote

Remote IT Project Manager/Product Owner (MORTGAGE/ LOS experience requ

Alluvion Staffing

Alluvion Staffing is seeking a Senior PM (Mortgage Industry) for an immediate REMOTE full time direct hire role with a client based out of Pasadena, CA.

MORTGAGE INDUSTRY EXPERIENCE REQUIRED!

_ W2 ONLY! NO THIRD PARTIES _ !

Overview:

The Senior PM with work remote with 20-25% travel required. This position requires extensive experience in the mortgage industry- ideally in depth exposure to Loan Origination Software and Mortgage Pricing Engines. Looking for someone who can thrive in a "start up" mentality environment and Agile mindset. This is a client facing role so the PM must be a polished communicator that has had experience with large enterprise clients- someone with diplomacy and "can do" attitude who is comfortable in front of clients and on calls with large amounts of corporate employees

Job Purpose:

Responsible for managing all aspects of complex projects from inception to conclusion as well as for the overall administration, coordination and delivery of software projects from kickoff to production. This position reports directly to the Client Services Executive or within that organization.

Job Duties:

  • Oversees and directs the planning and implementation of multiple projects/programs across the organization.
  • Client communication and relationship development- acting as trusted advisor
  • Acts as the point of contact on assigned projects, performs a variety of highly skilled duties such as: assembling, coordinating and managing multidisciplinary technical review teams.
  • Full SDLC project management
  • Monitor, track and report project status with tools like MS Project
  • Facilitates and troubleshoots the myriad of problems associated with developing complex systems or with coordinating and development, and design projects.
  • Provides highly skilled technical and management advice and assistance to department management and personnel.
  • Responds to inquiries about projects.
  • Assists in developing departmental plans, goals, objectives, policies and procedures.
  • Coordinates schedules of staff and other interested parties.
  • Collaborates with development team in building product specifications for company software applications and features.
  • Maintains knowledge of industry trends and employment legislation and ensures organization's compliance.
  • Participates on committees and special projects and seeks additional responsibilities.

Skills/Qualifications:

  • 7-10 years SDLC Project Management experience and or product manager experience
  • Bachelors degree required
  • Experience working on technical projects within the mortgage industry required
  • Agile and Waterfall project management experience required
  • Exceptional communication- collaborating with internal and external technical and business teams at all levels
  • Proficient with Microsoft project, Jira and both waterfall and agile software development methodologies
  • Interpersonal skills to include effective verbal and written communication with staff, key leaders and other departments.
  • Demonstrated ability to work with people in an environment of urgency, demands, flexibility, and improvisation with on the spot decision making.
  • Highly developed analytical skills

Other Requirements: This position requires some degree of travel- 20-25% Candidate must have a valid driver's license and passport All prospective employees must pass a background check

  • provided by Dice SDLC, Client Engagement, LOS, Mortgage Pricing Engine, Agile

COMPANY: Indiez; 50-200 employees; 75-100% remote;

About Indiez:

Software is eating the world. Everyday there's a new dent in the universe... a new tech product that changes how things are done. However, If you look closely most of the products are not market standards and give a far worse experience than the leading once. The world need better products!
Most of the businesses struggle to build quality software. This is because hiring is costly and outsourcing to IT development shops gives you substandard quality. There's no mission driven work anywhere in most IT cos.

On the other side, There's great amount of amazing talent that is under utilized or is badly matched. Most of the talent is rotting in office while thinking about making that trip to satisfy their wanderlust. Where's freedom and fulfilment?

Indiez is a hassle free and reliable platform for businesses to get high-quality software built. We take projects and delivers them via our community of top class software talent and partner agencies. Fulfillment is guaranteed by Indiez.

We have helped brands like Uber, Domino's, Mckinsey and Company, Aditya Birla, Make my Trip and many such esteemed companies build amazing products. We’ve been featured in TechCrunch and was awarded as top 5 startups in India by TechinAsia.

Content has been the key to our growth. Our co-founder was the top writer on Medium under ‘Startup’, ‘Entrepreneurship’ and ‘Business’ category. Some our blogs have received thousands of reads and shares. Check them out here -

https://hackernoon.com/9-things-that-i-learnt-from-the-most-successful-serial-entrepreneurs-6f6680e72429

https://hackernoon.com/7-minute-read-to-save-100-000-on-your-app-idea-2d17db675a1

Interested in building software for the world while changing the way we work? Keep reading.
Check us out at www.indiez.io

Apply by filling this form - https://airtable.com/shrxZirgNaZzSY52B

You'll be responsible for:

- Defining the brand voice and tone
- Building a strong brand
- Crafting our content strategy and implementing across all our communications.
- Pitch content and marketing ideas for blogs, videos
- Creating Content - Blog Posts, Case Studies, Emails.
- Hiring and managing relevant freelancers if required.

What we're looking for?
- Belief in a world where everyone will be working form anywhere, anytime and on things that they like. #futureofowork
- Knack for writing quality content
- Proven track record of helping companies build strong brand connections by communicating well
- Knowledge of SEO and analytics
- Ambitious and can be a torch bearer of the movement.
- Bonus points if you’ve build a significant following for yourself through blogging or social media
- Ability to write content better than what we have been writing.
- Focus on Quality over Quantity

Perks:
The ability to work from wherever you want. Whether you prefer traveling and working from exotic beaches or spending time with your family and working from home, the choice is yours.
Off-sites across the world. Indonesia, Mexico, Srilanka… Anywhere.
Invitations to frequent Indiez events going on around the world, including dinners, tech talks, conferences, and more.
Extremely competitive compensation.
Chance to be a super hero!

Hiring Process
* You’ll have to fill this form first - https://airtable.com/shrxZirgNaZzSY52B

* The assignment will be a paid assignment.

* If all goes well, we’ll get going ASAP!

items.title: SmartBug Media: Creative Director at Fast-Growing Agency (Remote, 70+ Awards, Great Culture)
items.content:
Full-time

(Anywhere)

Are you looking for a creative director role that will enable you to put your stamp on a fast growing digital agency in an exploding segment of the market? Are you comfortable building scalable creative systems and teams that can deliver award-winning work in a high-growth environment? Do you consider yourself a teacher and mentor that will build a powerhouse team your team?
We are looking for a top-notch Creative Director that can leverage the 70+ awards we won last year and build on our momentum in the marketplace.
 
 
Role
 
The SmartBug Media Creative Director will lead, mentor, and develop an in-house creative team of graphic, UX, and interactive designers, copywriters, editors, and associated creative professionals. Your team will translate client business goals into compelling brand communications and campaigns across multiple formats and media channels. The Creative Director will work cross-functionally with our consulting and interactive teams to deliver award-winning work.
 
You are an imaginative, and conceptual thinker with a love of storytelling who pushes creative boundaries without sacrificing business objectives. You thrive in a fast-paced, entrepreneurial environment where your work directly impacts the creation of the brand and the performance of the business. You sweat the details in a big picture way. Fast growth and a large client roster is in your DNA.
 
You understand the concepts of inbound and content marketing and also possess a vision of how it can be integrated within broader marketing activation in order to deliver an outstanding and measurable return on marketing investment. You appreciate the necessity of creating robust processes that optimize the conception, production and delivery of outstanding creative.
 
You are inspired by how digital has transformed the marketing landscape and possess a powerful vision as to how brands can harness this change to create effective, measurable marketing performance.
 
Responsibilities:
 
  • Build, inspire and lead a talented in-house creative team to push their limits and explore new paths that create an emotional connection with our clients’ brands and drive leads for their sales teams.
  • Drive the creative process across all of our creative delivery for clients. We are looking for a powerful thinker offering a fresh perspective while working to understand and refine the approach in an iterative way.
  • Create and implement creative systems that yield award-winning work at extreme scale
  • Develop teams of content development specialists around our specialist client business sectors – Technology, Healthcare, and Professional Services.
  • Be accountable for on-time deliverables and expertly crafted copy and design that is in compliance with our clients’ key messages, style guides and standards.
  • Be a key part of the team that acquires new customers for SmartBug Media and creates deeper connections with current customers using a strategically informed creative approach, custom content, personalization and community engagement.
  • Guide the creative development and execution for brand identity, voice and messaging across all aspects of the brand experience, including all channels and media vehicles.
  • Collaborate with key stakeholders to set the strategy of how design and messaging bring the brand to life and use this strategy to guide the priorities and output of your team.
  • Own and develop the SmartBug brand with the same passion you would our clients.
  • Develop talent through internal and external training and mentor-ship.
 
Requirements:
 
  • 10+ years of brand creative experience developing and executing integrated and innovative marketing campaigns
  • Exceptional visual style with focus on typography, composition, photography, and color scheme
  • 5+ years of experience leading creative teams to drive breakthrough results
  • Art direction background preferred with expertise in concepting and producing content for multiple platform applications.
  • Strong aesthetic that will drive the development of a signature creative style for SmartBug Media
  • Creative portfolio of results-oriented work that shows a diversity of experience across both online and offline channels
  • Great business acumen, with a solid understanding of how to achieve business objectives while meeting an expected brand standard and high bar for aesthetic quality
  • Ability to work in an environment with a large number of clients
 
 
Benefits:
 
Our extensive employee benefits program includes:
 
  • Generous compensation package with performance incentives
  • Health insurance with company contribution
  • Paid maternity and paternity leave
  • Paid vacation
  • Paid time off
  • 401(k) with employer matching
  • Flexible spend plan
  • Company-funded short-term disability and life insurance
  • Long-term disability
  • Annual leadership conference, ‘SmartBugapalooza’
  • Training budget
  • Flexibility of working remote
 
About SmartBug Media: 
SmartBug Media is a 43-person strong, award-winning digital and content marketing agency that helps companies grow. We’re one of a handful of HubSpot Diamond partners in the world and the highest-rated agency in the history of the HubSpot ecosystem. SmartBug Media is also a certified Great Place to Work, Inc. 5000 company, and the winner of 36 MarCom Awards in 2017 and 32 AVA Digital Awards in 2018, among others.


Our commitment to ‘Rocking the Customer Experience’ has enabled us to both develop deep relationships with our clients and realize growth outpacing the market average. As we support our continued growth and ambitious future plans, we are looking to broaden our range of strategic and creative services and are seeking an outstanding creative visionary to serve as our Creative Director to help us innovate across content, social, digital and mobile platforms.

items.title: Morning Team: Analytics Rockstar/ Master Project Manager
items.content:
Analytics Rockstar/ Master Project Manager

Posted Jun 20

Morning Team
Headquarters: Medellin, Colombia
morningteamllc.com
View all Morning Team jobs →

This is an opportunity to join a company that has grown at a rate of 30% to 50% YoY since it was founded – operating in a space that is constantly evolving. The job is part wall street trader/numbers freak, part project manager, with a ton of initiative in between.

Responsibilities:

  • Research: you will conduct daily research to spot and inform purchasing opportunities using previous data, proprietary processes, and reports – some that you will create, and some that will be provided to you.
  • Acquisitons: you will be purchasing 6 days per week to master the fundamentals. From there, you will be expected to lead the purchasing team who will be buying based on your research.
  • Problem-Solving: you will be responsible for staying on top of trends and changes in the industry that can alter the complexity of purchasing. You will be responsible for solving problems that come up using a comprehensive, systematic methodology.
  • Analysis: you will be responsible for reviewing your own analysis on a weekly, monthly, and especially quarterly basis to improve your decisions, maximize ROI, and minimize mistakes.

  • Project Management: in addition to purchasing, you will manage various projects with members of the team – many of which will be entirely your responsibility to plan, execute, and complete with minimal supervision.

A candidate must have:

  • Flexibility to move to Medellín, Colombia for an initial training period of 4 months beginning in late 2018. After, this is a remote position.

  • Significant experience with Microsoft Excel where you have managed large, connected databases and know how to effortlessly manipulate data

  • Willingness to work 6 days per week during your initial training period under high pressure.

The ideal candidates has:

  • Process-driven experience working from SOPs and creating SOPs.

  • A robust personal organization system for managing tasks and follow-ups.

  • Strong interest in markets (previous trading experience is a plus).

  • Remote work experience and entrepreneurial experience (preferred).

  • Superstar accountability. You will be expected to act as an owner of the company.

Apply for this position

follow us at morningteamllc.com. We've got just a few questions for you, we promise you won't break a sweat.

items.title: Engagement Manager - Content Technology Projects at [A]
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Mid-Level, Lead
Role: System Administrator
Industry: IT Consulting
Company size: 11-50 people
Company type: Private

Technologies

project-managementweb-servicescontent-management-system

Job description

We are looking for an Engagement Manager can help manage and grow projects within Fortune 1000 accounts.

This is a remote role that can be done from anywhere in the United States.

What you’ll be doing:

  • Leads all development aspects of SDLC for content related client projects.
  • Understands digital marketing technology in a broad view.
  • Partners with business and technical leaders to deliver, maintain, support business solutions.
  • Ensure all development and maintenance projects are in accordance with client and [A] strategy, and adhere to project vision and product innovation roadmaps.
  • Help manage project execution, resource deployment, and overall leadership and coordination efforts to ensure projects are completed on schedule and within budget.
  • Help provide insight, oversight, strategic context, direction, and leadership to the client and the team.
  • Assist in the develop of project documentation — e.g., project initiation documentation, budget, project plan, and resource plan.
  • Help to ensure resources assigned to projects are meeting deadlines and focused on the right activities.
  • Help to identify risks early and escalate issues, risks, and decisions to appropriate stakeholders as necessary and develop mitigating actions.
  • Monitor progress and status of deliverables.
  • Help to ensure proper functioning of the deliverables and recommend upgrades as necessary.
  • Review projects for completeness of thought and consistency of approach and interface.
  • Own product releases and provide status to client and internal stakeholders; escalate issues proactively.
  • Ensure standards, procedures, and methodologies in the delivery life cycle are followed.
  • Communicate development and production status and issues to management and stakeholders.

You may be a good match for this role if you have...

  • 3 - 5 years previous experience managing Agile/Scrum projects in a client services delivery role within a technical industry.
  • Previous experience in managing the delivery of CMS enterprise applications.
  • Ability to understand and relate to the business objectives and provide a high-quality solution.
  • Ability to communicate effectively and thoroughly to both technical and non-technical audiences.
  • Must have strong analytical abilities, negotiation/presentation skills, and organizational/planning abilities.
  • Ability to drive teams to meet consensus, and have a vivid passion for applications delivery.
  • Strong project management and team management skills.
  • Experience in implementing quality guidelines, standards and procedures.
  • Creative - able to think outside the box; uses knowledge gained through prior experience, education, and training to resolve issues and remove project barriers.
  • Drive for results - maintains constant awareness of projects and clients; keeps stakeholders and product owners focused on short- and long-term milestones.
  • Ability to establish and maintain trusted, positive working relationships with clients, yet represent accurately the perspective of our firm.
  • Experience working directly with clients and providing technology, strategy, and process consultation.
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills.
  • Strong leadership skills.
  • Collaboration and decision making skills.

Cultural Fit at [A]

  • You love learning, you love teaching.
  • You are constantly growing your own knowledge, and helping to grow the knowledge of others.
  • You enjoy wearing multiple hats and roles, and titles are not important to you.
  • You do top-quality work, manage quality, and make everything you touch better.
  • You are comfortable working under strict confidentiality agreements and often behind-the-scenes.
  • You are self-organized and manage time and resources well.
  • You are able to not only work alone, but also communicate within a team by sending updates, tracking time, and other forms of communication while you work.

[A] Team Benefits

Being an [A]gent comes with its benefits. Work from anywhere. Advance your career on the leading-edge of the content and technology sciences. Earn a competitive salary, and for longtime [A]gents, participation in a profit-sharing plan. But many [A]gents find the best part of working as an [A]gent are the other [A]gents you work with and the culture at [A].

We take care of each other and we honor each other's work and contributions to the team. We work to make ourselves better and our [A] team better. We make efforts to adapt new technologies and methodologies that can help us optimize our time, and we expect you to collaborate on these efforts if you’re an expert on any of those fields. We communicate and reach out to other [A] players.  We love learning. We love teaching. We write. We code. We support each other. For the right people, working at [A] feels like coming home. 

Learn more about [A] at simplea.com.

If this sounds like you, then write up a cover letter letting [A] know why you want to work at [A], what you do best, and what inspires you.  A great cover letter will say much more than the resume (though we'd like to see that too).

Apply now

About [A]

[A] is the Content Intelligence Service.

[A] is a distributed, private, professional services firm that provides strategic support for building content intelligence practices into organizations. [A] helps complex organizations establish content engineering standards and practices to compete in a multichannel, multimodal, AI-driven world.

[A] engineers intelligent content systems for CMS/CEM platforms, and offers integration, training, workshops and custom development. [A] helps clients value content as an enterprise asset, and enables future-ready content through use of the Master Content Model.

What’s Your Name, [A]gain?

Our name is easy. Just say “A.” The [A] brackets represent markup, microdata, content intelligence. The letter “[A]” represents the start, initiation, beginning of change. We are going to help change the world with intelligent content.

Benefits

  • Remote Workforce
  • Competitive salary
  • Shared company performance incentives
  • Individual training budget
  • A well-documented career path
  • Flexible hours & personal independence
  • Other benefits based on location.
  • 401K

items.title: Executive Vice President Of Technical Product Management at Crossover
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Senior, Lead, Manager
Role: Product Manager
Industry: Computer Software, Enterprise Software, Software Consulting
Company size: 1k-5k people
Company type: Private

Technologies

javac#.net

Job description

This position is with ESW Capital or one of its affiliated companies.

WHAT YOU'LL BE DOING

The Executive Vice President of Technical Product Management will serve as a key member of the global executive team.  We are searching for senior-level people who have been in CTO positions or Chief Architect roles with people management responsibilities.

You will make important technical decisions on architecture, coach your team on how to deliver more simple technical specifications which meet the business needs, and coach your team towards continuous improvement.  You will hire, coach and manage 5-15 global Senior Vice Presidents of Technical Product Management each responsible for a critical product line.

Another critical element of this position is your ability to work closely with our F500 customer executives as well as key executives within ESW Capital.  The expectation is that you are a seasoned executive with great English communication skills that can effectively manage executive relationships.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Hire, manage and coach Senior Vice Presidents of Technical Product Management
  • Create, standardize and drive an ideation process producing market-defining, technology-fueled, differentiated products delivering measurable customer value
  • Establish, monitor and publish KPIs aligned to business priorities
  • Ensure continuous improvement across KPIs and tie KPI changes to top and bottom line impacts
  • Set and maintain the quality bar for product specifications favoring simplicity and clarity and removing distractions, over-architecture, and bad design decisions
  • Synthesize inputs, communicate strategic direction, and validate assumptions with internal and external stakeholders
  • Establish feasibility with Engineering teams early in the process to avoid delays and last minute scope change 

CANDIDATE REQUIREMENTS

  • Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science is absolutely mandatory, (M.Sc. or PhD preferred) 
  • 5+ years of recent hands-on experience defining and owning the tactical and strategic technical definition and design of software products 
  • 15+ years of hands-on technical development and architecture experience 
  • Extensive experience communicating requirements in writing and using diagrams (such as architecture diagrams, data flows, and system component diagrams) 
  • NPI experience with startups or new/1.0 products within larger companies
Apply now

Benefits

  • Work from anywhere
  • Choose your own hours
  • Flat organization
  • Work with talented people all over the world
  • Committed to diversity
  • Competitive compensation

items.content:
About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Senior, Lead, Manager
Industry: Computer Software, Enterprise Software, Software Consulting
Company size: 1k-5k people
Company type: Private

Technologies

javac++c#.net

Job description

Aurea takes an unorthodox approach to hiring in an attempt to improve the candidate experience by expediting the hiring process through an innovate online hiring tournament. Candidates will receive an offer as soon as the day of the event should they be successful.

We're running an Online Hiring Tournament on June 23rd to hire VPs of Engineering (USD $200K/yr).

This event will include all testing for the role. Upon grading the deliverables from the event, we will set up qualified candidates with an interview with the hiring manager.This is a 100% remote, full-time role.

The VP of Engineering will serve as a key member of the global executive team for Aurea or one of its affiliated sister companies and will be responsible for quarterly high-quality product delivery.

As part of the leadership team, you will be expected to run an engineering organization using a revolutionary and radically differentiated process. With a focus on small, great global teams, productivity, factory-like process, and quantifiable business impact, you will be expected to drive higher levels of value and productivity from your engineering organization than most companies would expect to achieve.

Candidate Requirements:

  • Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science (MS or PhD preferred) is absolutely mandatory.
  • 15+ years of engineering experience leading multiple teams across multiple products and technologies — this is a global leadership role for a seasoned software development leader, not a first executive role for a great software development manager
  • Experience is Software Engineering focused instead of product management
  • Proven experience in building high-performance teams and scalable best engineering practices
  • Spent 5 years in hands-on C++, Java or .NET architecture and programming in a hands-on, development-intensive individual contributor role
  • Recent experience with DevOps and Cloud architecture. We live in the Cloud.
  • Experience with high-end enterprise systems deployed in environments of Global 100 corporation complexity

We recommend that you attend the tournament instead of applying online, as our tournament process will be much faster.

Click Apply Now > Register at the green button - you will receive the webinar link after completing registration. 

Apply now

Benefits

  • Work from anywhere
  • Choose your own hours
  • Flat organization
  • Work with talented people all over the world
  • Committed to diversity
  • Competitive compensation
