items.content:
About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Mid-Level
Industry: Software Development
Company size: 11-50 people
Company type: Private

Technologies

amazon-web-servicesgokubernetesazure

Job description

  • Apply Using LinkedIn

We are looking for our first Technical Partner Manager

Your Job

You take care to further developing our existing partnerships with Amazon Web Services (AWS) and Microsoft. Your main responsibility is to drive new opportunities and business from these partnerships and ensure that our partners are always informed, aligned and happy. It’s all about communication :) To be concrete, this could be:

  • You doing briefings with partners on Giant Swarm’s Solution (discovery calls with Account Managers and Cloud Solution Architects) and organizing technical workshops. (You wouldn‘t be alone, you’d work with the Giant Swarm team!)
  • You take care of technical partner integration and solutions. If necessary, you’ll have an eye on contracts, timelines and requirements.
  • You work very closely with Sales and Marketing. You drive partners sales and partner marketing activities (e.g. at partner events) and of course, you represent Giant Swarm there.
  • You dive deep into our ecosystem and bring new partners into the network

Requirements

  • You have relevant working experience (marketing, inbound sales, communications) in a technical (StartUp) company.
  • You can explain to us why Microservices and Kubernetes are ‘changing the game.”
  • ‘Getting things done’ in an important part of your job.
  • You’re fluent in German and English.
  • You are empathic. Every partner organization has its own structures and processes. You need to get into them, to get the best out for Giant Swarm.

Why we think this position is worth applying (challenge us!)

  • Impact, Impact, Impact! We are currently an organization with 24 people (located in 13 countries) on the team and every new team member changes the team. This is great! People who know things we don’t are highly welcome.
  • “It's better to ask forgiveness than permission” (Paolini) - sure, it’s not 100% like this, but we have a strong culture of failure which is part of our agile mindset. We don’t do things written in stone. You can try things out!
  • We play a key-role in our customers digital transformation. We have partnered up with AWS and Microsoft to provide our solution on their cloud platforms - more will follow.
  • We serve some of Europe's leading organizations and are talking to many more.

We are not hiring job descriptions. We hire humans. :) We welcome applications from everybody, regardless ethnic or national origin, religion, gender identity, sexual orientation or age.



Interested? Questions? Coffee? Ask Anna. You want to apply directly, just hit https://giantswarm.breezy.hr/p/68f10effde73-partner-manager

Apply now

About Giant Swarm GmbH

WHY US?

We would like to give you a glimpse on how working with us will be like:

Self-organization

Creative work needs freedom and openness. We encourage you to do your work wherever and whenever you want. We expect passion and encourage sustainability. If you need rest, take it. We don't count holidays - we count outcome.

Teamwork 

Our ambitious goals are only achievable as a team. Everybody’s input is highly welcome and appreciated. Although sometimes rules and processes are necessary, we try to keep them as lean as possible. Always question the status quo and find new ways of collaboration and team work.

Learning

Learning is mandatory and fun at the same time. If you realize you want to expand your knowledge in a specific area, we support you with conferences, books etc.

Basics 

We offer fair (transparent and open) salaries with benefits like choosing your own laptop, jobticket, coffee flat, mate etc.. And you will participate in our stock options program. Currently our team members have more children than we are employees. So family friendliness is a must. We base our teamwork on trust and appreciation.  

Benefits

  • unlimited holidays
  • fair and transparent open salaries
  • familiy friendlyness is a must
  • jobticket
  • choose the time you want to work
  • choose the devices you want to work with
  • remote work possible

items.title: Creative Strategist - Project Coordination for nevaly (m/f)
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=1, bigdata-ml=8, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=1}
items.content:
At nevaly, it is our mission to forge memorable and authentic marketing campaigns. We work closely with our brand partners to understand their goals and identify social media influencers that match their needs. By developing and rolling out creative and unique marketing concepts we give those influencers the opportunity to endorse brands they love and at the same time raise awareness towards the brands of our clients.

We are looking for a talented Creative Strategist to guide RFP responses and influencer driven marketing activations. You will be a vital member in developing creative solutions and realising them into productions. You possess strong expertise across several areas such as content development, social media, and project management.

Success in this position will be measured by delivering high quality work and creative, “out-of-the-box” thinking, building nevaly’s creative portfolio and staying current on the latest social platforms, trends and industry practices in order to deliver actionable recommendations.


Your Role:

-Contribute towards brainstorming sessions designed toward specific outputs and client solutions

-Serve as the go-to project manager on complex productions and occasionally assist team members on their own individual projects

-Develop strategies and tactics that tie together multiple earned/owned/paid media channels with the client’s objectives

-Partner with team members to flawlessly execute client deliverables, and reports

-Demonstrate strong social media and influencer marketing understanding and the ability to effectively communicate ideas and proposals to internal team members, as well as to clients

-Be an active leader with a POV on industry, pop culture, and digital/social trends; develop internal presentations on new insights, innovations, and trend forecasting


Your Profile:

-2-3 years of experience in a creative agency, media or game company, or production house

-Highly organised with a structured approach to handling people and projects

-Strong presentation and storytelling skills

-Ability to communicate and relate with clients, creative professionals, and influencers

-A strong collaborator with flexibility and ability to provide structure in ambiguous situations, operate independently, and manage up, down and across

-Capable of building client trust and enhancing Agency/Client relationship

-Detail-oriented, flexible, and willing to work in a fast-paced, demanding client-focused environment with set deadlines

-Experience managing video or content productions including management of logistics


What do we offer?

-You become a part of a unique and fun company culture (http://nevaly.com)

-You work with a highly motivated team of top performers and gaming enthusiasts

-You will receive an unlimited contract from the beginning and get the chance to be trained in one of the most popular areas in the marketing industry at the moment: influencer marketing!

-You get free fruits, coffee, soft drinks and cereal, enjoy numerous team and company events and have the opportunity to attend German classesYou work in the start-up centre of Berlin-Mitte, the European Silicon Valley


Interested? - Submit your CV and tell us what games you like to play.

items.title: Head of Data Science
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=2, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=40, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
We're a small team of high performers who have built the leading African Mobile First Consumer Lending Business. In the most promising but also challenging market in Sub Saharan Africa, we are ranked #1 for Finance apps (and #41 overall) in Google Play in Nigeria. We are a fast growing business (5%/month) and are well funded. Our talented team is spread between Lagos, Cape Town and San Francisco. As we expand our platform to new markets (Ivory Coast, Ghana, Senegal, Egypt), we are planning to establish our senior leadership in London. We are looking for an inquisitive, creative and driven Head of Data Science to join our senior team.

You'll be working directly with our co-founders, the CPO and the VP of Engineering to build our global automated lending platform and to derive insights for the rich transaction dataset we will be generating from non-lending products. Deep experience in ML/AI. Python or R super fluent. No boring Management Information tasks Perks include: Regular travel to the fastest growing and promising region for Fintech, hardware of your choice, regular team events. Beautiful collaborative workplace within vibrant tech/fintech community.

Objectives

  • Turn the wealth of data Paylater/OneFi has gathered over the years into a clear edge over newer entrants
  • Find ways to monetise data through partnerships or other products launches
  • Partner with the Head Of Risk to develop the core AI/ML models for credit approvals and fraud prevention
  • Recruit and develop junior data scientist in Lagos

Responsibilities

  • Managing a team of 1 remote junior data scientist who will build, document and monitor most basic models
  • risk analyst to start with (responsible for portfolio monitoring and potentially for the implementation of the risk strategy with IT)
  • Setting the bad debt assumptions for the annual budget with the finance team;
  • Setting operational performance expected out of the collections team/processes

items.title: Amazowl (Treltec Ltd): Amazon / Ecommerce Project Manager
items.content:
Amazon / Ecommerce Project Manager

Posted Jun 18

Amazowl (Treltec Ltd)
Headquarters: Dublin, Ireland
https://www.amazowl.com
View all Amazowl (Treltec Ltd) jobs →

We're a fully-remote Amazon Marketing Consultancy with global clients.

We require Amazon / Ecommerce Project Managers preferably with significant experience of Amazon Vendor Central, Amazon Seller Central & AMS.

You will be responsible for:

  • Being the brand specialist for several brands on Amazon simultaneously
  • Being each brand's "champion" to ensure that their needs are being met, their sales are growing & proactively suggest next steps etc. 
  • Liaising with client brands via both email & phone
  • Coordinating our internal teams (Operations, Advertising & Marketing) to deliver on client tasks & projects

SKILLs Required:

  • Project Management
  • Team co-ordination
  • Amazon Vendor Central and/or Amazon Seller Central expertise - in lieu of this, significant ecommerce experience will be considered
  • Very good knowledge of the Amazon ecosystem
  • Comfortable briefing clients via both email & phone
  • Comfortable switching between very different clients and tasks several times per day

NOTE: We ask a LOT of questions (see below) in our application process. Why? Because we're interested in finding great team members who are seeking long-term roles where they can grow their skills & responsibility.


================================

QUESTIONS - Please answer ALL questions below in your cover letter.

================================

In which timezone do you prefer to work?

Are you available to work at least 20 hours per week during the European/American working day?

What do you like about working remotely?

What do you NOT like about working remotely?

What remote working tools have you used? (Asana, Slack etc)

If you're NOT a native English-speaker, how did you achieve Fluency in English?

Please rate your spoken English on a scale out of 10.

Please rate your written English on a scale out of 10.

Do you currently have a day job with fixed hours? If so, tell us about it.

Tell us about your last/previous day job.

What was your best experience as a contractor/freelancer?

What was your worst experience as a contractor/freelancer?

What are you great at?

What do you struggle with? What do you need to work on?

Give us an overview of your experience working with brands on Amazon?

What is your experience with Amazon Vendor Central?

What is your experience with Amazon Seller Central?

What is your experience with Amazon's Advertising platforms?

Do you have any experience in Copywriting?

Apply for this position

To jobs@amazowl.com please send:1) Your answers to ALL questions in the section ABOVE (please include the question text, before your answer)2) A link to your LinkedIn Profile

items.title: Technical Program Manager
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=2, go=0, nodejs=2, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=4, gamedev=0, php=18, embedded=0, frontend=10}
items.content:
Technical Program Manager

Company: Genetic Alliance
Leavenworth, WA, US

Genetic Alliance is a nonprofit health advocacy organization committed to engagingindividuals, families, and communities to transform health. We give people power to influencethe manner in which research is conducted and healthcare is delivered. To that end, we createtools and technologies that give communities and citizen scientists the ability to design andlead research. We believe strategic partnerships that put families in the driver seat in local,national, and international settings are critical to meet our goals.

One of our signature tools, the Platform for Engaging Everyone Responsibly (PEER), is aunique, award-winning technology platform that empowers people and families to aggregatetheir patient-reported outcomes and other health data and then make it available for healthresearch. PEER maximizes engagement by enabling people to decide when and how their datais shared. Its custom survey interface has been used by more than 45 disease advocacy andcommunity-based organizations to redefine research to be of the people and for the people.

General Position Overview:The Technical Program Manager will oversee the platform's technical and product strategy andimplementation. This includes application and system architecture, development, productionand testing, and implementing and maintaining overall engineering objectives, standards, andinitiatives.

The Manager will lead both internal and outsourced engineering teams while also being able tonavigate and assess the code base when needed. The Manager will develop and oversee arobust project management process and delivery timelines to keep projects on schedule and onbudget. This position will collaborate closely with the entire PEER team.

Primary Responsibilities:● Manage PEER development, production and testing pipeline and infrastructure● Interface with external vendors to develop new modules and features● Administer project management systems, including JIRA, ServiceDesk and GitHub● Implement continuous integration tools (Travis) and testing scripts (Selenium, Sauce Labs)● Maintain and expand system documentation● Oversee transition of the codebase to open source● Conduct code review for both new and legacy code● Collaborate with key stakeholders to refine product roadmap● Review vendor proposals, estimates and deliverables● Ensure submitted code complies with approved requirements and specifications

Qualifications:● Minimum of a bachelor’s degree in engineering or related field● 6+ years of professional engineering experience● 2+ years of management experience using agile methodologies and tools● 1+ years of experience managing remote development teams● Expert knowledge of web application design patterns● Strong knowledge of AWS, CI and deployment strategies such as Chef and CloudFormation● Strong knowledge of MySQL and ElasticSearch● Feel comfortable working daily with a codebase that is comprised of Java, PHP and JavaScript● Experience with the Angular and Laravel or similar frameworks● Comfort working with a codebase that is comprised of PHP, Java, and JavaScript preferred● Experience in a regulated industry with an understanding of HIPAA and 21 CFR 11 preferred● Familiarity with large, open-source projects preferred

Interested applicants should send a resume, cover letter, and references to: Tetyana Murza,tmurza@geneticalliance.org

items.title: Modern Tribe: Digital Project Manager
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=10, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Digital Project Manager

Posted Jun 14

Modern Tribe
Headquarters: Worldwide
https://modern-tribe.breezy.hr/p/92e9aa5f5881-digital-project-manager?source=weworkremotely
View all Modern Tribe jobs →

The Opportunity

We’re looking for a talented and experienced digital project manager in North America for future openings on our PM team. We’re a WordPress agency so hopefully you have run some projects with the platform.

If you are drawn to order like a moth to a flame, then drop us a line. If you like maintaining lists and seeing team members make progress because you set them up to succeed, then you are perfect for this gig.

If you are skilled in agile, waterfall and whatever-suits-the-project techniques, then we should talk.

To be transparent, this is NOT a Digital Producer role. We have Strategists that you will be working with as well as UX team members. This gig is about organization and management more than it is about creative input.

Responsibilities

Your primary responsibility is to shepherd the project to success. We pride ourselves on our projects arriving on time, on scope, on budget with a happy team and customer. You will create confidence through organization and oversee communication. To do this, you will need to:

  • Manage scope, timeline and budget execution
  • Manage expectations for everyone on a project including the team, the account managers, and the customer
  • Run scrums and other status meetings
  • Review team hours
  • Write SOWs
  • Review budget
  • Set up and maintain tickets in the management system
  • Manage collection of assets and information from the customer
  • Perform meeting prep, prepare agendas, and handle all follow up
  • Produce weekly and monthly summary reports

Personal Competencies

  • Strong communication and/or experience working as part of a remote team
  • Self-motivated, detail-oriented, strong organizational skills, with a methodical approach to all tasks
  • Ability to prioritize workloads and meet deadlines
  • Ability to work independently with minimal oversight
  • Fluent English speaker

Required Knowledge & Experience

  • At least 5 years of experience working as a PM, ideally on a distributed web design / dev team
  • Experience with agile and waterfall management styles
  • Experience producing large CMS powered websites
  • A whiz when it comes to online collaboration tools. You feel at home when we talk about Slack, Google Hangout, Google Docs, Dropbox or any number of online PM tools.
  • Experience managing projects with budgets of at least $100k ($250k preferred)

Additional Experience (Bonus Points)

  • Experience with WordPress
  • Technical experience as a frontend or backend developer
  • Experience with enterprise level web development projects
  • Design experience

Location

Given the nature of this role, we’re exclusively seeking applicants located in North America who have a perfect command of the English language. Please do not apply if you are not totally fluent in English or are located / work outside of traditional U.S. business hours.

Compensation

This is a freelance, contract gig (15-20 hours per week at a rate of $50-$60 USD).

Inclusion Statement

Modern Tribe is committed to a culture that embraces diversity and inclusion. We foster an environment of collaboration, open engagement, fairness and respect regardless of differences in age, race, disability, national origin, gender identity, religion, sexual orientation or veteran status. As a hybrid workspace ranging from distributed contractors to traditional employees, we value the unique perspectives and experiences of our global team.

We come from all walks of life. We are small business owners. We are tattoo aficionados and 80’s movie buffs and ex-pats. We are homeschool teachers. We are single parents. We are musicians, college drop-outs, and entrepreneurs. We are travelers, feminists, runners, volunteers, and makers. We are a Modern Tribe.

Everyday we strive to fulfill our motto: live well and do good work. We hope you will consider joining us.

Perks

We believe in learning from each other and fostering personal growth. You can expect to learn a lot while working with us and we have a benefits package for full time employees.

(Also, if you work enough with us, we’ll bring you on the team trip.

Who We Are

Modern Tribe, Inc. is a rapidly growing software & design company. We develop custom solutions for some of the world’s largest companies, government institutions and smaller growing organizations. We pride ourselves on our ability to bridge people and technology and to bring the passion and dedication of an entrepreneur to every project. Our team is composed of talented employees and freelancers around North & South America (and a smattering across the globe).

Who You Are

We love working with each other because we have built a culture that suits us well. We work primarily with freelancers and coordinate their talents for large projects. To be on our team, you must be:

  • HAPPY - Where there is a will, there is a way. Having a positive disposition allows us to achieve great things and to support each other.
  • HELPFUL - Always looking for ways that you can help others.
  • CURIOUS - It is essential that you have a passion for learning. Technology changes daily, and life has a way of constantly raising the bar.
  • ACCOUNTABLE - Our clients expect us to get the right thing done on budget and on time. Communicating expectations and meeting them is the cornerstone of success.

For this role specifically, you should feel comfortable wrangling a chaotic digital media project into an organized one. You should ask lots of questions and feel a need to. We are hoping you will not just project manage, but understand the project, the business goals and engage in the technology enough to be able to anticipate scope, budget and timeline challenges.

Apply for this position

https://modern-tribe.breezy.hr/p/92e9aa5f5881-digital-project-manager?source=weworkremotely

items.content:
Experienced Magento eCommerce Project Manager - remote

Posted Jun 14

IWD Agency
Headquarters: Baton Rouge, LA
https://iwd-agency.breezy.hr/p/523424b06606-experienced-magento-ecommerce-project-manager-remote?source=weworkremotely
View all IWD Agency jobs →

IWD Agency is a leading eCommerce agency with a fun, energetic, innovative and exciting culture. We believe in the GSD method: get shit done and this has led to us being awarded LSU’s Top 100 Fastest Growing Businesses for the past 4 years. Our focus is in online retail and we are darn good at it. We are looking for energetic, passionate people to join our team.

We are headquartered in downtown Baton Rouge, just steps away from many local restaurants, pubs, museums, the Mississippi River and many other activities. As a leader in the online retail industry, we work with many high profile clients and international brands. We believe in being passionate about our work, having fun, and delivering the best results.

Our team members enjoy great pay and benefits, a casual, relaxed work style and a friendly, collaborative environment.

While IWD's main office is located in Baton Rouge, we would be open to new hires possibly performing this job remotely.

Full-time employees enjoy benefits such as:

  • Paid Vacation
  • Paid Holidays
  • 401k Retire Plans
  • Health Insurance
  • Vision Insurance
  • Dental insurance
  • Monthly Social Events (such as 13th Gate Haunted House, Painting With a Twist, LSU Tailgates, Plantation Tours, Skyzone Trampoline Park)
Core Values

Everything we do at IWD centers around our core values. To be considered for any position, you must have the following in your DNA:

  • Innovative
  • Accountable
  • Passionate
  • Team Player
  • Perfectionist
You will be a good fit for this position if you never say "that's not my job", relentlessly optimistic, work hard, bleed your company colors, and thrive in a fast-paced environment. Oh, and you want to have a lot of fun while you're doing it!

Account Manager Role

IWD Agency is currently looking for skilled account managers that are capable of keeping up a with an innovative and fast paced agency. A strong account manager is one that can facilitate a project from kickoff, to delivery, and ultimately close the project on time and on budget.

Responsibilities include, but are not limited to the following:

Manage all technical and creative development aspects of multiple clients

  • Exhibit strong leadership to a technical team by delegating tasks and overseeing due dates.
  • Requirements gathering and business process analysis through effective communication with technology staff and business stakeholders
  • Manage the scope, schedule, cost, risk and issues of the project
  • Periodically build status reports and presentations to senior management, clients and other stakeholders
  • Overseeing work that is produced is of the highest quality and meets the agency’s and client's expectations.
  • Participating in sales meetings and proposal development
Desired Qualifications:

  • At least one year experience managing projects on the Magento Platform
  • An in-depth understanding of both technical and creative processes
  • Managing web development projects
  • Facilitating creative and technical requirements sessions with clients and vendors
  • Familiar with e-Commerce technologies such as Magento, HTML, SSLs, Credit Card Processors, PCI Compliance, data feeds, SEO, etc.
  • Exceptional communication skills and enthusiastic approach to liaising with clients and team members
  • The ability to foster close relationships with agencies, vendors, customers AND internal teams

Apply for this position

https://iwd-agency.breezy.hr/p/523424b06606-experienced-magento-ecommerce-project-manager-remote?source=weworkremotely

items.content:
About the role:

We’re looking for an enthusiastic digital project manager to join our busy operations team, leading on the delivery of digital projects. Working alongside designers, developers and content specialists, you will lead multiple digital projects, liaising internally and externally to keep things running smoothly, on time, and to budget.

You’ll be the main point of contact for clients using our digital services and you need to be comfortable with handling multiple projects and shifting priorities, remaining calm under pressure and able to think on your feet.

About the agency:

Soapbox is a creative communications agency working across a range of disciplines, including digital design and development. We specialise in working for organisations that use their knowledge and ideas to promote social, economic and environmental progress. We work with many of the world’s leading think tanks, as well as NGOs, academic institutions and intergovernmental organisations. Notable clients include Chatham House, UNICEF and the Stockholm Environment Institute.

About you:

You must be comfortable working in a fast-paced environment, handling customer enquiries, and maintaining a high level of responsiveness. We pride ourselves on customer service and this role is expected to play a key part in maintaining this, so you need to be confident in communicating with a wide range of external contacts.

You must have proven experience in managing digital projects, and a good understanding of digital processes. You should be highly organised and adaptable.

Key responsibilities:

  • Scoping, planning and costing digital projects.
  • Creating and updating project plans, communicating changes internally and externally with clients.
  • Scheduling work around studio capacity with multi-disciplinary teams.
  • Communicating regularly both with clients and colleagues, setting up meetings as required.
  • Recording key decisions and project information.
  • Monitoring project progress and identifying potential problems.
  • Ensuring your own projects are delivered on time, scope and within agreed budgets.

Person specification

Required:

  • Experience in coordinating multi-disciplinary teams to deliver products or projects.
  • Experience in completing documentation such as contracts, statements of work, briefs, cost estimates, timelines.
  • Excellent planning, time management and organisational skills.
  • Ability to work on own initiative within the parameters of the role.
  • Excellent and efficient communication skills both written and verbal.
  • Experience with project management tools (e.g. Gantt charts, Basecamp, Asana, Jira)
  • Experience of working in a client-facing role.
  • Experience and understanding of processes involved in delivering digital outputs.
  • Confidence in communicating with senior stakeholders both internally and client-side.

Desirable:

  • Undergraduate degree or equivalent.
  • Experience of working in a creative agency.
  • Experience in graphic design and/or web development.
  • Experience of delivering organisational websites built in a standard CMS such as WordPress.
  • Experience managing a website (professional or personal)

Benefits

  • 25 days holiday per year plus Christmas shutdown
  • Fruit delivery, snacks and drinks in the studio.
  • Regular (voluntary!) social activities.
  • Cycle to work and Tech loans.
  • Flexible working around core hours.
  • Childcare vouchers.

How to apply

If you’re interested, please email your CV and covering letter to jobs@soapbox.co.uk

The successful candidate must have permission to work in the UK by the start of their employment.

We're spearheading the movement that allows you to scale up your application on any cloud at any time and have fun doing it. We happen to be scaling up ourselves at a rapid rate and are looking for like-minded individuals who love the fast-paced nature of startups where you can make a huge impact in the early stages of a great idea.

We offer full benefits, 401(k), biannual team retreats in places like Austria, Morocco, and Northern California, flexible work schedule and unlimited PTO. And, of course, there's our office dog, Bumper (https://www.instagram.com/bumperdoodle/).

items.title: Executive Vice President Of Technical Product Management at Crossover
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Lead, Manager
Role: Product Manager
Industry: Computer Software, Enterprise Software, Software Consulting
Company size: 1k-5k people
Company type: Private

Technologies

javac#cloud

Job description

This position is with ESW Capital or one of its affiliated companies.

WHAT YOU'LL BE DOING

The Executive Vice President of Technical Product Management will serve as a key member of the global executive team.  We are searching for senior-level people who have been in CTO positions or Chief Architect roles with people management responsibilities.

You will make important technical decisions on architecture, coach your team on how to deliver more simple technical specifications which meet the business needs, and coach your team towards continuous improvement.  You will hire, coach and manage 5-15 global Senior Vice Presidents of Technical Product Management each responsible for a critical product line.

Another critical element of this position is your ability to work closely with our F500 customer executives as well as key executives within ESW Capital.  The expectation is that you are a seasoned executive with great English communication skills that can effectively manage executive relationships.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Hire, manage and coach Senior Vice Presidents of Technical Product Management
  • Create, standardize and drive an ideation process producing market-defining, technology-fueled, differentiated products delivering measurable customer value
  • Establish, monitor and publish KPIs aligned to business priorities
  • Ensure continuous improvement across KPIs and tie KPI changes to top and bottom line impacts
  • Set and maintain the quality bar for product specifications favoring simplicity and clarity and removing distractions, over-architecture, and bad design decisions
  • Synthesize inputs, communicate strategic direction, and validate assumptions with internal and external stakeholders
  • Establish feasibility with Engineering teams early in the process to avoid delays and last minute scope change 

CANDIDATE REQUIREMENTS

  • Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science is absolutely mandatory, (M.Sc. or PhD preferred) 
  • 5+ years of recent hands-on experience defining and owning the tactical and strategic technical definition and design of software products 
  • 15+ years of hands-on technical development and architecture experience 
  • Extensive experience communicating requirements in writing and using diagrams (such as architecture diagrams, data flows, and system component diagrams) 
  • NPI experience with startups or new/1.0 products within larger companies

Apply now

Benefits

  • Work from anywhere
  • Choose your own hours
  • Flat organization
  • Work with talented people all over the world
  • Committed to diversity
  • Competitive compensation

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Mid-Level, Senior, Lead
Role: Product Manager
Industry: Real Estate
Company size: 11-50 people
Company type: Private

Technologies

agileproject-managementscrumjira

Job description

We’re looking for an experienced Technical Project Manager – Scrum Master to oversee multiple products from initial requirements gathering through acceptance testing while facilitating adherence to an agile methodology. Specifically, the Technical Project Manager – Scrum Master will:

  • Coordinate and facilitate daily stand-ups, project planning and estimation, retrospectives, backlog grooming, release planning, stakeholder demos and other Scrum-related ceremonies. 
  • Implement and foster a lean environment where agile principles create a predictable, priority-driven culture which continuously delivers more value to customers in shorter iterations. 
  • Actively manage issues and sprints to ensure reliable delivery of sprint goals and deliverables across multiple projects and teams. 
  • Maintain desired sprint velocity and hold participants accountable for their responsibilities to ensure timely delivery of software releases. 
  • Monitor and report project KPI's including code quality, velocity, productivity, etc.
  • Own and swiftly break down impediments that prevent things from moving forward. 
  • Assist Product Owner as needed with backlog maintenance, internal and external communication, improving transparency, and disseminating information.

Qualifications:

  • 2+ years experience in a Technical Project Manager – Scrum Master role within a SaaS or enterprise software company practicing agile software development
  • Fluency in Atlassian Suite 
  • Experience managing team members in remote locations
  • Intuition to know when to challenge teams and when to get out of the way
  • Ardent desire to continually improve the agile process 
  • Thrive in a fast-paced, growing company, where scrappy solutions and rapid experiments mobilize innovation 
  • Excellent communication and collaboration skills to create, and maintain, focus on key outcomes
  • “Can do” attitude, team player, fun, energetic personality, works well under pressure
  • Genuine passion to improve the real estate industry
Apply now
Ask a question

About Jovio

Jovio is a new kind of real estate brokerage taking a transcendent approach to homeownership and real estate transactions. From streamlined brokerage services to empowering products and tools, Jovio is architecting tomorrow’s real estate marketplace.

Benefits

  • Small Team - Big Impact
  • Modern Tech Stack
  • Remote Ok
  • Flexible Hours

items.content:
About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Senior, Lead
Role: Full Stack Developer
Industry: Business Intelligence, Data & Analytics, Developer APIs
Company size: 51-200 people
Company type: Private

Technologies

c#apitypescriptamazon-web-servicesgeolocation

Job description

100% Remote: This role allows working remotely 100% of the time from anywhere in the US.  Workers must be authorized to work in the US (No Non US Applicants Please). 

Who We Need: We are looking for talented software developers to act as lead developers in a customer facing, technical project manager role.  Applicants should have a strong history as a lead software developer (no non-technical project managers, please) and should be a top notch C# and JavaScript programmer.  We are looking for sophisticated team members who are passionate about not only how UI is used, but also how the APIs, ontology, data structures, documentation, and examples come together to make both the UI components and technical APIs a pleasure for customers to use.

Typical Tasks: Typical Tasks include both writing code and leading planning activities.  You will often be acting as the lead technical point of contact on customer engagements, running internal and external planning meetings, helping to wireframe user interfaces, creating specs for the public facing APIs that drive them, doing deep dive code reviews with developers, and writing code for key portions of the deployed application.

Skills: While we hire all kinds of people and invent roles to fit them, these are the key traits we prefer for this role:

  1. Smart & High Energy Engineer - We work at a very fast pace on cutting edge hard problems and we need people who can keep up.   We need people who really love producing results for customers and who enjoy programming and exhibit the energy and creativity that comes from being fully engaged in the technical side of what we do.
  2. Strong Software Development background - This job is definitely NOT for non technical project managers. Recent, hands-on experience coding both server side (C#) and client side (JavaScript) are strongly suggested, and 5+ years work experience as a professional programmer is required.  
  3. Experience Wireframing UI & Designing APIs - You do not have to have strong artistic skills, but you should be comfortable not only spec-ing out UI wireframes but also designing the supporting technical web service API’s and/or client side component API’s.
  4. Technical Project Management:  You should be highly organized with a strong history in either technical project management or as the lead developer for complex software development projects.  
  5. Customer Facing: comfortable meeting with sophisticated customers and managing expectations on large high value projects.
Apply now
Ask a question

About MapLarge

MapLarge provides Big Data Analytics and Visualization to make the world safer, more productive, and more efficient.  The MapLarge API provides real time geospatial and predictive analytics for over 15 billion location events per day and trillions of historical events. Analysts using our geospatial visualization capability can instantly query and visualize data on any desktop, mobile or tablet device.  All of our UI components are re-usable, data driven, event driven, API powered (client and server side), scriptable, re-configurable, savable, deep linkable, shareable etc.  We also have editor components, and data visualization wizards that allow non-technical users to import, automatically visualize data patterns (with sensible defaults that “just work”), conduct predictive analysis and also re-configure more advanced detailed settings with “what you see is what you get” editor tools.

Benefits

  • Flexible Hours
  • No Commute (work from home 100%)
  • Technically Excellent A+ Team solving very hard interesting problems
  • Friendly People - Postitive attitude is our #1 criteria
  • 401k
  • We like all kinds of people
  • Family Friendly
  • Top Notch Health Care
  • Cutting Edge Tech

items.title: Engineering Manager at Toptal
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=10, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Manager
Role: Full Stack Developer, Backend Developer
Industry: Human Resources, Recruiting
Company size: 1k-5k people
Company type: VC Funded

Technologies

ruby-on-railsrubyamazon-web-servicesjenkinsgo

Job description

As an Engineering Manager at Toptal, you will help us scale for our continued growth as a game-changing, industry-defining company shaping the future of work. You will lead and work across multiple engineering teams to improve workflow and delivery while driving engineering excellence and ensuring teams are delivering high-value results.

This is a remote position that can be done from anywhere.

Responsibilities:

You will be a technical and people steward for the teams you lead and manage. You will act as a mini-CTO within Toptal and report directly to the VP of Engineering. You will drive impact through the relationships you develop and the goals you deliver on. You will be constantly looking for ways to improve our products, workflow, technology stack, and to grow and develop the people under your management. You will provide hands-on guidance and excel with Ruby on Rails. You will work in an entirely distributed company and help define an entirely new space, while learning about how an organization scales on a hyper-growth trajectory.

In the first week you will:

  • Join our bootcamp team and begin your introduction into Toptal.
  • Get familiar with our product portfolio and team structure.
  • Review our extensive Toptal Engineering Documentation to become familiar with our working processes.

In the first month you will:

  • Transition from our bootcamp team and begin working with your first teams at Toptal.
  • Attend regular meetings. Examples include a weekly Engineering Manager call and the once a month Engineering All-hands meeting.

In the first three months you will:

  • Be leading three to four engineering teams.
  • Be working hands-on with these development teams.
  • Understand the teams’ impediments and begin improving them.
  • Be involved in team planning meetings and retrospectives.
  • Ensure the product roadmap is well thought out and feasible for each team.
  • Create regular feedback loops and be in constant daily communication with your teams.
  • Make sure that every team is properly staffed and supported.
  • Ensure that individuals are energized and motivated by their work.
  • Oversee and drive the implementation of engineering best practices.

In the first six months you will:

  • Drive engineering excellence and ensure teams are delivering high-quality results.
  • Be involved in architectural conversations and give suggestions on improving code quality.
  • Continue to increase the potential and performance of the teams.
  • Collaborate on personal career paths and goals for everyone on the teams.
  • Engage in interviewing for Toptal and hire exceptional people.

In the first year you will:

  • Continue to identify and eliminate team distractions.
  • Conduct performance and salary reviews.
  • Continue to grow, develop, and manage the teams while identifying future leaders within Toptal.
  • Drive consensus and results across teams.
  • Help guide and direct the technical and product strategy.

Requirements:

  • Previous experience managing multiple engineering teams.
  • Web development of large-scale applications.
  • Track record of delivering successful products as an engineer and a team lead.
  • Provide hands-on guidance. Post-technical doesn’t apply to you.
  • Experience guiding continuous improvement of process and technology.
  • Ownership. You take responsibility for the success of the engineering teams.
  • Quality. You take pride in everything you deliver as a reflection of yourself.
  • You must be highly detail-oriented.
  • Ability to take smart risks and champion new ideas.
  • You must have excellent written and oral communication skills.
  • Ability to communicate clearly and constantly with teams via Slack and other collaboration tools.
  • You must be a world-class individual contributor to thrive at Toptal. You will not be here just to tell other people what to do.
Apply now

About Toptal

Toptal is a network of the world’s top 3% of software engineering, design, and finance talent – available on demand to help companies accelerate, adapt, and scale. With $100+ million in annual revenue and triple-digit growth, Toptal is the largest fully distributed workforce in the world.

We take the best elements of virtual teams and combine them with a support structure that encourages innovation, social interaction, and fun [see this video from The Huffington Post]. We see no borders, move at a fast pace, and are never afraid to break the mold.

If you’re not in the job market, you’re exactly the type of person we’re looking for.

Benefits

  • Remote
  • Competitive Compensation
  • Unlimited Vacation Days
  • No Mandatory Hours
  • Mentorship
  • Travel Any Time, Anywhere
  • No Office Politics

items.title: Student Loan Hero: Head of Product Development
tags: DBG:surround``remot 3N OR(options, avail, allow) NOT encourag
items.content:
Head of Product Development

Posted Jun 12

Student Loan Hero
Headquarters: Austin, TX
https://grnh.se/918697ce1
View all Student Loan Hero jobs →

What does the Head of Product Development do?

The Head of Product Development is responsible for leading our organization in product strategy and execution. The ideal candidate is an entrepreneurial product leader with a track record of driving revenue growth through user-centric product development and optimization.

Our goal at Student Loan Hero is to help consumers make better, well-informed decisions about their finances through our digital tools and experiences. The Head of Product Development plays a key role, driving end-to-end product development that starts with a deep understanding of what consumers need in order to launch comprehensive products that deliver great customer experiences and align with the overall growth strategy of the business.

This role is both strategic and operational. It requires someone with an ability to not only craft a product vision and advocate the importance of a good design process, but also understand how to build and lead the team, roadmap and processes needed to execute on that strategy.

The day-to-day:

  • Lead and drive the vision of Student Loan Hero’s website and products
  • Build, lead, and coach a talented team of product managers, designers and researchers
  • Support product teams in identifying user research, usability testing, and A/B testing priorities that align with the overall strategy
  • Collaborate with leadership team and business unit leaders across the organization to align the product team’s strategy with the company’s overall strategy, and collaborate across the organization to execute on that strategy.
  • Work closely with Product Managers to ensure that they prioritize product ideas and align them with the roadmaps, conversation initiatives, and the overall growth strategy of the company.
  • Work with team to develop and groom the product backlog on a weekly, monthly, and quarterly basis.
  • Work with user research and design to ensure a quality user experience across all products
  • Drive conversion of audience coming to the site through funnel optimization
  • Lead on-time delivery of new features and products with a focus on impactful results
  • Support marketing team with acquisition efforts
  • Other duties as assigned.

Job Requirements:

  • Legal authorization to work in the U.S. without sponsorship is required.
  • Must have a Bachelor’s degree.
  • Must have a minimum of 7 years of related experience.
  • Experience leading and scaling product teams of 10 or more is required, experience leading and scaling remote product teams is preferred.
  • Must be technically savvy with a solid understanding of engineering processes that allows you to work cross-functionally to drive a product vision that aligns with the company’s Engineering team.
  • Must understand the value of, and can successfully work with, user research and design to ensure a quality user experience.
  • Experience with agile software development practices is preferred.
  • Experience with JIRA is preferred.
  • Experience with Sketch, InVision, and Zeplin is preferred.
  • Coaching and management skills/certification is preferred.
  • Deep understanding of data analysis, web analytics and SEO best practices is preferred.
  • Understanding of AARRR startup metrics model is preferred.
  • Experience in the finance or FinTech space (preferred)
  • Experience in working remotely (preferred)
  • Availability to travel up to one week per quarter for work-related activities and events (required)

    Apply for this position

    Complete the online application form: https://grnh.se/918697ce1

Visit nttdataservices.com to learn more. NTT DATA, Inc. (the "Company") is an equal opportunity employer and makes employment decisions on the basis of merit and business needs. The Company will consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religious creed, citizenship, national origin, ancestry, age, sex, sexual orientation, genetic information, physical or mental disability, veteran or marital status, or any other class protected by law. Role Responsibilities: * Seeking senior ServiceNow Cloud Innovation ITSM leader experienced and knowledgeable with service and business processes, service management, systems integration and architecture * To manage the ServiceNow platform and competency which include creative solutions development, process analysis, configuration and BI/reporting areas * Work with business stake holders and business partners to ensure that requirements are met and deliverables are made in a timely fashion * Provide road map and strategy around SN to align with Business and Corporate needs * Able to play a big part as an Architect and design solutions around ServiceNow * Provide road map and strategy around SN to align with Business and Corporate needs Preferred Skills: * Strong ServiceNow Background including Multitenant and domain separated instances * Modules include - ITSM, HRSM, Facilities, ITOM * Extensive global experience managing professionals across multiple regions * Work with business stake holders and business partners to ensure that requirements are met and deliverables are made in a timely fashion * Able to play a big part as an Architect and design solutions around ServiceNow * Strong understanding of the following Modules: ITSM, HRSM, Facilities, ITOM * Knowledge of NTT Data environment and processes. * Strong experience as a Service Manager Basic Required Qualifications: * 3+ years ServiceNow experience specifically * 5+ years background in Service Management or Delivery roles * 8+ years experience in being a Team Lead, Architect, Technical Manager,and/or Technical Delivery Manager * Able to manage and work with a global team. late night/ early morning calls and meetings required This position is only available to those interested in direct staff employment opportunities with NTT DATA, Inc. or its subsidiaries. items.title: Account Manager - Fresh Dairy (Home Based) - DSM Food Specialties - Home Based
items.content:
Account Manager - Fresh Dairy (Home Based)
DSM Food Specialties -Home Based
DSM – Bright Science. Brighter Living.™
Royal DSM is a global science-based company active in health, nutrition and materials. By connecting its unique competences in life sciences and materials sciences DSM is driving economic prosperity, environmental progress and social advances to create sustainable value for all stakeholders simultaneously. DSM delivers innovative solutions that nourish, protect and improve performance in global markets such as food and dietary supplements, personal care, feed, medical devices, automotive, paints, electrical and electronics, life protection, alternative energy and bio-based materials. DSM and its associated companies deliver annual net sales of about €10 billion with approximately 25,000 employees. The company is listed on Euronext Amsterdam. More information can be found at www.dsm.com.

DSM Food Specialties is a leading global supplier of food enzymes, cultures, taste and health ingredients and other specialties for the many of the leading global and local dairy, baking, beverages and savory food brands. Our advanced ingredients help our customers to differentiate their products with great taste, texture and appearance and optimize their production processes by reducing raw material usage, waste, emissions and energy need. Over 400 of our scientist are committed each day to find new science-based innovations, building on more than a hundred years’ experience in enzyme and fermentation technology. Our people are driven by optimism – a belief that through innovations in food technology, solutions are possible and actionable and many of our customers involve us closely in their product development and production process to help them solve challenges by combining the possibilities of science with our dedication and application knowledge.
Home Based Position - Perfer candidate to be based in the Midwest or South East, TN or TX but not required.
Travel Requirements: 60-80%
The Challenge
As an Account Manager in Fresh Dairy you will be a key player in driving our Fresh Dairy results in USA with both local, regional and global key accounts. You will report directly to the Regional Sales Manager Fresh Dairy NAFTA.
Key Responsibilities:
  • In this role you will have a thorough understanding of DSM’s cultures and enzymes range for the dairy industry from a commercial point of view and having a technical understanding of the portfolio, the market and the industry is also key.
  • Support sales through commercial planning and strategy as well as supporting technical advice, training and customer trials.
  • Externally orientated and keen to develop new applications for our cultures and enzymes in line with customer requirements.
  • Contribute to the innovation process with your industry insights and expertise and you are continually assisting the development of our application knowledge into dairy processes.
  • Able to provide technical / application presentations to all accounts, including global key accounts. Your main target area is fresh dairy products (sour cream, yogurt, cottage cheese, kefir, etc.).

Knowledge and Skill Requirements:
  • Undergraduate or Graduate degree in dairy/food science or business-related field or Biological Sciences and have an interest in biotechnology.
  • Strong technical background and working familiarity with the use of Cultures and Enzymes in and in depth knowledge of the dairy industry and preferably have practical experience with dairy ingredients.
  • Minimum 5 years of related experience in sales or marketing.
  • Willingness to travel 60-80%.
  • Preferably have regional experience and a proven sales track record in the dairy industry with dairy products.
  • Enjoy working with customers and have the ability to communicate at all levels and can tailor complex technical and commercial information into clear messages for all commercial audiences, sympathetic for their needs and technical understanding, while being equally home in a scientific setting.
  • Fluent in English language.

The Reward
DSM's wide diversity of disciplines makes it possible to offer employees a wide variety of roles throughout their career. For instance, you may start your career in an area related to your education or qualifications, but your future is what you make of it. At DSM we stimulate people to determine their own career path and we encourage international careers. We strive to be an Employer of Choice and ensure that our employees are nurtured and given the opportunity to develop their talents. To learn more about DSM's HR vision and policy, please visit our website at www.dsm.com/career.

Royal DSM is an equal employment opportunity and affirmative action employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, protected veteran status, status as a qualified individual with a disability, or any other characteristic protected by law.
Interested in this position? Please apply on-line by sending us your resume and cover letter via the career portal (www.dsm.com/careers).
Reference check procedures are part of the DSM Recruitment & Selection Process. You will be contacted when these references checks are required.

items.title: Customer Happiness Executive, Weekends
items.content:
We're looking for a candidate to join our customer service team working a minimum of 16 hours over Saturday and Sunday, but with the opportunity to expand to more hours if required. The role is primarily home-based, but there will be some compulsory training based in Canary Wharf at the beginning of the role and at various times throughout your employment.

YourParkingSpace, recently named as one of the UK’s fastest growing companies by Leap 100, is looking for an enthusiastic and driven Customer Happiness Executive with a passion for the sharing economy to join our rapidly growing tech start-up company and drive our customer experience. We are aiming to transform the parking industry by providing a platform that enables motorists to find and book parking online. We’re fast-growing and looking for someone to join us in our Canary Wharf office to assist us in our constant growth.

As a Customer Happiness Executive, it is your responsibility to ensure that every customer leaves with a positive impression of YourParkingSpace.

Whether a customer has contacted us with a general query or a complaint you will need to be fast-acting, stay calm under pressure, and remain positive throughout the interaction to ensure an exceptional customer experience is provided.

It’s necessary to expect the unexpected as unanticipated issues occur, you will need to be a keen problem-solver in order to handle any difficult situations which may arise.

You will play a crucial role within the team so as a remote operator you will need to be highly motivated, driven and passionate about the role. As a start-up we are still growing and learning as a company, therefore it is important to have the confidence to notify us of any recurring issues so that we can work to resolve these on mass to provide a better experience for all users.

The Role

- Acting as the first point of contact for most customers
- Communicating with users and potential users to give advice and answer any queries, in addition to resolving any complaints, often through thorough investigation.
- Providing prompt responses, within set service level agreements, using our customer support software, Zendesk
- Driving sales by negotiating terms with users of the site
- Achieving monthly sales targets as part of a team effort

The Right Person

- Experience in a customer-facing role
- Able to communicate to an excellent standard both written and verbally
- Exceptional computer skills
- Keen attention to detail
- Focused with the ability to self-motivate

Job Title: Business Development Manager

The Goat Agency are the leading Influencer Marketing Agency in the UK and are currently expanding globally. We are looking for talented Business Development Managers to join us.

This is an ideal role for a self starter with excellent sales experience and entrepreneurial flair! We have some impressive clients we already work with such as Apple Music, UEFA, Formula E and New Look. We also have a fantastic culture with a collaborative environment where everyone pitches in and has the chance to excel.

Your responsibilities will include:

* Generating business leads
* Pitching proposals to clients

CoStartup & Go is a ‘one stop shop’ flexible support for startups.

All the services that a startup needs under one roof in affordable project or monthly hours from business set up, creative design, digital marketing, social media through to PA/ VA /support & Project management.

All powered by a group of handpicked freelancers.

With exciting new collaborations and our successful New York launch we are now looking to recruit several top notch Project Managers / Virtual Assistants at the top of their game.

Note: This is a project management role, not an admin role (no emails or diary etc) And we are looking for operations ‘doers’ not consultants.

This work would suit someone with a strong background working in startups looking to work more flexibly while being part of a new and exciting startup growing globally.

You will need to meet the following criteria:

- Minimum of 2 years office manager or operations experience

- Personal Assistant or Executive experience a must minimum 3 years

- Experience working remotely

- Strong Project Management skills (able to run with projects from start to finish)

- Smart, switched on and extremely tech savvy

- Be able to manage multiple clients and demands easily

- MUST BE LONDON BASED

- Open to meeting with clients if required (London)

If interested please apply along with your CV!
